Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My silver Chair rental&#39;s
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skirt Steak YUM!!

JAGS-1lpLAphlt_roysoIA.text: Going to Border Grill is not just going out to brunch/lunch/dinner, it's an experience! My friends & I sat on their lovely patio for brunch for the 2nd time & it keeps getting better & better. Hands down, no Las Vegas brunch can match the quality & price you get at Border Grill. We also had the pleasure of meeting "The Two Hot Tamales," it's great to see a celebrity chef owned restaurant with chefs actively involved in their own restaurant & not just a famous name attached to it! Even the executive chef Mike came out to our table just to make sure we were enjoying everything. I can't wait to go back for brunch, next time I'll try the unlimited mimosas they offer, the table next to us had them & those mimosas looked so refreshing! Thanks for another great dining experience!

yG5-bXC92JOLyQMePRPV2w.text: We recently visited this restaurant for the first time.  We had been working a trade show and were pretty hungry when we arrived.  Their chips and salsa were yummy and we ordered some guac which was tasty as well.  We ordered a poblano quesadilla and Border classics appetizer to share (2 corn tamales, 2 plantain empanadas, and 2 chicken panudos). We weren't sure what to get, so the Border Classics was recommended.    The quesadilla was pretty good, but the cheese was a bit rich. The corn tamales were my favorite.  I love this type of corn filling, being from the South (where it is sometimes called fried corn).  The plantain empanadas were soggy and bland, so we did not finish those.  We are 99% vegetarian but were hungry so we each tasted the chicken panudos.....the chicken tasted boiled and very bland, so we did not eat more than the one bite and I wished that I had not tasted it at all.  The worst part of the experience was that everything was pretty darned expensive.  We went during a very busy time, yet the service was still pretty good and everyone we encountered was pleasant.  They kept the beer coming, and we had a good time overall, so I might give it another go when I'm back out that way.

ru4SBUbfOQ5ORma06sLVwg.text: I ate at this restaurant three times because it was close to the conference center in the Mandalay Bay and was good at avoiding an allergen (milk). I loved the homemade green salsa that was heavy on lime, and I liked the chicken burrito, pork tacos, and shrimp salad entrees I had. I also liked the outdoor seating by the pool. The pomegranate limeade was weak.  The food was more nouveau Southwest than True Mexican, but still good.

ubSEqcPxPp8qyyITTyFq8A.text: It was what we can agree when there is a group of people and everyone had different tastes.   PROS Steak quesadilla and chilliquiles. Listening to live music from the concert going on at the beach. Outdoor Seating and people watching.  CONS It is overpriced, though I did return on a different visit for the steak quesedilla.

2VjCjsk2Jd5vB7sW4AfFmg.text: was there with Vegas rover they ran out of food and there endless  mimosas and champagne. i will not be going back there.

nRxmN0941_eh2J6PzaMWyw.text: I had a salad from the Top Chef Masters when I was there and it was YUMMY! Worth checking out when you go. And to top off the experience when I was there Rick Moonen, Mary Sue Milliken and Susan Feniger were seating at the next table. AWESOME!

8DHnNRMq7oq2J5AfLC54AQ.text: Wow.....my wife ordered the wagu tacos which were perfect. She loved them. I ordered the chicken mole. By far the best Mexican dish i have had at a restaurant. I also had the raspberry Chipotle margarita. So freakin good.

RVzvSRj98Le95GV68bgCAA.text: 03/17/12 BRUNCH.  I haven't reviewed BGLV before this? I'm surprised. We went almost every Wed night that Mary Sue was competing in "Top Chef Masters" last year. Sat in the bar with other fans, ate/drank for 1-2 hours, it was great fun. Great staff, bartenders, waitresses.  We, spouse and I, are ANCIENT foodies, and have known the "2 Hot Tamales", Mary Sue and Susan, since they started off in a storefront and only using hot plates, along Melrose Blvd back in the early 80s in LA. I experienced all of their iterations in the culinary world, most especially City Restaurant. I miss City. And Ciudad. I love Street, and try to return there when I can, when visiting LA.  But you know what is the best thing about THIS Border Grill, the Las Vegas location? The man they have in charge at the stoves, Executive Chef Mike Minor. Every time we dine there, his dishes are simply wonderful.  Well, last year they introduced Brunch at BGLV. We thought it really good, but needing a few changes. Even Mike, who is in charge of the Brunch dishes, admitted that we visited too early, and should return later in the year. Well, the Brunch is only from March until October. We missed his changes. (If we had tons of money, we would have returned, and quite often.)  Well, THIS time around, today, it was a very different menu, and EVERY DISH was astounding. I split dishes with my spouse, and we tried as many as possible, but couldn't get thru half the menu, still going home feeling like pythons after consuming an antelope. But MAN, what we ate!  I don't even need to mention the dishes. EVERY DISH was just sublime. (But the shrimp and grits, those I could eat all day long.) And the $5 bottomless mimosas were great, too, with a huge selection of variations, with things like blood orange juice, pomegranate, etc.  So try the Brunch. You will NOT be disappointed. It's normally $29.99 pp, but as BG LV VIP card holders we got a one-time half-off offer thru the email, ending Mar 25. Look into that, if you are a local Nevadan. But believe me, even without a discount, we WILL return this year, especially if we have friends visiting LV to introduce to this Brunch.

UOUjULiSOAivoFyIMnFSJQ.text: Met a college buddy today for lunch at the bar! He ordered the shrimp tacos, I did the fish. We then traded each other one.  This fish was moist, topped with a nice slaw and creamy guacamole.  The shrimp, a bit spicy but tasty. They too had a nice slaw topping.  Both were served with black beans, a cilantro rice and spanish rice. Both rices were very flavorful.  Speaking of flavor, the trio of sauces and chips they serve you before hand are delicious. The green sauce... I could drink by the gallon!  Service was great and quick...  Definitely a place to reccommend to friends who are staying at Mandalay Bay.  For locals, its not the easiet place to get into...

7SKjjnyV2iFcnhl6NddxLw.text: Bottomless mimosas and endless tapas brunch was amazing. Funky food and kick butt servers! Rachel in particular was super friendly and knowledgeable! We literally wanted to stay all day. I am not kidding about bottomless and endless food and drink...amazing deal for 45 dollars!!

w9qQaCHhJzVNp2gfL-chaw.text: Excellent meal from start to finish. The coconut mojito and orange margarita were great. Enjoyed the appetizer platter, entree, and dessert which were all flavorful and delicious!  Also the guacamole is made fresh to order at the ceviche bar.  I would highly recommend this restaurant if your in the mood for Latin food / Mexican

Ibj0p-nDqucBf59piEe8eA.text: Best meal I had in Vegas. Come for brunch, please: ALL YOU CAN EAT TAPAS ($30) with UNLIMITED MIMOSAS ($5 -- TOTAL, NOT EACH). I couldn't believe what a great deal it was. And on top of that, my friend had a Restaurant.com giftcard to make the deal even sweeter. I'm trying to remember which tapas I had (Oh, the tapas are larger than any tapas I've ever had, so don't think they were pussy little blobs of food on a plate. No way, miss). Hmmm... Yeah, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, even your food memories, apparently. But trust me, all of the savory dishes were amazing, as were the chocolate chip pancakes (which I do mysteriously remember). I intend to visit Vegas again (when I'm not a student and have time and money to spend excessively), and if this place is still around, I'm so there again.

-vAtzEJpTPMYtg4M9juY-g.text: Came here for dinner since we were staying in the resort. Ordered the skirt steak nachos & a mojito. I did not care for the nachos but my daughter who wanted them thought they were fine. The Mexican cheeses were not good. Tasted rotten, even though it wasn't! The chips/salsa are quite good. Chips are very fresh. Tomatillo salsa is very refreshing. The mojito was fine. I prob won't eat here again.

ZyT9vwJbmtrBpa6mkBa5IQ.text: Love this place! I ordered the chicken enchiladas on a recent trip and then went back and got them again later in the trip..the green sauce is so good! Their chips, salsas, and margaritas are all very good and the bartenders will mix you up something special if you sit at the bar and tell them what you like. A very good spot hidden by the convention center in Mandalay.

VvYbEjZTzq6a7Y_88BGIPw.text: You cannot foo-foo up Mexican food and have it taste like real Mexican food.  How bout cheddar cheese on my chicken nachos instead of feta cheese.  Who eats crumbly cheese instead of melted cheese on nachos!?  I know for rich people, it either has to look like crap or taste like crap to be fashionable, but when I heard this was a really good Mexican food restaurant, that's what I expected.  They did nail the high end price though, $90 for 2 nasty dishes and $7 for a Corona.  If you want good Mexican food, don't go here, even Taco Bell would be better.  However the benefit is you are inside Mandalay Bay, so go play Blackjack after you throw up and you can win your money back that you wasted on this dump.

8-2fIzGMaTq8TLSwQuwTgQ.text: Border Grill is located in Mandalay Bay, just down the hall from the wedding chapel.  When I visited, my friends wanted to sit outside on the patio.  One plus is the patio outside is completely covered.  It's almost like a room with just the one wall to the outside missing.  So you get the breeze and the fresh air, but still feel like you're slightly indoors.  Also, the patio overlooks a pool with a stage and you can enjoy whatever live music may be playing.  Another plus is their menu has a lot of different and interesting items from which to choose.  I ordered chicken panuchos, which is black bean stuffed tortillas with chicken.  I've never seen black beans stuffed into the middle of a tortilla before, so that gave it a nice twist.  But unfortunately, the chicken was very dry.  I had to add A LOT of salsa to give it some moistness.     A couple of negatives.  The restaurant has this weird policy that they bring you their special filtered water and pour your glasses, and if they refill your glasses - then they charge you extra.  It's stated on their menu, but the problem I have is - why even bring the water without asking if the table wants it?  And the waiter didn't fill one of the glasses full, and although the person never touched the water - he filled it up to the top when he returned.  This meant we would have been charged, when he never even filled it all the way to begin with!  Sneaky?  You be the judge.  The other negative is, there is no restroom on site.  You have to go somewhere downstairs, which is a little ways to walk.  Instead, I went down the hall to the wedding chapel.  If you don't make eye contact with the receptionist, you can go in and the restroom is right there at the entrance :)

79wpzHbJQ3bHVqtBP0KX2A.text: Man, still as good as I remember.  I can't add much to the other accolades, but, holy cow!  I had the special entree, beef cheek sopes, which was fantastic!  Not really a sopapilla, but more of an open-face pulled-beef sandwich with coleslaw garnish, vaguely Korean, which made me think that kimchi would have made this even better.  My only gripe is that they err on the side of mild rather than spicy, but I'm not sure you'll care.

kqCqzX2wGtLdUgW2g8XfxQ.text: I felt so proud to share the Border Grill with my husband. I was a manager for them in 2003-2005 and even though the layout of the second floor has changed the delicious creations in the kitchen have not.  We started off with the queso/ chorizo appetizer. It was so scrumptious that it was gone before we knew it. I had the pina coloda with toasted coconut. Wow what a drink. I love the chicken quesadilla, something I crave! You can not beat the fresh hand made tortillas of Border Grill. We also shared the Border Grill Classics. I wanted my husband to taste the well balanced flavors of the empanada and the sweet corn tamale. They were just as if  had tasted them in the years of my employment.  Thank you Border Grill Mary and Susan. I loved working for you and your flavorful fare did not disappoint and impressed that of my beloved.

cqxpJNVLKNXYJGrSL0Vswg.text: We had brunch there today and tried the all you can eats tapas. Everything was fresh with great flavor. We ate almost the whole brunch menu and left full and happy. We love Border Grill and frequent it in LA. One of my top 5 restaurants of all time.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-zP0CmsISCiRMiTmnNhfSQ.text: Sat/Sun Brunch is definitely worth it - $35.  Unlimited Mimosas, great tapas...this isn't a buffet - they are brining you fresh tapas from the kitchen - just pick the things you would like or do what I did - just tell them to steadily bring you things and this beautiful selection of breakfast oriented tapas just keeps coming.  My favorites by far:  the Chilaquiles and the Shrimp and Grits - excellent.  Also love the oyster rockefeller, the fruit cup, and the salmon slider. Sat downstairs by the pool - outside - great people watching because you can see Mandaly's "Lazy River"...take your time - I spent 2 hours just casually eating, drinking mimosas, writing.  Also - excellent service - some of the best I have seen in Las Vegas

S-vl06vw5SwgoWc4iBAQIA.text: If you want to treat yourself to authentic, creative, and just plain yummy Mexican food, it's GOTTA be Border Grill! Brought to life by the Two Hot Tamales and their amazing Chef Mike, Border Grill has something for every mexican food lover. My favorites are the Beef Brisket Taquitos, the Yucatan Pork (carnitas, black beans and grits, OH MY!) and the Tres Leches cake for desert.   If you're a Margarita lover like me, treat yourself to a Cadillac Margarita that is topped with Grand Marnier with lots of extra salt, on the rocks.   I can't say enough about this restaurant. The ambience is killer. The staff is attentive. The ingredients are fresh. It's just the best all around. As a native Southern Californian, this has my LA girl seal of approval for Mexican!

Bkuh7ftfI0gygZ7_VLcjRA.text: Had a great dinner out on the patio last night. The three salsas were wonderful, so much so I plan on making them at home.  The ceviche sampler was delicious as was the chicken mole.  Wine by the glass generously poured and service very professional.

PW3fb9Q8AkbiEbtUES7kdA.text: I made a reservation for Saturday night at 5:15 for a party of 5.  When we showed up for our reservation the server informed us that our reservation was "1st Available" and that the patio was the only option available at the time.  We tried to sit at the patio, but it was unbearably hot, and we were forced to leave and take our business to another restaurant.  I think Border Grill should warn patrons making reservations that the may be forced to eat on the sweltering patio.  Also we observed multiple "walk-in" groups being seating indoors ahead of our reservation (probably at our "reserved" table).  I cannot speak to the food at this restaurant, but the service was unacceptable.  Take your money to the many other competitors in the area where they value their customers.

EM7Qh418QgmNoVInlggamw.text: Margaritas... chips... guacamole, what more can a girl want out of life? We arrived around 7pm on a Sunday night sans-reservation. There was a 30-minute wait, so we grabbed a seat at the bar for some drinks & guacamole. I started with the Blanco margarita and the boy had a Cadillac. I really liked the Blanco, it was crisp and refreshing, everything a margarita should be. The guacamole here was great, it had a heavy lime flavor & wasn't overly spicy, read: very Karen C. friendly.  For dinner, I went with the Fish Tacos Ensenada, and they were delicious! I skipped the beans, and they instead served them with 3 different kinds of rice... all were so flavorful. The boy had the Sauteed Shrimp, which I admit to stealing a decent amount of because it was SO good! The sauce was so flavorful and seasoned perfectly. The only complaint is that the red rice on both of our plates was a little too salty, but other than that, it was great. It definitely isn't crazy authentic Mexican, but that's not what I was looking for, so I'm down with that.   I like the ambiance here, and would have liked to have been sat outside, but there was a huge birthday party so that was a no-go. Very random, but I love the glassware they use. Overall, I'm very glad we checked this place out!

mDww0zXVjDtGTCtgxfDtFQ.text: Ate here 1.29.13  Best dinner the whole week we worked in Las Vegas! Had a booth at the Mandalay Bay convention center right around the corner from this place.    Seriously so good! :o Everything is fresh, fresh, fresh! Service is extremely attentive, friendly, and prompt. Chips and salsa are super tasty plus they give you a variety of 3 different types of salsa.    I ordered the chile renello, by far the BEST chili renello I've EVER HAD! Sorry mom :/ I also got their seasonal mojito with lemon and blueberries! Yamaaah!    My husband got the skirt steak, he said the "cut was premium, flavor was amazing, and was cooked to perfection!"   He also loved his blood orange jalapeno margarita, which he said," was a welcomed distraction from the average margarita!" ;)    We will be back for sure next yr!

g1zJZSzp43c97MtCwgYoLw.text: i love chef susan feniger...i love watching her on top chef masters...and i love that she is a strong lesbian in high ranking in the culinary world.  we need more of you chef feniger!!!    this was our last foodie stop on our trip before we headed out to the airport...and my oh my, we weren't disappointed with our experience.  we were 45 minutes late for our reservation.  we called to let them know but instead of having a cow, they sat us right away when we got there, with a smile...stating that she was saving a table for us.  woowee...and i thought we were going to get yelled at.  haha.   anyhoo, if you want water, they charge you 50 cents each person.  they don't serve tap water here...so don't be surprised when you see that extra charge on your check!   so we started off with the ceviche duo..wifey and i were split on that dish.  i loved the orange habanero ceviche while she liked the baja ceviche better.  both were extremely refreshing and hit the palate like WOW.  oh!  wifey also ordered a watermelon lemonade...DELISH!!!    for our entrees, wifey had the mexicana breakfast off the brunch menu...and i had the grilled skirt steak and eggs...also off the brunch menu.  these items go for 19.99 and include a side of fruit and pastries.  both of our dishes were cooked PERFECTLY...so freakin perfectly that even the eggs were delicious!  and seriously, how often do you hear people say that their eggs are delicious?  the tortilla that came with my dish was definitely homemade...the best tortilla i have ever had!    BUT...the best item i had at border grill today...was the GUAVA CREAM EMPANADA.  yes!  you heard me right...fresh out of the oven...they were apparently a little behind on pastries so this item came out towards the end of our meal. (btw, the service was just average...but good enough to not dock any stars)  saved the best for last right?  everything about it was perfect...the flakiness...the creaminess of the hmm...cream?  and the flavor...omg...the guava just took over my taste buds!  i've never had anything like it before...and sadly, i must go all the way back to vegas to have it again...sigh.  wonderful...everything was just wonderful...i can't compare border grill to any other mexican place i've eaten at...it's just some serious gourmet mexican food that is untouchable...i can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. guava cream empanada...AMAZING!!!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fruit during brunch

PeJFZ5Am1kbnMa6b0BMaTg.text: Best food we had in Vegas! I ordered the shrimp tacos and my bf ordered the chicken poblano enchiladas, and they were both delicious! My bf won lunch with the enchiladas - the sauce that came on them was beautiful and tasty. Not to mention, the margarita we ordered was on point. The endless brunch items looked yummy as they passed by too, but I would definitely recommend trying the normal menu items! The prices weren't outrageous either - two meals and two giant margaritas (as in the equivalent of 3 regular margaritas each) came in just under $100. Oh, and the chips and salsa were awesome too!

2vMitqrbMnJJIUYKzV7itg.text: Came here for dinner just before attending a concert at the Mandalay Beach, and it was a pretty disappointing dinner.  We had made a reservation ahead of time knowing it would be busy given Memorial day and of course the concert, but alas we still had to wait over 20 mins to be seated... I was so HANGRY!  The hostess' up front were very scattered and overall the restaurant just seemed poorly run.  Our server, however, was very friendly and had great customer service...told us the kitchen was backed-up and apologized by getting us little corn tamales. We ordered a gaucamole and chips, and the guac was very good. Their chips and salsa are also quite good.   Food was otherwise very subpar, but I believe this is secondary to how busy and chaotic the restaurant was. I've heard their brunch is fantastic, so maybe I'll try that next time, but the dinner was very mediocre. I had an order of the fish tacos, and they literally killed the fish - overcooked, dry and flavorless. Same thing with the green rice, which was so dry I kept taking gulps of water in between bites. I couldn't even save the rice with salsa/guac.   Would definitely not come back for dinner....Strip prices and bad food? no thanks! But like I said, the brunch looks amazinggggg...

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn tamale
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super dry fish tacos

aJv-E3KXWruaawOtHWfZmg.text: Best brunch in Las Vegas!! I came here once with my boyfriend and then physically dragged my family to Las Vegas and into this restaurant.  $35 all you can eat brunch tapas, $10 for bottomless mimosas. The food list is extensive and everything is made fresh so you can customize to your dietary preferences. There is a rotating selection of mimosas and there were at least 7 choices each time.    Both times, my waiters asked me a few questions about what I liked and then brought out extra dishes that I hadn't ordered that they thought I would like -- spoiler alert, everything is great.  I loved how friendly and knowledgeable the staff was and how they went out of their way to make it a great meal. They also bring out little pastries before your meal that are flaky, tender perfection.    One downside, the bathrooms are far down the hall or down a flight of stairs. If you have mobility issues, that's something to consider before taking advantage of bottomless mimosas.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sounds weird. Tastes incredible
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Chile relleno-- vegetarian and amazing!

bgCXYk2SYu-1e1vvY5RSQA.text: All I can say is Wow!  This place Rocks!  The food was amazing.  I was craving Mexican food so I stopped in and promptly seated for dinner.  I was also craving a frozen margarita but wanted something different so I asked my server if they could do a strawberry and she recommended adding a swirl of Mango....Genius!  It was the Best margarita I've every had.  Also ordered the brisket taquitos, Mexican corn, Guacamole...So Good.  Highly recommend this place.

ifHey15EZyyeeiR7nZbQRQ.text: I have been thinking about the plantain empanadas for a full week since I visited! So tasty.  We had the guacamole with tortilla chips, plantain empanadas, short rib enchiladas, chicken poblano enchiladas, and the flourless chocolate cake with almond ice cream.   Since we were staying at the Delano hotel attached to Mandalay Bay, I wanted to visit this spot then found a deal on travelzoo which also included 2 drinks. We got margaritas which although not overly sweet, I thought the size was small and that they tasted weak. We sat on the covered patio on a 110 degree day, so I appreciated that they brought a carafe of water for the table, as well as bringing refills.   Our waitress/waiter shared service of the patio and were both super friendly. I appreciated that the menu is very clear about GF labeling. We also saw the owner (who was on Top Chef Masters tv show) greeting a table, then later we saw her in the lobby of the hotel and she was super nice.

-L9WSo2-UwZIAT4Mr_XzDA.text: First, shout out to Eduardo for great service and recommendations!  We came for brunch on saturday, seated outside on the patio next to Mandalay Beach. Got the menu and immediately started picking through the list:  Eggs Benedict-great eggs, touch undercooked, fairly burnt bread underneath, but excellent hollandaise. Still a 3/5.  Breakfast fries-holy shit. Steak and fries with an egg cracked on top. Delicious, filling, and messy. 5/5.  Steak and egg-pretty standard preparation, but excellent nonetheless. 5/5  Pigs in a croissant-Holy. Shit. Amazing. The manchengo cheese sauce over chorizo sausage was out of this world, the croissant pastry light and fluffy. 7/5  Double up on the pig in croissant-it was that good. Oj was excellent, coffee great as well. We had several other small plate dishes, but those were the standouts. Glad we ate here and I'll definitely be back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benny, ate the rest too fast to get a picture!

wFqKX_ctsLprd3oJ8AdlHw.text: Amazing. Did not disappoint. Everything we had was awesome: pork tacos with pineapples, pork sandwich with guacamole, beans, and cheese, pineapple margaritas, and chips with trio salsa. I would hightly recommend.

M_EurcA2Kld501uvbL-07w.text: Went back to Vegas on Thanksgiving and stopped by Border Grill again and it was delicious.  I ordered the same thing (the brisket taquitos) and they were delicious.  We also ordered the charred broccolini again which was so good.  My boyfriend ordered the baja ceviche tostada which he really liked.  And our waitress Tara who was so nice, helpful and attentive gave us a free grilled corn appetizer that was really good.  We will definitely be going back on our next Vegas trip.

CGQ-CeUL6IdVdvbm7OzySQ.text: The quality of the ingredients really shines here. From the complimentary chips and dip, to the main courses. The tortillas are made beautifully and everything tastes fresh.

LemCa_o3McpkHci65MZ1aw.text: Glad I came here. Excellent service from Tatiana... Food is good too! Great atmosphere, we sat outside on this cool 79 degree day.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fish tacos &#34;da bomb&#34;

7OfGvIaLcpoYOvGEPP4VZw.text: This was my first time at this restaurant and I was very impressed. This location is inside Mandalay Bay, near the convention center. I came here for brunch with a few friends and they have an unlimited small plates menu for only $35. You can add unlimited mimosas too for $10. Of course, I did the unlimited small plates and mimosas.  I pretty much tried every item on the menu and everything was really good. My favorties were the waffles, breakfast fries, and pigs in a blanket. You might has well order everything off of the menu because it's unlimited! The food comes out as it's made.   The mimosas were really food. They were definitely heavy handed with the champagne. They have a ton of different flavors and seasonal flavors. They have blood orange (my favorite), passion fruit, prickly pear, mango, pomegranate and more! Some of them lacked flavor and just tasted like champagne, but hey, it's unlimited so who cares!   I stayed here for about 3 hours with my friends just eating and drinking. This is now probably one of my favorite brunch spots!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited mimosas! Pomegranate, mango, and Apple ginger

0XFdcdWWRlOu5lJapG-4lw.text: Great lunch today; service and food were spot on perfect!  Thank you.   Guacamole was great and fresh. I also ordered the shrimp and fish tacos. Fish was good but the shrimp was great with a perfect spicy kick.   Service was awesome, our waiter killed it!

WNllJmsXM1KUFADJSb3ynQ.text: Went there last night and the food from the chips to drinks were amazing. I ordered the octopus asado and the ceviche... WOW. They were not only delicious but the quality of the seafood was noticeable. The ambiance and quality of service coupled with the food made this for sure 5 star.

-GB2_CWu8mhNBzEXLdWgBQ.text: We had our wedding reception here at the south front patio. Everyone raved about the food and service. From the atmosphere to the service and the tres leches cake. It was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 year anniversary dinner for our wedding reception here! Just as AMAZING as the wedding. Everybody Loved the food and venue!!

sJcdoDLMFKD0NmP2Ip6QxA.text: Typical overhyped hotel restaurant- overpriced and small portions. Food was ok, but nothing spectacular- of particular note, they charge .50 for water...to give to some fund.... no thank you- I'd prefer to decide to whom I'll give my money- I'm here for food, not a social cause.

LIihGxx824OrHqC1UJRGQQ.text: *THEY DELETED SO REPOSTING**  It's the day after my 21st birthday & we just put all of our things in the car & decided to get something to eat before he drive home. We get to the restaurant and they first tell us the wait will be around 20 minutes. We go to the bar to sit and drink some WATER and food & they kick us out because I didn't have my ID. Yet, the state law in Nevada allows you to stay in a bar section if they serve food at the same hour. I would understand if I went to order alcohol but it was strictly water & instead of going far (the parking structure now where near) to get my purse from the car I decided to wait because they told us that its a 20 minute wait. We waited outside for 40 mins & then after asking 3 different times if the table is ready and getting now more attitude from another employee there, the hostess, we finally get seated. We get the option to sit inside or outside, thought that was odd coming from the fact of it being a 20 minute longer of a wait. We choose inside and there is at least 8 empty tables. 4 of them being dirty with napkins, plates full of half eaten food & old drinks. The food was okay. Although, MY FOOD CAME OUT BEFORE MY WATER. Then when I got my tortilla soup im pretty sure they got a tomato soup can and put it in a bowl and didn't cook it AT ALL and then put it on my table for me to eat. I mean they are "REALLY BUSY" so they probably don't have time to cook food while they are busy staring at their dirty tables or maybe they should take the time to take the stick out of their asses. The guy next to us in a suit had a whole tray spill on him. It's been like 30 mins and the other people next to us haven't even got their drink order. I thought customer service was a good thing to get them to return.. But instead of saying it is all because of it being "busy"  IF I had the option to give it 0 stars. I would. If you're at the convention at mandalay bay, save yourself and walk over to another restaurant .  As I write this a bunch of glasses just fell and broke too. Haha. Nice.

tlS8K4x0ovb0ddCCYmfLVw.text: Worst service ever. Seems like girls are trying but it is completely understaffed, not to mentioned overpriced. We have been here for over an hour and have had to ask three times for a second bowl of chips... ordered Chile Relleno and 30 minutes later were told they were out. I was then offered chicken quesedillas at twice the price. Come on vegas, this is supposed to be a nice place and we have a pool concert to go to. NEVER GO HERE, NOT WORTH IT. WE WILL NEVER COME BACK. Not worth anyone's time, you are better off spending your money elsewhere.  Was just told by the manager that this is NOT A FINE DINING ESTABLISHMENT so do not expect that.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HFeOobCXFCm17fD-OJaToA.text: This place is absolutely a disgrace. Everyone's meal came out wrong. The steak quesadilla was drenched in oil. 2 of the exact same salad came out completely different. The service took extremely long for our food to come out.

hoIQ4W7fRU8pgGg8bVlhZQ.text: This was a nice surprise. The menu was trendy Mexican, but it really worked. Service was excellent and the foods was very well seasoned. We enjoyed the skirt steak nachos, the  poblano enchiladas, and pork belly tacos. It was a delight.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specials menu. Pork tacos topped with piece of chicharron. Great taste and texture.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak nachos. Even the chips were seasoned. Skirt steak. Excellent. Hearty. Needs a fork.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken poblano enchiladas. Chicken was very tender, sauce was flavorful. Great dish.

Y7U8bZREhqj_8ztSotlMTQ.text: This review is on there buffet brunch. The dishes that are avail are best average but the salad was good. There abondigas sucked along with there shrimp and grits. Try at your own risk. One thing is, that there are a lot of dishes to pick from. I liked their brisket sliders.

SlMbIE7iYfBH2BMODBRT_w.text: Inattentive service. Seating was poorly done.  Made us sit outside at 105 degrees.  They pushed 2 tables together in the front of the room. Everyone who walked by my chair literally bumped my chair. There were other tables available yet they chose to do this. Now the skirt steak was good but not seasoned well. It was a small piece for what you pay. The lime marinated chicken was dry, way over cooked.  The potatoes were Ok but the Brussel sprouts were weak. The empanadas were weird, not a good experience.  Worst was the huge bill.  THERE IS N O WAY THIS IS A TWO DOLLAR PLACE.  MORE LIKE $$$-$$$$.  Will not come back. Save your money!

H83Uszf7G7O0yncfZQazxA.text: I can't wait to come back ! I have told everyone about this place for brunch. The food was phenomenal. The plates were small so we could have a little taste of everything. Then there were around 7 different mimosas ! All of them tasted like champagne to me haha but they were very pretty and our waitress kept them coming. There was one that was infused with jalapeno and I didn't really like it but some people are into that. The menu offers organic items and gluten free which I loved since I try to stick to a healthier diet while binge drinking in Vegas haha. Love this place, had a lot of fun outside on the patio. The small plates brunch costs around 35$ then the mimosas were unlimited for 10$ ! Can't beat that.

MmNwmCofXqmBqakh3aS6pw.text: We chose Border's Grill for my daughters wedding reception in April 2015.  We had a casual brunch with several different dishes, which were delish with free-flowing mimosa's.  Not to mention, at a reasonable price.  We made most of the arrangements from afar and the planners were absolutely awesome - helping us with menus and options.  Everyone there was awesome - from the wedding planner (Destiny and crew), to the staff.  They allowed us to bring in our own decorations and had many options to choose from.  If you want a great place for a wedding, party or whatever event, you should consider this venue - truly a great experience and all the guests loved the food, mimosas and atmosphere

cI2Z3ibMklCh0cjp4E6AuQ.text: We were at the Border Grill on Valentine's day, the food was amazing!! I had the chicken poblano enchiladas and they were incredible!  Our waitress on the other hand was not so great! A man delivered our menus and chips and he was much more friendly and helpful than our waitress who referred to Him her assistant, should have been the other way around.  Once I got a drink it was great, but she was slow, rude and didnt even tell us the specials.  I asked for a side of something and my meal was over by the time she had it delivered.  Then we waited fifteen minutes just to get our check!  Great food!  Bad waitress!  Would go again and hope for a better server.

EigVuSNzZFO2LsJPEBB45g.text: We sat out on the patio and opted for the Sunday brunch.  They brought out fruit empanadas and fruit to get you started; don't waste your time, that is just cannon fodder.  Go for the small plates 2 per person, at a time.  They cook fresh to order and it is such a smart way to brunch.  Who needs food sitting on a steam table when it is cooked when you order it?  Here is what we had:Green Corn Tamale (excellent, order 2), Skirt Steak and Egg ( we opted for no egg), Yucatan Egg Benedict (I'm not a fan but my boyfriend loves egg benedict),  Crispy Potato Rajas Taco (only one per order so we ordered 2),  Machaca Chilaquiles (very tasty) , Short Rib Hash and Egg (we opted for no egg but maybe that was why our dish was dry) and we finished with Churro Tots so good you'll say "Tots! all day!  Very very good food we left way too full.

LV4Hsg17vE68h9650SCDug.text: Amazing!! Worth the time trying to find this place in Mandalay Bay. We didn't have reservations so we say at the bar but the ambience was just as amazing. We went on a Sunday to try their famous brunch and it is one worth the hype. Make sure you go with a totally empty stomach so you can savor all of those dishes. The chicken and waffle, the biscuit and gravy and the seasonal fruit plate were or favorites, but everything else was nice too. They were also serving complementary steak tacos tapas switch was delish.

cp00KXp8yznF0IxWBifE8w.text: Border Grill isn't anything mind-blowing & I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there but it's a solid option if grabbing a bite while at Mandalay Bay. In my case, I like to make reservations there before events. The service is lukewarm but not bad. The chips, salsas & guacamole are yummy... as are the chicken enchiladas & quesadillas. But both flavors of rice & the black beans are quite bland. The restaurant itself is kinda cool, with several different dining areas with different personalities.

uHRy7ysulV4YMGmnYBlEZg.text: Presentation looks nice but food doesn't taste good, the only thing that we liked was the ceviche, waste of money and calories

J7cKlC5XL1jhLz_v3ZpHbQ.text: I loved the Adobada Pork Chop! Always ask your waiter what their fave dish is, everywhere you go. We did that here and ended up with the best meal of our lives. The pork chop is served with a sauce over it and I can't remember what it was, but I would drink it if it came in a glass. I dipped the side of spinach in it and altogether the flavors worked well. A little pricey, but well worth it!

jIMW3wH_uijoZ6ht2E9vIw.text: The best deal in Vegas for sure. The tapas style brunch was the best dining experience I've ever had and that was mainly due to the service we were given. Our excellent server Carmie was the most attentive and kind server I think I've ever had at a meal. All the tapas plates were just perfectly executed flavor bombs. I will be going back whenever I'm in Vegas. PS. Go for the endless Mimosas

AIf_yTODpUbuebPeI_S0mQ.text: We had a great dinner experience for my last night in Vegas! I had been to the Border Grill in Pasadena (which closed a few years ago) and loved it, so I guess I knew I would like it here before I sat down.  We had reservations for 9:30pm and were seating as soon as we walked in. Our table was in the middle of the room, which was crowded, but the table was large so I was comfortable.   We were brought water immediately and our server got our drinks in maybe 3 min. at the most. They were really busy and the servers seemed to be really on top of it. HONEYDEW MARGARITAS. oh boy.  The waiter told us to try the plantain empanadas, and i didn't need much persuasion. plantains are a favorite, pablano chilis are my favorite and i put cotija cheese on everything, so basically this was a match made in heaven for my mouth! (they also have black beans in them, which i prefer over pinto, but still usually stay away from). The three of us liked them so much we ordered a second serving.   At this point we knew we were in trouble. I was already getting full and we hadn't even had our entrees yet.  Round 3 of margaritas had just arrived as my main course of Chile Rellenos was placed in front of me. The dish comes with rice and beans but I asked them to substitute their mashed sweet potatoes and garlic vegetables instead. The mashed sweet potatoes may have plantains in them too, or something else tangy. They were buttery and hot. I was soooo stuffed about 3 bites in...but I kept going.  My bf ordered Pibil thanks to my recommendation, which is a stewed pork dish. OMG I ate a lot of his. They add cinnamon to their sauce and it really gives the pork a whole new flavor. Its subtle but not just spicy......its aromatic. AND it comes with plantain orange salsa, which was asked for a bowl of because we all loved it soooo much!   My friend had chicken enchiladas, which she always orders. These are hard to do wrong, and usually are good everywhere you get them....even Taco Bell. She likes them with a lot of vegies, which is exactly what she got on top. Corn, peppers, onions, mushrooms......(i am allergic, so I didn't try her dish).   We also foolishly ordered a caesar salad to share. It was really crispy and the cilantro dressing was good, but TOOOOO MUCH FOOD.  Round 5 of margaritas......i don't feel so good and I'm giggling like an english school boy.  time to relax. we let ourselves digest for about 10 mins....then the damn waiter told us about the desserts. and, well......when in Vegas, right?  Mexican Chocolate Pie. GOOD GOD. I died and heaven was in my mouth. Orange Cheesecake. So creamy, so good. I only got a little bite because the boyfriend did not want to share (maybe because I didn't let him try mine.....)  My friend opted not to have dessert and instead played on her iphone. Fool. The dessert was fantastic!!!!   All the food was complex and unique. Its not Mexican, its not Tex-Mex, its not Brazilian, its not Oaxacan, its not Argentinian, nor Peruvian.   Its Border Grill.   P.S.- Even though we were all dressed up and ready to go to out.....we waddled our way back to our room, lay on my bed and watched a movie. I couldn't even take off my shoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Cream Pie. oh my!

67ae4uP54OA7e9XmvOIRwA.text: Candice was an excellent waitress and a real pleasure. Had the chicken mole verde which was great. We had six in our party and no one left hungry.

X9um1wGUWh_UOH4OVqHrJA.text: The Saturday tapas brunch was fun and tasty.  The creations are fun, inventive and worth the price.  Most tapas I've had overload you with too many, often boring small plates but Border Grill seems to have found the sweet spot of selection and creativity. Would come again.

BSht9_T2L_DLViMGVeL73g.text: I don't usually go out of my way for.Mexican food.  But this place.may be an exception.  We had 2 dishes that each had a slightly different mole sauce.  Great unique flavors.  The guacamole was excellent as well.  Solid restaurant.

7gnGkgfhHgDqqY59a-6vdQ.text: I love border grill in Santa Monica and DTLA. it's a shame that the service at their Vegas location is so horrible.

fi_5qL3amgLMaTzaxbw_nA.text: I'm only giving this one star because of the limeade drink. What a terrible restaurAnt! You Would think in a city that hosts people from around the world that most restaurants would be able to accommodate vegans or vegetarians. This restaurant can not. Our waiter also was unpleasant, I would never go to this restaurant again. The other meals at the table were average at best.

G_mHEMlwuTRd6CePO4L8qQ.text: I think that everything was a bit over priced. We sat out by the open air that overlooked the pool and that was nice.

D13VKhR6aIuOIrgaIksOCA.text: Wonderful food. So very fresh and great service. Chicken mole is the best and the boar special was amazing. Came after catching a show (MJ-ONE) and enjoyed the border experience menu option. App, entree, and desert. Great value. Would recommend to anyone.

Wx6oKTcGUyVggAz2UPlS-g.text: It was a delightful day and we decided to sit on the patio which was the perfect choice.  I was here with my family for a sad occasion.   My mother had passed and we were in town for her funeral.  Our server Alan was so accommodating on such a hard day. We were going to have lunch but he recommended brunch and i am glad we took the bait! The steak and eggs is a must but I suggest medium rare.  The bacon peanut butter jelly biscuit was an unexpected treat.  My Little ones Susie and Jonah were acting up and our server brought some chips and crayons to calm them down.  He really took care of us. Jonah spilt his milk all over the table and into his lap and Alan and his server assistant cleaned it up without hesitation.  A manager stopped by.  She was soooo sweet!  We even had a chef stop by.  I can hardly believe it. We even made a joke about being royalty.  I give this place my highest rating. Make sure you save room for the French toast and churro tots!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great service!

sLMM0TSG6PVyS2MHcigmdQ.text: Great Restaurant.  Expecting a mediocre meal, we were pleasantly surprised when the server brought our food.  It was extremely fresh with unique flavors.  This is a Vegas must have.

e47Ib1yPNPqCCUgyDDlfEg.text: Great view on the patio!  I had the Chile relleno and it was very good!  It had 1 traditional style and a stuffed Chile relleno, both delicious!   Atmosphere was great, came to celebrate a birthday with a 15 others, service was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jejjlNG6ff9ZYPU32t1Osw.text: Great margs and wonderful service. I'm not a huge Mexican food fan, so 3 stars is pretty good coming from me.  Started with some chips and guac, which were great. Then had vegan chorizo fried squash blossoms. VEGAN! You wouldn't know by eating them - they were delicious!   Had the brisket tacos and they were decent.   It's a good option in the Mandalay if you're close to the convention center but wanting something a little more sophisticated than the food court.

H-PJAEzZKcd4XBJkESf1vQ.text: After a few days in Vegas, my wife and I had gotten used to good food and so-so service.  We were excited to be able to try Border Grill.  WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED. Our server Justin was welcoming and knowledgeable, offering menu options and suggestions that made my spice hating wife comfortable.  Uni ceviche app. FANTASTIC.  Braised pork wrapped in banana leaf- SUCCULENT. Skirt steak-TENDER and DELUCIOUS. The perfect end to a long day.

wUJUh0ziM_tDDQIP8cX82g.text: I've eaten here twice with my sister-in-law, who is an employee of corporate MGM. Both times were pleasant experiences.  About a month ago I was visiting on business and arrived straight from the airport. The hostesses were very kind and offered to watch my bags while we ate. I really appreciated that because I was exhausted. My bag was safe and sound in the end.  The place was packed due to a small conference going on, but the girls handled the chaos and traffic very well. Shortly after we got seated, our waiter greeted us and brought out their marvelous chips. The chips and dip are probably my favorite thing about this place.  I have only ever tried variations of the tacos (shrimp, chicken, steak, and veggie). My favorite is the shrimp because it's not as filling. Most meals comes with beans and rice. Portion size is perfect and not too overwhelming.  In the middle of our meal, the manager came out and introduced herself. She also thanked my sister-in-law for the work that she does as a corporate employee for MGM. I loved that she did that; it showed a sense of community between the various channels of the whole company (for those of you who do not know, Border Grill is located in Mandalay Bay, which is part of the MGM Resorts group).  The only negative thing I have to say is that when it's busy, it's hard to get the attention of your server. We felt like he didn't service us as much as he could. He wasn't really that present and he didn't check-in on during the meal. When it came time for the check, he didn't notice us trying to get his attention, then we asked a different server who totally forgot that we asked. Finally we saw the manager walking by and was able to get her attention. That would be my only complaint. Otherwise, I really like this place. Keep it up!

nFo23su5avJy9mheyHIZdg.text: We came here for brunch during a trip to Las Vegas and sprung for the bottomless mimosas - they were delicious and so worth it! With so many different flavors (blood orange, prickly pear, pomegranate, etc.). It was so much fun to try all of the different varieties.    The food was fantastic and there was a lot of it! I recommend going if you are ready to enjoy PLENTY of food. :)   Food highlights: - Churro Tots (how can you go wrong these?!) - Chilaquiles  - Pigs In a Blanket - Tres Leches French Toast  But the best part is that you can try everything since it's included with the all-you-can-eat brunch!  I definitely will return during my next trip to Las Vegas.

Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Oyster Taco
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles

wCqNRkZdwboq6OQtHfh83w.text: Had the best lunch today. Chicken Enchiladas with Pablano sauce and roasted corn. This place never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u-AlSRkFrehBEs1olA4eOg.text: The service is amazing at the Border Grill. Autumn knew all the ins and outs of the menu and was fantastic at describing how everything is prepared.   We started with the Green Corn Tamales (free with Yelp check in) and the Queso Fundido. ($14.00) Both of these appetizers were outstanding but the tamales were my favorite. The fresh corn was amazing.   I ordered the Chicken Poblano Enchiladas with a side of beans and rice. ($37.00) They were made with braised chicken, Mexican cheese, Poblano chiles, corn, pickled onions and coal charred chayote squash. It was very flavorful. We also ordered the brisket , Al Pastor and chicken tacos. ($19.00) The grilled pineapple salsa made the Al Pastor tacos the best of the bunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted Tacos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso Fundido
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Corn Tamales

LHyXSnC92xe2vmmLK-a5Wg.text: I was so excited to try this place as the chef is very well known and for as expensive as this place is, there was no effort/flavor put into the food. The 10$ guacamole had no taste, the chicken tacos were grilled chicken on top of 3 tortillas on a plate, no garnishes nor sauces, and the brisket taquitos were dry/burnt. The kids quesadilla for my 2 year old niece was good, and the outside view of the pool was nice but overall, I spent 120$ on a very basic, tasteless meal for 3.

Nec2KM_zm2pZcVzKUJfV6g.text: Border Grill has a $35 AYCE Tapas Brunch with delicious fusion items, and a $10 bottomless mimosas add on.  The pomegranate was my favorite mimosa flavor.    Service is great.  Servers had a great sense of humor, and kept the food and drinks coming.  They also accommodate allergies, which is great.  AYCE Brunch items favorites -Eggs Benedict -Green Corn Tamales -Shrimp and Grits -Churro Tots  AYCE Brunch items to skip -Chicken and Waffles -BBQ Brisket Slider -Cinnamon Roll Pancake -Ceviche

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles, cinnamon roll pancake
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict in mini skillet. Pulled pork tortas
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless mimosas. Strawberry coconut and prickly pear

ui1-s1AbdIpPjdVuvbgAjg.text: Came here for lunch while staying at Mandalay Bay. The food and service was great. We split the Caesar Salad and added Shrimp, guacamole and also the Queso Fundido. They do offer a great brunch menu with bottomless mimosas for an extra fee.  *Make sure to checkin with Yelp for a free order of their green corn tamales. They were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sFiukrF-eANJREsfgMMKfA.text: The AYCE weekend brunch is great here! I previously tried it at the location inside of Caesars Palace. It costs a few extra dollars at Mandalay Bay ($39 vs. $35), but it's worth the money for the ambiance, especially if you sit outside on a nice day, and the service. The servers are always super friendly here! Our favorites: -green corn tamales:filled with sweet corn -Steak and eggs -campechana: great to put on the free chips -Chicken and waffle: mostly the waffle--a delicate, almost cake-like crumb -parfait: nice way to end the meal (not too sweet)

k03M7nSiXeUvwDEwBxZaJg.text: What a pleasant surprise! Had just gotten to Vegas and needed lunch prior to a series of work meetings. Stepped up and it was the odd hour between lunch and dinner. Grabbed a couple seats at the bar.  Ordered a Chardonnay and a Steak salad. My expectations were low, given it's a chain. However, the steak on my salad was delicious. They marinated the steak, so it was flavorful and tender. Plus, they add spiced pepitas, aged manchego with a coriander vinaigrette to the salad. Great taste combo.  Husband was super happy with his margaritas and meal, too.  Staff was friendly and attentive,  Satiated and ready for the evening of meetings.

mP-NsIRVtFSHHcn1z4PSww.text: I've been a fan of the Border Grill for years. The service is always friendly and relaxed.  We started with chips, guacamole and the standard trio of salsas. If I were to complain about something, it would be that the salsas were weak and lacked a spicy kick.  The waiter did bring out a fourth, "spicier" sauce, but it, too, was bland.   The star of the menu, for me, is the grilled, sliced skirt steak. Excellent flavor, paired with a delicious flour tortilla ($27).   Please work on the salsas. The fresh chips deserve it.

vx5zCIjcBUq8jsJQ6igJaA.text: I didnt see the nachos on the menu. They were recommended by a friend. Waiter new right away which nachos we were talking about. They were sooo efin good! I can say efin in this review. Its in Vegas. We also ordered the avocado ceviche. Both were very good. Cant wait to go back!

AHuwk-E4hzAQLstTTcgw1w.text: Great all you can eat and drink brunch. You can sit outside overlooking the pool and order as much food as you like. They have different flavors of mimosas plus different specials to order every time. Great to go with a group. Definitely top of our brunch list.

bwWyGXfdVsgOMUOROKyBeQ.text: Tara was our server and she was AMAZING! Mine and my boyfriends family was in town and we all had never been. We will be back and asking for her every time :)

xCp4zrXtUvjBBkSNd62Msw.text: Last visited when scouting houses in September 2013, that morning compromised by a traffic cop clearly looking to fill a quota, it was alongside a friend met just a few weeks later that Brunch was planned inside Border Grill at Mandalay Bay on Saturday, the return of Chef Mike Minor to the kitchen seeing several new items added to the endless Brunch in addition to several old classics.  Joined by a second location at The Forum Shops since that first visit, a pair of meals there plus one in Santa Monica providing a good frame of reference for Mary Sue Milliken and Susan Feniger's brand of Mexican cuisine, it was after navigating a good bit of the Hotel and Casino en route from Self Parking that guests were checked-in at the hostess podium, Chef Mike briefly seen greeting diners in the upstairs dining room before returning to the kitchen and later visiting downstairs patrons.  Offering both an a la carte plus $38.99 all-you-can-eat option on weekends from 10am until three o'clock, the ability to add bottomless Mimosas, Micheladas and Bloody Marys for just $20 clearly a popular choice, it was deferring Alcohol not once but *five* times throughout the course of the meal that the decision was made to partake in the AYCE Brunch, a basket of Guava Empanada's familiarly starting things off and as good as what one might find in Miami or Mexico while the housemade Tortilla Chips with four Salsas proved tempting throughout nearly two-hour meal.  Receiving 14/16 of the menu's diverse options during the course of the morning, service hit-and-miss with a youthful Hispanic gentleman a bit overzealous while his lanky Caucasian counterpart could not have been more blase if he tried, it was as Tortilla Chips were being presented that a vessel containing plump Shrimp and a vibrant mix of Vegetables arrived, a refreshing opening bite that quickly transitioned to medium-rare Skirt Steak atop crispy Potatoes with smoky Chipotle Sauce and a Sunny-side Egg.  An enormous and intriguing space, the soaring ceilings and walls all painted with both indoor and al fresco seating, it was shortly after Steak that the Two Hot Tamales Shrimp and Grits came from the kitchen, the creamy base and Sustainable Seafood bolstered by Peruvian Pepper Paste while the Chilaquiles spoke well of Border Grill's Chips which remained crisp despite several toppings.  Going sweet for a moment, the coursing left to Chef Minor smartly using fluffy Cinnamon Pancakes to refresh the palate before offering up a fiery blend of Masa and Shredded Chicken, it was in follow-up that Border Grill's Benedict proved to be one of the Brunch's most memorable items, a housemade Cheese Biscuit stacked high with Pork and Pickled Onions plus the expected Egg and Hollandaise.  Adapting to current dining trends by offering a "Power Parfait," the presence of 'superfood' Chia Seeds on menus certainly not common in 2013 and neither adding nor detracting from a fresh Fruit and Coconut Milk in this creamy vegan concoction, it was again with senses freshened that Breakfast Fries and Sliders came next, the typically American pairing given a southwest spin by way fresh Salsa and dried-Pepper BBQ Sauce plus braised Meats including crispy Carnitas and tender Brisket.  The rare 'everything to everyone' menu that still manages to maintain its concept, Border Grill's longtime success likely attributable to precisely that fact while several other "Mexican" or "Latin" Restaurants on The Strip have struggled, it was with Milliken and Feniger's comforting Bacon Jalapeno PBJ Sandwich followed by Mary's Organic Fried Chicken atop a tiny Waffle soaked in 100% Maple Syrup that savories came to a conclusion, the ingredient quality never in question and frankly remarkable in comparison to Las Vegas' other all-you-can-eat choices.  Wasting nothing more than a few smears of Sauce to this point, Chef Mike complimenting the table's capacity when visiting guests around the room, it was with a sliver of Tres Leches Bread Pudding plus chopped up Churros in Caramel plus Passion Fruit that Brunch neared its finish, the addition of $9 Rice Pudding from the a la Carte Dessert Menu highly recommended, though the portion here seems a bit less bountiful than that served in the Forum Shops with a Pecans and Bananas.  ****Happy to see Chef Minor back in a kitchen showcasing his talents, the ingredient quality and cooking across fifteen plates speaking volumes about both ownership and the man at the stove, those looking for an upscale Brunch option that brings the heat while remaining accessible would be well-advised to stop by Border Grill at Mandalay Bay on weekends, though some consistency in service would make the experience even better.

zHRkTOv-rbUOGBozwEzGRg.text: My party and myself had a wonderful time. The variety of different cuisines was outstanding. We sat out side and the grounds are literally gorgeous. I highly recommend BORDER GRILL

6D2MzaQ9Lfb8vLmdGaRzGQ.text: 08.08.2017  We met some relatives here for dinner this evening. I was excited to try this place because I remember seeing these two chefs on TV.   We sat down to wait and was served chips and salsa. Additionally, we ordered the homemade guacamole and queso fundido. The guacamole was very yummy--the avocado was creamy and fresh!  The queso fundido came with three small flour tortillas and was cheesy, stringy and yummy goodness. It was like a make-your-own mini quesadillas appetizer.   Little O had the Kid's Bean and Cheese Burrito with fruit on the side and a watermelon lemonade. The burrito was made with black beans, not refried beans. The burrito was a good size, at least the size of my hand. The watermelon lemonade was lemonade with a watermelon syrup, not to her liking so she switched with her big sister.   H had a Kid's Quesadilla with fruit on the side and a strawberry lemonade. The quesadilla was simple and on the small side. But she was also so full from all the chips, salsa and queso fundido that we had it was the perfect meal for her.   CONFESSION: I had TOO many chips, salsa, guacamole and queso fundido as well so I stuck with two appetizers--grilled octopus and grilled elote (Mexican corn)--for my meal.   The grilled octopus was cooked well, not over done so it was tender. But I wasn't fond of the seasoning and flavors it had. I ended up dipping it in hubby's crema that came with his taquitos.   The elote (Mexican corn) was grilled and had good seasoning. I wish it had more mayo and cheese, though.    Hubby also ate too many chips and salsa so he went with the brisket taquitos. The taquitos were flavorful but the sauce they served over it was too thick and the flavor was overwhelming. It reminded me of enchilada sauce. Then it made the taquitos soggy. Hubby was sad. The meal came with a side of black beans and rice. I usually sample it but as I said earlier, I ate too many chips to even do so. LOL!   Our server, Rachel, was very attentive and patient with our group as we arrived in shifts before we were a complete party of 7. Our water glasses were never empty, the gentleman waiter did his job very well.   I would definitely come back for the chips, salsa, guacamole and queso fundido.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TOP: Grilled octopus appetizer BOTTOM: Grilled Mexican corn appetizer
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The homemade guacamole was fresh and delicious! Oh yeah, the huge tortilla chip on top impressed some of us.

WR7HiVOTbOV5BI9ObMiaQA.text: This was our fancy dinner choice for our Las Vegas trip and boy was it worth it! Many of us ordered tacos and I ordered taquitos, the food was spot-on all around and we all truly enjoyed our meals! Our glasses were never empty and the servers were playful and sweet to our two-year-old, energetic guest! Definitely a great choice for a date night or meal with friends!

BVPoz2vAEM0lR7PLdT1owQ.text: Got the free tamale. It wasn't cooked through. I also had the fish tacos. The fish was overcooked and flavorless. Try somewhere else.

fKxWowP_CPX-C7pLRQwsfw.text: I had never heard of Border Grill, but when family that we were in Vegas with suggested heading there for their tapas style all you can eat brunch on a Saturday morning I was in. When they say all you can eat.. they mean it! We were there for about 3 and a half hours enjoying their delicious offerings plus $8 bottomless mimosas. We sat outside near the pool since the weather was perfect and really enjoyed our brunch.   Because there were more than 5 of us they suggested ordering family style so the food would come out a little more quickly so we did and it worked out quite well. After being seated were were automatically brought out some tasty guava empanadas and fresh fruit to much on while we decided on our mimosa flavors (did I mention there were 7 flavors to choose from??) and our first few menu items. We ended up trying 11 of their 22 dishes and some of the favorites were the Shrimp and Grits, Breakfast Fries and Bread Pudding French toast. Almost every dish was in some way super decedent and rich and it worked out perfectly to just have a few bites and move on to the next dish.  Our waitress, Rachel, was amazing. She was super helpful with suggestions and answered any questions that we had. She also amazingly kept up with our mimosa and food requests as well as refreshing our plates, silver wear and water glasses when needed. She also never got tired of us asking her to repeat the mimosa flavors (maybe listing them on the menu would be a good idea).  Great experience and I would definitely choose this over a buffet any day!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle and Pork Belly
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Pudding French Toast

9epRwjXXxKSqlmAoO2Ce3w.text: Very kind and attentive staff. The food was alright. Great chips and salsa.

V3NjI-KVCC-lUnT4kPqYWg.text: Bf and I came here for Restaurant Week. We sat outside in the patio so that we would have a pool view (suggested by one of the yelpers when I was reading the review). It was nice out and a little sticky (humidity was 35%) and they turned on their huge outside fan about an hour later.  I ordered: - Tuna Crudo - Duck Chilequiles - Whoopie Pie and Cinnamon Horchata.   The bf ordered: - Mushroom Empanadas - Gaucho Steak - Whoopie Pie and Cinnamon Horchata  I will have to say that THE BEST DISH we had out of all of them was hands down the Gaucho Steak. OMG, It was the most softest steak I've ever had. That literally melted in my mouth. No chewing for a million years, it was just absolutely freakishly good!  My Duck Chilequiles I was not too impressed with. Barely 2oz of duck and majority of the plate was filled with tortilla chips drenched in like an enchilada type sauce. It did taste good with the meat that I did eat but not worth it because of so little meat.   As far as the appetizers went, the tuna crudo is really good if you eat it with the tortilla chips they give you when you first sit down. Adds extra texture. It's also warmish, not cold which threw me off but still good. The empanadas weren't that bad. I'm not a mushroom kinda person either.   The whoopie pie to me was alright. Bf liked it a lot as it was not sweet and he's had the cinnamon drink before whereas, I've never had it so to me it was eh.   Service was really great up until we finished our 2nd course. Our waiter was no where to be found. The guy who took away our plates also took away the water pitcher and never brought a new one back and my glass was completely empty. It took probably 20+ min before we got our waiters attention to bring our last course and to pack one of them to go.   Other then the slow service at the end, I would definitely come here again and DEFINITELY recommend the Gaucho Steak. That stuff is legit!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck chiliquiles...NOT a lot of meat at all.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho steak is the shit!!!! So damn yummy!!!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom empanadas

N3o7x-16wclwx9HhvmQBLQ.text: The Border Grill is a Santa Monica favorite of mine, so I was happy to get to have a tried and True dish while we were in Vegas last time.  His plate:  Kobe beef tacos, grilled pineapple salsa, guacamole, handmade flour tortilla, black beans  Her plate:  Grilled Skirt Steak (ordered rare), charred corn relish, black beans, handmade flour tortilla  The salsa selection provided is always great - usually a bright verde, a smoky chipotle, and a fresh, light pico de gallo. I had previously marveled at the freshness and flavor in each, and ordered all of Mary Sue Miliken and Susan Fenniger's books so I could make these at home. I'm happy to report that their salsa recipes are easy to make and very close in flavor to the restaurant's. (Look for some recipes on the blog soon!)  The steak here is some of the best I've ever had - and from the two times I've had it before in Santa Monica, I can also report how impressively consistent it is. Great marinade on tender, high quality steak is always a winning combination.  D liked his tacos, though isn't as in love with this restaurant as I am.  An important note, for the Vegas patrons who live on points and rewards - they may be located within Mandalay Bay, but this restaurant is actually independent - you do not earn nor can you use reward points here. Not that it should discourage you from going at all, just good to know!

_sOmG8RlQ28n5d3kjYFf5w.text: Border Grill at Mandalay Bay hotel is delicious!it is a mexican style brunch spot whwre we did the $38.99 unlimited breakfast tapas. Pigs in a croissant  and chicken and waffles are to die for. I had three orders of the chorizo pigs in a croissant. Food came out fast with the friendly staff. Our server Eva went above and beyond for us, very friendly and accommodating! So worth the long walk through the hotel and pool areas. You won't be disappointed!

T3kt1eGdHvE3FeDfmYxBDg.text: I had to eat here a few times while at a convention and I'm not a fan. It's ok. The tortillas are undercooked, the rice is dry, and the food came out cold everytime. Chips and salsa are good. Save your Vegas meal and go somewhere else.

ayHiEsbaHBiheagQprjMQg.text: The mimosas were just as delicious as all the food. I was extremely impressed with the staff - super helpful and on top of things. She placed food orders in for us as soon as we sat down so something would come out to try before we even ordered. Our drinks were never empty and the food just kept coming. It was amazing! It was a little pricey, but for all you can eat/drink it was worth it. I will definitely be back!

njiZHXnUFcT9yapGwd987g.text: We lived in Mexico for close to a year and therefore have some knowledge of its culinary delights. We stopped by here just to have some drinks and then decided on their Tortilla soup - which was outstanding and very flavorful. This is a place with a funky atmosphere - I think they call it a Cantina and justifiably so. We will be back on our next visit and sample more of their food. We liked it.

4t7gwBGysy3JfjSik7PPxw.text: Food was okay but over priced. The waiter was lousy and only checked on us one time and that was when we were all finished. He didn't give/take our plates or ask us for refills. When the bill came around he was there immediately to collect tip and got upset because he felt we didn't give him enough money. He even said" Wow" behind me as I was walking out. He was a tall guy with blond hair and glasses. Be prepared to be disrespected when you walk into this place. Last time we will go and I'll make sure to tell my story wherever I go.  If you are looking for authentic Mexican food head over to "Javier's Authentic Mexican Cuisine" inside the Aria. You won't get attitude from frustrated dudes who hate their job. Rather, you get great homegrown Mexican service that you can feel good about paying for.

llUm0nVxdbSGmnUqx_nQjA.text: Great outside patio, but overall the dining experience was okay.  To start off the server while attentive, was really not very helpful nor did she try to encourage us to try different things on the menu she was very ... Let's just say short with her answers to our questions.  I ended up ordering the mushroom mulitas. It was a very interesting - essentially mushroom stacked up apparently stuffed with beans and cheese and greens ...But all I could taste was mushroom and I swear there was not a pinch of cheese in the entire dish! which it desperately needed. I ended up ordering a side of tortillas so that I could chop it up and put it in something otherwise it just really didn't feel like a meal more like an appetizer. Overall the concept was there but it was poorly executed. On the plus side their chips and salsa was very tasty.   Again, overall it was not a bad experience, but with all of the dining options in Las Vegas... I would not go back.
