r1AJtkw303f00Zlq2O0tvA.text: All of the men in my family thoroughly love Mexican food and I enjoy a good margarita so on our recent trip to Vegas we decided to try this restaurant which was described to us as "upscale" Mexican.  The food was good but not great and not what I expected from two Top Chef Masters.  The good -  Service was very, very good.  The margaritas and cocktails, in general were fabulous and the guacamole was among some of the best I have tasted.  One of my guys had the oxacan strip steak and said it was delicious.  Now the bad -  I had the taquitos and they were tasteless and small.  My husband had the fish tacos and his verdict was that they were "OK" but no better than what he can get at home (which is Dayton Ohio - a far piece from the border).  I forget what my Son had but he agreed with my husband that the food was just good but nothing he could not get at home.  That would be OK but this place was pricey for what we got.  Now for the ugly - The place was dirty and the seating was uncomfortable.  We were also promised a "view" when we elected to sit on the patio; however, the only people who get a view are the ones who sit in the very front of the patio.  We were at the very back of the patio. The overall appearance of the place just seemed to be chaotic and disorganized.  Not an enjoyable experience at all.  We will not be visiting again.

xmBv45GXsxUh0-UePloAmg.text: i think the only reason it's not getting that precious 5th star is due to the price.  i probably wouldn't have flinched at night, but for lunch it was a bit more than i'd planned on spending.  we were looking for something a bit less intense than what we'd been splurging on for dinner, without having to resort to the pitiful food court near the convention center.  the food, however, was incredible.  we picked up some freshly prepared guac to go with our chips and 3 salsas (diverse and fresh tasting).  i had a mint mojito with cucumber-infused vodka (heaven, but i'm not sure when something ceases to be a mojito and is just "with mint and simple syrup" ;)  i ordered a salad of the special menu that was full of tasty things. i can't even remember everything but i know there was rock shrimp and avocado, and ... grapefruit? and 100 other things i'd never put together in a salad but thoroughly enjoyed.  my husband raved about his tacos almost as much.  both dishes came highly recommended by the waiter, who clearly knew his way around the menu.  along with all this good food was outdoor seating complete with misters--exactly what you need on a hot summer's day.

0EEWIPkSBkj47KXtHI7vaQ.text: I'm not even sure what I had, okay?  It was some kind of smoked poblano pepper soup that was sheer awesome.  And a caeser.  And a couple of house margaritas (en the rocks). Nice joint. All said, this was a good way to start a romp down the strip.

-HtlPWqADts8aC2gHEe1OQ.text: Would have gotten 4 stars if we hadn't had the least attentive waiter in existence.  The food was really good.  I got the special Chicken empandas.  My dad got the skirt steak.  The empanadas had a good flavor, but the weren't as crispy as I had hoped.  My dad's skirt steak was fantastic.  The waiter did not pay attention to anything we said, and was inattentive to fill up drinks and take plates away.

jNReyDK5oaQo3VsORWSpMA.text: We came here for lunch on our first day in Vegas. FYI, the restaurant is a lil tough to navigate, so go towards the Shark Reef sign and you'll be there. This time, the remodeling was apparently done since last year so we got great terrace/patio seating outside. The ambiance was great and the food even better. I tried the chicken panuchos and loved the green and red rice, very tangy and seasoned. The guacamole and tortillas stuffed w/black beans make it more filling than the plate looks.  Didn't have the energy and tolerance to break in my first drink at 102 degree weather, but settled for the pomegranate limeade, which was very delicious. Don't worry, I met my drink quota later that nite at Mandalay Place, hehe! But we really loved the patio seating. Great ventilation and overlooks the lazy river pool. I dunno, something about eating a nice Mexican meal while watching ppl float down the river in inner tubes that says "welcome to vegas." I'll be back, and definitely ask for the patio seating.

IHEBfzWGRqpvSXPVJJEPcQ.text: I went with a group of 6 to Border Grill for Cinco de Mayo. They have the best Margaritas in all of Las Vegas. All they use is Tequila, lime, and Agave. So many places use sweet and sour mix and I think it is just awful. I ordered a portabella dish and it was excellent. I did ask for it without dairy and they messed it up twice, but corrected the issue with no problems. I used a 15% off card they gave me and a restaurant.com gift certificate, so it was a great deal. The Chef, Mary Sue was in the kitchen and came out to say hello to us as we are Top Chef fans. We were also lucky enough to hear the Black Keys play live. They were playing a private event at the Mandalay pool and since we were sitting on the patio outside we could hear it! I like the patio because it is one of the only places on the strip where you can sit outside and not be on the street. Great service, drinks and food. I will go back soon.

XlzzTVLNFnIUd2pFN8DBCA.text: I loved Border Grill in Santa Monica back in the day, so I was really excited to check this place out.  The plantain empanadas are irresistible.  I dunno though...overall not as wonderful as I remember Santa Monica being.  Still decent, but not a place I'd get excited about.

UXbHQn1wYPi0cMhcYdHWSA.text: I've been going to Border Grill for a few years and they have really improved over the years! They have a new look, new menu and new chef...very good Mexican food! A bit pricey...it's Vegas!

rNnSkqp6D1s0EPqYoqayrQ.text: Although this is really a 3 star place, I am tempted to give them 4 stars because in the wasteland of overpriced mediocre food that is the Las Vegas food scene, this place is actually not bad! Fresh handmade tortillas and really GOOD salsas. Grilled chicken tacos were tasty and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend them if you're looking for a place to have lunch or casual dinner.

VazJTB60AvmVAAqx6YJPfQ.text: My wife and I really enjoyed this place. Food is kind of expensive but well worth it.   We ate here twice and would again. No complaints. We would love to have the border grill in our home town.

RtfS7I82MJY82DHBSZPv-A.text: Am a big fan of both Susan and Mary-Sue. Expected to be knocked out of my socks by these Top Chef Masters, fell short. First the location is way off the main area, not a good idea. The restaurants is classy with a California vibe. We got the complementary chips with the 3 salsas, salsas were OK, chips were fresh! We asked for a spicy sauce and got a good kick in the butt with the habenero chillies. Ordered bunch of appetizers - out of which the baja ceviche rocked, fresh fresh seafood. The other trio of appetizer included plantain empanadas (OK), corn cream tamales (too sweet) and the chicken tacos (best yet!). We also got the Mexican soup, nice! All in all the food was good but not crave worthy. Service was excellent with water refills, recommendations and offering of hot salsa. Best part of got 15% discount for being CA natives, go CALIFORNIA!

mia6wSnCvNdve57yd9Ndlw.text: Omg the food is soooo yummy! This is the second time around visiting this spot. The first time we visited was last year, at the Caesars location (which is now closed). This place is just the same. Very clean, food is yummy and delightful. We did the bottomless brunch, and I had a Cadillac  margarita....delicious !!!! Thank you for the awesome service MATT!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-NbEa1uJm6vz2n-Vq8430w.text: I loved it once, so I loved it twice.  I'm not going to lie... I'm a bit embarrassed to admit this, but I had this two nights in a row. With all of the amazing restaurants in Vegas, the guilt was sting, but the craving was stronger.  I stumbled upon this place in my hotel on Thursday night. I love the chefs that own the place, so I figured a would give it a try. I sure was glad I did!!! It was simple, fresh and authentic.  The chips with a trio of salad, spectacular!    On Friday night I was looking at all kinds of amazing dinner options but my mind kept going back to the amazing steak tacos.  I found myself back here a 2nd night and it was just as good as the first!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd night
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1st night

qWZCYmpYiiilKfQYQs9Wpg.text: The food and drinks will delicious and the outside patio seating was perfect.  We order two food items from the menu. The first was the asado norteno chicken. It was prepared perfectly with just enough spices. The only think I would say is that you should order a side of tortillas. The meal itself comes with half a chicken, roasted purple potatoes, carrots and pickled onions.  The second was the Yucatan Pork. It was a little too greasy, but the flavor was good because the pork is roasted on a banana leaves. The dish also comes with a side of black beans, red rice, a small scoop of guacamole and corn tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yucatan Pork
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asado Norteno Chicken

OVKB0dReCgMZQlW29PQ-pw.text: First off -- came here for Brunch and it was way overly priced. As a local, since we already drove down here we decided to stay. We arrived at 2PM on a Sunday and it wasn't busy at all. All you can eat brunch + mimosas totaled about $60 a person (40 for ayce, 15 for aycd). If you ordered food and bottomless mimosas separate, the mimosas were $30. Brunch food cuts off at 3:00, reasonable, so we ordered fast -- but drinks could go all day.  They used to bring mimosas to you, now they leave a bottle of champagne off at your table and leave you sides of juices to choose from, which was was convenient. The steak and eggs were my favorite, steak was very tender. My friend enjoyed the dynamite chicken (secret menu of the day) and the cinnamon roll pancakes.    If it wasn't for our sever Luis, I don't think the experience would've been super great. We probably won't return because of the food versus the price and quality.   Also for mimosas - all the photos show mango, prickly pear, apple, pomegranate -- these are all discontinued. They only have orange juice, peach, passion fruit, or blood orange

GDA7Nh7l_Cxf8LwWaSjsFA.text: Don't waste your money here! Atmosphere and service was great but food was horrible! When you order queso it's literally and pan of melted cheese. My wife and I had the tacos and they literally give you the smallest tortillas then put a pound of food on each one making it impossible to grab it and enjoy it. You have to use a knife and fork with a freakin taco! Makes no sense right? Yeah, exactly! Don't come here if you want good stick to your ribs Mexican food. I've attached a picture of the glorious queso for your viewing pleasure. #sarcasm. This place should not have 4/5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The water was the best part. No joke. It was delicious water.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They call this QUESO.

DmaRFmRSGej48n9u2Y031g.text: An "upscale" Mexican restaurant. It's not super budget friendly, but most of vegas isn't if you want good food and don't want to hit a buffet or eat anymore burgers and fries!  I had the Yucatan pork and it was delicious. Smokey, sweet and oh so dork tender. I love plantains so was excited they were included with the meal. They were a little too sweet for me, but I enjoyed the caramel ones goodness. The rice and beans were just okay. I believe it was $26  My friends loved their brisket taquitos ($18) and their duo Chile rellenos ($21)  The blood orange lemonade and white peach lemonade were delicious but a hefty $5.00 each with a $2.50 refill which we didn't partake.  They do charge for water here which is .50 a person.  They bring you delicious tortilla chips and a trio of salsas with it which include tomatillo and chipotle. The first was complimentary and was delicious.  Service was prompt and friendly with the exception of the hostess who seemed a little snobbish, but our waitress was great.  Yelp offered a free green Chile tamale appetizer on check in, but it is no longer on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4efCfn5NeV7c3Idr3jbfUg.text: Expect to pay about 25 dollars for an entree here. Then again, we're here in 4-star Mandalay territory, so I didn't expect any of these restaurants to be inexpensive. Some of y'all sophisticated and wealthy yelpers out there might not bat an eyelid. But if I'm paying for my wife (which I did) and sister, this meal gets expensive real quick.  That being said, the food was definitely above average. Some kind of Mexican fusion--i don't know what it's fused with, but it's more fancy than your basic beef burrito joint on the street corner. I can't lie though, my mind wasnt blown. I don't really know what 25 dollar mexican fusion is supposed to taste like, but I'd expect to be at least as good that I remember what I ordered. I ate here less than 10 days ago and I forgot what I ate.  I think it was some pulled pork thing.  We were seated outside. Ceiling fans kept us cool and considering that we're talking Vegas in June, I was actually pretty comfortable.  Waitress was attentive and friendly enough.  They start off with the complimentary nachos and 3 kinds of salsa. This was actually pretty good. Didn't drink any of the adult beverages, just asked for water. Server asked if we wanted bottled water or "regular" water. We got regular. Water was brought to us in a fancy tequila-looking glass bottle. Weird thing was that there was no ice. Figured that's how the real mexican-fusion peeps do it, so I just drank my room-temp water with my pork-something entree.  Overall, 3-stars because, considering the price,  my mind was not blown.

evls-w4hxDjZWtqRz-aPIg.text: Ladies and Gents, it doesn't get better than this!!  This past weekend was actually my second time eating at Border Grill - and I was pumped we were going here because I remember it being fantastic, and it was even more amazing this time around than I remembered!  We had a pretty large group for a bachelorette (12 of us total) and the service was still great; they were very on top of our party.  Most of us opted for the brunch because - how can you not?! We also got the mimosas or mimosas & bloody mary add-on as well. ($15 for bottomless mimosas, $20 for bottomless mimosas, bloody mary's and micheladas). The brunch was around $40.  What I love about this brunch is everything is made fresh - it is all small plates or family-style. Since there were so many of us, they just brought out two family-style plates of all their most popular dishes, and kept 'em coming! (Of course if we had specific requests of dishes we wanted to make sure we got, they brought those as well).   I honestly can't say there was anything I didn't like, but I will say that my favorites from what we got were: - Spicy Chicken Tamale - BBQ Brisket - Breakfast Fries - Pigs in a Croissant  You also have a variety of juices to choose for your mimosas, some being: - Blood Orange (delish) - Peach - Prickly Pear (delish) - Regular OJ & More!  PRO TIP: Since drinks are bottomless, they will give you one in a to-go cup at the end if you request it as well!  I can go on and on but I will say, I love this place, it is a bit expensive for the brunch but well worth the money, especially when going out in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S7VgRrSBQJu6tPKRp62OGA.text: I'm in Vegas for work periodically and this was the first time I stayed at the Four Seasons. We were looking for a nearby lunch option after checking into the hotel and Border Grill came up in the Yelp search.  I had the Chile Relleno and a sweet corn Tamale appetizer. The tamale was probably the best I've ever had. Food was flavorful and well prepared and presented. The Chile Relleno was excellent as well.  There are lots of great choices in Vegas and if you're looking for something beyond the typical Mexican place, this is worth a visit.

jcIWl3mFZ-ZcnXuYpXHsXg.text: Fancy Mexican food!   Loved the salsa.   Just the right amount of heat and so damn tasty.   We were seated immediately without a reservation although I have seen a line when walking by at other times.  Located in Mandalay  Bay towards the convention center.     I ordered the ceviche and it's was too salty for me and I usually like salt.

Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tm

n3mq-sZcf0lmnbDtbIf6IA.text: This is a Mexican fusion restaurant, not sure what they trying to mix but for me this is just a fail restaurant came here twice (because of coworkers) first time had the impossible burger,  it was as they say meaty looking and good taste, however because this place drowns the burger in a sauce, this makes the burger melt down and gets pasty and ruins the experience.  The second time here i had the grilled scallops and shrimp, the scallops were very delicious, but the shrimp was way overgrilled hard and chewy, plus came with a strange sweet potato smear that just did not click with the seafood.  Another coworker had chicken tacos that he half ate, said they were strange having shredded carrots in the taco, the place gets packed but food is not very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qr0P2UjYFvmK46AVdMWagw.text: BEST SALSA VERDE! They bring a trio of house salsas with chips and they are all incredible. I ordered the quinoa salad because I'd already eaten a ton of food that day and it was perfect. It had an amazing cardamom vinaigrette, crisp thin sliced apples and the quinoa with mixed greens. Everyone loved their food. One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been too.

Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salsas
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quinoa salad - amazing

cL5hhuwIy1ivXG2H5t7HaA.text: Theeee Best ELEVATED Authentic Mexican food I've eaten. I'm from NY, so I've had a lot.  From appetizer to Desert the food was. My waiter was Marlon. His attention to detail and hospitality was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Dinner

_GQriUKFJvTR9G-ZvQmxCw.text: Yummy gluten-free options!  Usually only minimal choices but I had a hard time deciding.   The chips and salsas were yummy!  The chips are warm and crisp as tho they're freshly fried.  They were hard to stop asking for more.  We had the corn tamales that were free with check in and they were sweet and delish! We also had the empanada plantains that were not a hit with my 16 year old daughter but they were good. My tortilla soup with shrimp was flavorful and delicious as well.  Looks small but filling, how? Sara took care of us and was great and her suggestions were helpful.  All supporting staff were warm and nice.  Overall, great lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup with 4 giant shrimp in this small bowl.  Gf and so flavorful.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A fish, brisket and shrimp taco.  All gf and yummy!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vt8QSThTe2m7Vjf3xx2K0w.text: Was pleasantly surprised. Decor was a little off, didn't feel like a Latin restaurant when we walked in but the food made up for that. The service was outstanding. I recommend a reservation ahead of time if going on a busy night or if there is a convention going on. We wanted a guaranteed meal time prior to the MJ One show.   Everything here is made fresh, including the chips and the salsa. Not normally a fan of green salsa, we both devoured it! I ordered the brisket taquitos and they were delicious. My wife ordered the chicken poblano enchiladas and loved them. We ordered a side of plantains (seems hard to find those outside of larger Hispanic populated areas) and one of their blanco margaritas. Well, the plantains were gone in minutes and the margarita not long after (ended up ordering another....shhh!).   As a bonus, when I booked the reservation time via another entity's app I had marked it was our anniversary. They sent out a couple of their fresh made chocolate chip cookies and ice cream as a treat. We would definitely come back here again when in Vegas.

EYE3lC5Y19S6hu06Yw0KxA.text: My friend and I got to Vegas and instantly decided to start walking around exploring. After hours of walking we were starving and this looked like the best option that was open at the time.  We sadly got there towards the last 45 minutes of the unlimited brunch so it wouldn't have been worth it. The menu looked awesome though! Had I known we could have planned a little better and gone for brunch. There is always next time though!  Once we ordered they brought over some salsa and chips for us to snack in. This was the first good sign. I'm a firm believer that the best mexican restaurants serve free chips and salsa. It should never be something you charge people for. I got the spicy shrimp tacos as my entree. They were extremely flavorful. So flavorful that they were honestly a lot hotter than I expected. Definitely not a complaint but it was a little tough to finish all 3 of my tacos with the heat.  The only complaint I really have is related to the service. It started out great and our waiter was very attentive. Once we started eating it unfortunately went downhill. Our waiter stopped showing up and didn't check in with us. We were clearly done touching our food and no one came over to ask if we were ready for our checks. It would have been fine if my waiter was busy but I saw him and numerous other servers standing around.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shrimp tacos

FuJyk1cpjqFdCrWJWbKfag.text: Food was great, service was okay, but I question the dishes.   I stopped by here since they had vegan food options and ordered the Cauliflower Annatti "Paella", which turned out to be delicious. The sauce was seeped into the veggies creating a perfectly spicy flavor, exactly what I would have wanted from a Mexican restaurant.   What wasn't so good was the water, or more so the dishes they provided to us for the water. There was an odd fishy smell to my water, as well as my family members. We did inform the manager and waiter, who said they would look into the dishwasher and offered to bring us a new bottle of water along with new dishes. I declined it, opting to drink from my bottled water I had previously purchased.   The service was OK. While our waiter was quite pleasant, he neglected to stop by to check on how we were doing until after I was half way though my meal. Lucky for me, I didn't need anything further (other than non smelly water).   Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, but it certainly wasn't the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qmWcC2zTrHM86iz_7TLhYQ.text: Me and my fiance had a chance to check out this Resturant for our reception and we came away very impressed the food the service the location all fit into are needs and we will be coming back with the family to enjoy the amazing food again.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Churro ice cream sandwich was amazing mixed with the fresh berries I highly recommend trying this desert you won&#39;t be disappointed.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib enchiladas hands down some of the best I&#39;ve eaten.

5RcZelO4u3-4oBa5rY9rVw.text: Great places if you can get a seat on the patio, it's an awesome view.   The bottomless mimosas/champagne for $20 are a great deal AND they'll give you one to go! The food is good! We did the bottomless brunch for $38/person and ordered practically all the small plate options.   Our favorite was the steak and eggs! Great place to be able to get everything without be overly full! Definitely will be back! And the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BsPssSN1Z8RS9HQCxVjsHQ.text: The most amazing food and ambiance! Chef Mike Minor really outdoes himself! Definitely a must when dining in vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Scallops made special for my friend who is gluten free, allergic to flour and corn and is strick keto
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Mike Minor and his entourage

GsUkovmBDbi_Lw42BEcneA.text: Wow for a little hotel restaurant this place was amazing! Chicken enchiladas highly recommended.

YYhgF8k-wL0GGG3LfxZYjA.text: I was invited to an all you can eat brunch at this restaurant to celebrate a my sis in law's birthday. I was running late but my brother said it was ok because they just placed their order for food. I was a bit confused because I thought it was a buffet. Instead you order food and a small serving is served on small plates. That's ok because you can sample everything on the menu and if you like it you can reorder it as many times as you want! All the food was great! I especially enjoyed the chicken & waffles, bread pudding and bbq brisket sandwich. Couldn't find my parking ticket so I ran back to the restaurant hoping they had found it. I was told they saw it on the floor but the busboy cleaned everything and had thrown it away. Wish they could've put it aside because it costs $30 for a lost ticket...oh well mostly my fault.

UpSukTya_KHltHQmHyvt4Q.text: I really loved my visit here and sooo glad that my first visit here was to try the Sunday brunch with an all-you-can-eat cooked-to-order menu.  This was fantastic and so much fun.  We sat on the patio with the heating lamps (it was December), and it was a nice view of the swimming pool area.  We ordered one of most things (got full before getting through whole menu) and split each mini dish.  One of the most unique brunches I've ever experienced.  I would highly recommend it!

6cZW0Hv4ahiwBiQcHkVHZA.text: I can't say enough about the unprecedented service I received. I brought my son with autism and multiple food allergies and two amazing ladies bent over backwards to meet our needs. Huge thanks to Jen and Sandi for helping me navigate the menu. Food was outstanding truly the best chips and salsa I've ever had. Everything was well prepared and comparatively affordable. Thank you so much for making our night spectacular.

R82gXBid8oxHDhzGHnldMQ.text: One of our favorite spots for happy hour! Used to go to the one at Ceasar's when we were in town. Was sad to hear they closed but thank goodness this one was still open! Sat at the bar and indulged in delicious margs and tacos galore.

X8x-DztPsLbcvqcsmQVyFQ.text: Way too expensive! Too much lime in Ceviche. I make much better guac. Very small serving. My salsa is also way better. Spicy skinny margs were excellent however they did NOT taste like doubles!!! Almost $350 for 4 of us. Two drinks each. We all had appetizers. Never again!  This place was way better 8 years ago when we ate here!

Z7pRYT0LgoweoEiInAeZRw.text: It was overall a good experience, having dinner with the family. We have been told that there is no table for 6 outside so we had to stay inside. We could not see the beach but the decorations were nice. We could not get dessert as we were full.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting for food
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids menu
