5VmqYyLKt6dGUkY0Wpke9Q.text: It's so nice to find a good Mexican restaurant. This one is Mexican, with a twist. What I loved about this restaurant is that they have a gluten sensitive menu. Their chips are gluten free, and have a dedicated fryer for them. The chips were phenomenal and addictive! They give you 3 salsas.  I loved the green sauce. We ordered guacamole, and it was very fresh. Ask for lime to squeeze on the chips and guac. We ordered the Baja ceviche, which had a jalapeno aioli. That was not so good. The fish didn't seem fresh.  I chose the gluten free chicken enchiladas and split it with a friend. Delicious and citrusy. Had some margaritas and i felt like there was no alcohol in them, but they were tasted good.  Would probably save my money there! Go to happy hour at Hussong's Cantina nearby in the hotel for a good margarita that is properly tequila'd!

bNlKS-1sMxyNnumWwZDaeA.text: Props to Tommy our server this time!  But staff is always awesome here. Mimosa galore

UEuJ5aba8paVYSKUNxkbYw.text: Yum!  Enjoyed great food and service.  Tucked away location near the convention center at Mandalay Bay. Carne asada was perfectly grilled.  Chicken and poblano enchiladas were flavorful.  House chips and salsas were also excellent.  Also had the autumn sangria; paired well with meal.  Highly recommend and may even go back during this same trip.  Don't miss!

c3X6tCGTcQhe0dz3YpcFwg.text: We love the grilled skirt steak here! We've been for both dine in and we've also ordered food to go and brought it back to our room. You can make reservations on open table.

A8b-I0F2j-YFWtnTvDc5gA.text: When here for a wedding reception and was very surprised how good it was. Bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's were very tasty, and the food was flavorful although small portioned. Hopefully one day I will return for some more!

rKCScxN_kQ-ynTJ7KsP-Ow.text: Pretty good. Service was excellent. Food was yummy. Definetly impressed with the food and service.  Would go again.

Va0_5qIHE3EZ_OWZ75ytqA.text: SO good. Had the tacos which were out of this world. Also had the spicy bean dip-- which was majorly spicy. I thought the spot was perfect for a quick casual work lunch. My coworker really enjoyed it and felt like we got a nice break from the Convention and Vegas craziness.  The service was also very good. They were very attentive and hannnndsome!

jto_umz3RqI_h4KX8IrrWw.text: We went to Border Grill on our first night in Vegas because it was located in our Hotel, however, upon our arrival my excitement from looking at the menu quickly diminished. It took several minutes to get water, which was okay because it was a busy Saturday night but once we finished our water we never got refills despite asking our waiter several times for more water.    The carne asada quesadilla was okay, the meat was delicious and tender but the Tortilla was greasy. We only had one small basket of chips, our waiter did not even offer us more chips.   Before we ordered, we stated we would need two separate checks because 5 out of the 7 people I was with needed to expense their meal together but when we received out checks 3 people were together and everyone else had separate checks. It was apparent our waiter either forgot or was not listening to us.   I gave 3 stars primarily for the Raspberry chipotle Margarita, it was delicious.

o5QNliuCLLn3I8bYhMpI_A.text: Great food and drinks (blood orange marg is very good) also a thumbs up Kids menu.  Fish tacos are excellent.  Would definitely come back.

Qg4eX2J6zS_-xStX_-tOrQ.text: I had lunch today. Chicken enchiladas were the bomb!! I sat at the bar and had a Bloody Mary. The bartender was very friendly. I will definitely go back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food- good Bloody Mary!

VCBECn7UlXhJXERCMJrBnA.text: I regret not visiting the LA Border Grills when I lived there because I'd be there weekly. After the previous night's disappointment at Fleur we decided to try something a smidge more casual and Border Grill ended up being our first choice. Why is it great where Fleur failed?   1) The food is actually cooked well and didn't confuse salt and fat with flavor. Seasoning on everything was perfect from the chips through to the desserts. The food all had nuance, even the steak which is usually one of the more boring things on the menu was seasoned spectacularly well. The accompanying quesadilla would have been a great appetizer in its own right. I don't think it's possible to go wrong on this menu.  2) The service gives a shit. Our server was awesome, he steered us in the right direction on recommendations, telling us what he wouldn't order, and why, and making sure that everything was there when we needed it. At one point we needed a spare steak knife and didn't need to flag someone down, it just appeared as if by magic. Everyone we interacted with was awesome, and they got the pacing perfect. We never waited for anything but we also never felt rushed.  3) Casual is, well, casual. Border Grill manages to do a bit upscale without being stuffy. This is just an easy restaurant to be in. The energy is great throughout and the patio is a great place to be, overlooking the pool at the Mandalay Bay and it was even comfortable in the beginning of summer. Nothing is forced.  4) The drinks are great. There's a bunch of different spins on Margaritas on the menu and they're all worth drinking and all perfect for summer. Order anything from the cocktail menu with confidence. It's all great.  Some restaurants have great food but the service is off, or they have great service but the food leaves something to be desired. Or there's great food and service, but the bar is weak. Border Grill is one of the few restaurants that hits on all cylinders.

6n_ZC2eyRY_pflvmGT4FHA.text: Our reservation for valentine's day dinner at Border Grill wasn't perfect, but nothing that would take away from the 5 star rating.   We ordered the guacamole and tuna ceviche appetizers, both fresh and beautifully presented. Asked ahead of time for the guacamole to be SPICY (more jalapenos than normal) and it came out bland. Salsas for the table were good, especially the tomatillo salsa.   I ordered the chicken chile verde enchiladas and my honey had the Yucatan pork. Both of us thought our dishes were wonderful, generous portions and almost too gorgeous to eat. Love a restaurant that ensures the freshest and organic ingredients. Handmade tortillas really made the enchilada dish. We were wow'ed. For dessert we had the Mexican chocolate pie, which was just like regular chocolate pie, couldn't taste the Mexican chocolate, but it was good.   The only issue I had here was that I was sitting directly under a water leak (air conditioning, maybe?) and got dripped on here & there throughout the meal. Didn't want to ruin my dress! Told the waitress about it, she was non-chalant about it. Weird.   Anyway: dinner here was a pleasure. Being local, we will be back again. We just won't sit in the leaky dining room!

GB0cMtW-Qya48tUJgZmjsg.text: We ate here for dinner. Our service by Tara C. Was the best in the business, we started with queso. It's a little hot, but definitely worth the heat. My husband had fish tacos and I had skirt steak. They were both delicious. We had the cookies and milk for dessert. 6 for $6!! Yummy. The best thing was the service though, our waitress was the best.

hFhLrWN4r__Kk4riZPfH9g.text: We seriously love this place!! We're all locals and we come here for brunch all the time. Today we had Carmie as our server and she was constantly bringing out mimosas and our favorite tapas! See you next weekend!!

8Hgn5RB-QHrB2Lz7yXXiIg.text: so i walked into this place thinking i was finna eat "real mexican food" but my actual shit is more mexican than this food. "rogelio" our waiter was super rude . NEVER COMING BACK !!! they charged me for a few glasses of water. like bruh wtf. i'm livid af!  i also ordered a pink lemonade and they charged me $6 it um nah bruh.

jW-r67cI4VUq5bwjauwlZg.text: "Death by All You Can Order Brunch"  On our search for a good Sunday brunch on the Las Vegas strip, my husband and I came across Border Grill on Yelp.  We have been to Border Grill in Santa Monica for happy hour, and really enjoyed the tacos we ate there, but when we saw the brunch menu here, we were sold.  You see, my husband is a huge fan of anything "all you can eat", but I don't love buffets because the food is often mediocre and the thought of people digging through the same food kind of skeeves me out.  Border Grill serves an "all you can eat" brunch for $34.99 per person, but you actually order small plates off a menu.  The best of both worlds for us, especially when for an additional $8, you can add bottomless mimosas!  We made a reservation via Open Table for 11am, and were sat at a great table on the patio overlooking the pool area at Mandalay Bay.  We started off ordering 2 dishes each, and subsequently 1 dish each thereafter.  We never felt rushed by our server, which was a pleasant surprise.  Before our first dishes came, we were brought some delicious flaky empanadas, and the best corn tamales I've ever had (not being a fan of tamales, this was a great surprise)!  The mimosas were great, generous on the champagne, and there were many flavors to sample.  We had the typical orange juice mimosas, as well as peach, pomegranate, and my favorite, cucumber lemon.  Here is a list of the items we sampled, in the order we ate them, and our assessment:  Breakfast Enchilada- good, but the corn tortilla was hard to cut Shrimp and Grits- DELICIOUS, shrimp were cooked perfectly Skirt Steak and Eggs- best thing on the menu.  The steak was perfectly medium rare and well seasoned Short Rib Hash and Egg- average  Crispy Potato Rajas Taco- crispy and yummy Biscuits and Sausage Gravy- gravy was delish but 1 biscuit would have been plenty  Breakfast Fries- smothered french fries, so delicious and bad for you, in a good way Bacon Jalapeno PBJ- a unique blending of flavors, but I didn't love it as much as I thought I would  Lobster Pancake- I enjoyed this, my husband did not like Waffle with Pork Belly and Syrup- a wonderful blend of sweet and savory  Skirt Steak and Eggs- SO GOOD WE ORDERED IT AGAIN BUT CAN'T FINISH IT Bread Pudding French Toast- decadent and delicious, but I'm starting to feel like there's a brick in my stomach  Churro Tots- oh dear God we ordered too much and I feel like I might die  The food was so delicious we could not stop eating until we literally felt like we were going to explode.  It was all so amazing and delicious.  I don't regret our gluttonous brunch whatsoever because the food was just that yummy.  Suffice it to say we wobbled back to our hotel, took a food/champagne nap, and didn't eat much of anything for the rest of the day.  It was so worth it, and I can't wait to go back to Border Grill for brunch so I can experience Death by All You Can Order Brunch once again.

NPsYAIIHCblnqlZRuHR-Yw.text: Very nice spot 7n the end of mandala bay, directly located beside the pool. We come here very spontanious, as we decide to eat mexican and headed to mandalay bay hotel&resort.   We then asked inside the hotel and they have 2 mex restaurants in mandalay. We have done the right decision to choose border grill. Avery awesome experience from the beginning.   The service was very friendly and helpful. He gibe us the advise to try the plates dinner as we asked several questions about the meals. Its a all you can eat deal annd so then you cannorder diffrent meals. Wagyu beef tacos, and steaks have been delicious! All the plates come in a smaller size so you canntry several plates. We had around 6-8 each.   We also liked the place here. Nice decoration, style and overal look. It was a bit crowdy bit thats normal for such a good place at around 8 pm.   Definetly can highly recommend this spot when you like mexican food. Very friendly and fast service, amazing meals and choice and nice atmosphere!!

-JRLdlmgOwdgXdCLapDELQ.text: Yummy, great change of pace from your normal AYCE brunches in Vegas. I came here this past weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday, and they set us up in a private dining room for our 40+ person party.    Must Get: Green Corn Tamale Plantain Empanada Peruvian Shrimp and Grits - A fav amongst my friends Skirt Steak and Egg - Top dish here! Breakfast Fries - Reminscent of lomo saltado Fig and Blue Cheese Quesadilla Green Eggs and Ham Waffle and Pork Belly -Generous pork belly portion  Ok: Machacha Chilaqueles Biscuit and Sausage Gravy Lobster Pancakes - The lobster was really just a tablespoon of shredded lobster  Skip: Churro Tots Breakfast Enchilada - The tortilla on the bottom was hard Sweet Potato Pancake - The syrup was too thick! I would imagine the pancake by itself is good. I would definitely ask for the syrup on the side next time Yucatan Egg Benedict - The bread absorbed the egg flavor too much, imo.  Unfortunately, for a party this big, they charged as all for the unlimited mimosas, although a good number of us did not have mimosas. We made sure they took away our glasses for people who didn't drink, but one of the waiters even said "I don't believe that you're not drinking". I thought she was joking when she said that, but I guess it was True because when the bill came, they charged us all for mimosas. Kind of upsetting, because at the very end, people had already left cash for the bill and left, and the birthday boy ended up eating the rest of the bill. The service for the mimosas was great though, they basically left bottles of champagne on the table for us and brought new ones when we ran out.  Overall, the food here was really good and a lot of these dishes had a generous portion of scrambled eggs.  For the sweets dishes, they were all a little too sweet though. Service was good, they kept coming out with food and they were even nice enough to give us just steak when we asked.

giroPxmzvylG30Hbi6gnTg.text: After a morning at the Mandalay Bay Beach, my boys were famished and we needed something quick to eat so we headed here. They gave us chips with three different types of salsas and a free corn tamale to hold them over for the main entree. The corn tamale appetizer with salsa and sour cream dip was a mix of sweet and savory. I liked it and my sons liked it too despite the hesitation to try it at first for its very mushy appearance and texture.  It didn't take long before my boys orders of carne asada and chicken quesadillas were placed on our table. My eldest said their quesadilla was a tie to mine if it was an actual contest, so that's quite a compliment (for them) considering he wants to eat my homemade quesadilla everyday (ask me for my recipe, if you like). The seasonal fish available was mahi mahi so I had to try their fish tacos (Ensenada tacos) and it was recommended by the waitress. It was served on corn tortilla filled with mahi mahi, avocados, cilantro, shredded green papaya and grapefruit (saved the best for last). Now I don't usually like grapefruit in any form, but it added a citrus punch to this taco that was quite good. It also had a right spicy taste too. I didn't  like their cilantro and plain rice as I found it too dry and not so tasty. Service was great- very attentive, always kept filling my empty glass of water, and warm. I may come again just to try their brunch since others are raving about it (weekends and it starts at 10 am).

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh mahi tacos es muy delicioso!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a sweet corn tamales, but the salsa and sour makes a nice contrast of savory. Free courtesy of the chef or check-in!

xYR_pTeeB1gdCusv7ueMjg.text: Can we just talk about how Amber is the best sever there is at BG?? What could've turned into a bad experience...was turned around by Ambers amazingly great attitude. Border Grille is lucky to have her and I (as a local) will continue to recommend everyone to BG for brunch because it is the best food, for the best price, on the strip! Do yourself a favor and ask for Amber to be your server.

Ak_ScjzI_BvhXprKp7teQA.text: There were a lot of older positive reviews at  the entrance to the restaurant. Decor was nice and roomy table for 4 adults and a toddler. No sitting on top of each other. Wait staff was knowledgeable and attentive.  Fresh made corn chips and three different dipping sauces were brought to the table. Not complimentary and a $4 charge. We started with guacamole and cc hios. Guacamole was flat and needed more lime, salt, and probably some cilantro too. We ordered lunch specials on recommendation of waitress. Less than stellar short rib enchiladas.  Mine needed salt which is not on the table.  I thought it was me. But son in law agreed his was a little flat and needed seasoning too. Daughter #1 ordered a chicken quesadilla which needed seasoning as well. Pulled pork mini tacos  were good according to daughter #2, not great, but good. Ok food but not what I  expected and the lunch bill with no drinks was $140. Don't think lunch was worth the price. .

_qJWhomEpXidxW7WgVGsKg.text: During my time in Las Vegas I ate at some really incredible Restaurants (check my other reviews), Border Grill was not one of them.  I went with a party of 6 for a Saturday morning brunch. We had a really nice view of the pool, with semi-outdoor seating. The atmosphere was nice, but that was mostly accredited to the weather..not so much Border Grill itself.  The service was good, but nothing special.  Now I can save you some time by telling you my entire group tried everything on the brunch menu, and I can save you time and money by telling you everything was average at best. The pancakes were dry and flavorless, the Yucatan Egg Benedict was boring and heavy, the Huevos Rancheros was okay but nothing special, the biscuit and sausages gravy was...again flavorless.   If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay, you might as well go here because it's close. If you're staying anywhere else, it's not worth the trip.

IwtA1Yqy5iAP51qSWGLKHA.text: Food was good but could be better. I swear the wagyu tacos was skirt steak... too tough to be wagyu. They are trying to take Mexican food to a 4 star level. Just do Mexican and do it good

X5HOXp9oetFY0VkvATcEUw.text: The weekend brunch was a great alternative to a full buffet brunch. The meal included unlimited small plates and mimosas, but in a sit down atmosphere, no wait, great service. The flavors were delicious, especially the chilaquiles and chile relleno. Most of the dishes we ordered were a bit spicy, especially the cauliflower taquito. I'd certainly recommend this to friends, and am likely to return on my next visit to Las Vegas.

y8Y6ld4c_hzG9B8rYp42tA.text: Brunch brunch brunch NOMMMMMMMMMMM  Some friends and I hit this place up for brunch this past Sunday, and I was BLOWN AWAY but this hidden treasure. $25 for a tapas style brunch, $30 for all you can drink mimosas. I tried the shrimp BLT which was my favorite, the chilaquiles which was a close second, the crane asada tacos. The carne asada was tender and flavorful, an excellent choice. I di dorder the breakfast enchilada but it wasn't my favorite so I passed it a long. A teensy bit too spicy for my palate. I wrapped up my meal with the fruit plate, and it was divine.  Oh, and the best part? The bloody mary with BACON infused vodka. Do yourself a favor, order it. It will leave you craving another a week later when you're not even in Vegas anymore.  Our server Tom was as good as it gets and a breath of fresh air after some of the experiences I had in Vegas. Hes a delight, the food was amazing, and it was walking distance from my hotel room which made it well worth everything.

HkPeSTDFk3UILsMalfHJ3g.text: Leo R was our server and we had the best brunch. Everything was amazing and tasted very fresh. Would recommend to anyone. Leo was so accommodating and gave us great suggestions on what to order. Thanks for making our last day in Vegas amazing!

J5IYDIXnLE7MHJslP2Wb0Q.text: We made it here before the rush and after closing up a tradeshow. Great hospitality and attentiveness from the moment we walked to to our awesome waitress to the servers and bussers that brought food and collected plates and refilled water.   Great service!   The food, boy, where to start. After a long day on our feet and a relaxed atmosphere the food was excellent. Hot, spicy and full of flavor. I wish I could eat more. Tried some toasted  jalapeno peppers, taco platters, cold margaritas and left stuffed and satisfied.

ZdjnDTdJqMpATdquVwZJSw.text: Meal #8 of 2017 Las Vegas Trip   This was easily my husband's and my favorite meal in Las Vegas. It was such a lovely relaxing experience from start to finish. And everything was so yummy I gorged myself attempting to try as many different dishes that I could (and also revisiting some of the best ones).   The weekday lunch does not compare in the slightest to the weekend brunch, which while good, is in a completely different Stratosphere. (Let's see how many other Vegas hotels I can reference in this review, or on second thought, maybe not.)    The sunny two story Mandalay Bay restaurant definitely is superior to the other windowless location in the echo-y mall at Caesars Palace. The fact that Mandalay Bay's patio had a view of the pool just hammered the final nail in the coffin.   A tapas-size version of each dish arrived, made to order, often in its own miniature frying pan. The cold items were available at a station by the bar. This included a made-to-order salad (the chef plucked still-growing micro greens to make it) which was one of the highlights of both our meals. Also here was a chia blueberry parfait (chia seed, lemon zest, almond coconut milk, and fresh blueberries). I may have had more than one.   Highlights from the rest of the menu included the barbeque brisket mini torta and the chilaquiles. (Unfortunately I waited too long to write this review because I'm having trouble remembering what we liked and the few things we didn't like as much. I do remember the husband loving the salad and the chilaquiles.)   Our server (I can't remember her name but I know she was from Sonora) was super friendly. I appreciated that she offered to bring a cinnamon roll pancake from the buffet menu to the kids (who were eating lunch off the kids' menu - they weren't complete freeloaders). The servers were nice and generally looked the other way when we did share a little of our food with the kids.   For $38.99 a person, totally worth it.     Our Las Vegas 2017 Trip   5 Stars BORDER GRILL, MANDALAY BAY (brunch) Grimaldi's, The Palazzo Bouchon Bakery, The Venetian (snack) Eggslut, Cosmopolitan (snack)   4 Stars Payard, Caesars Palace Border Grill, Caesars Palace (lunch) Shake Shack, New York New York   3 Stars  Tournament of Kings, Excalibur Bruxie, New York New York Therapy, Downtown

qRH6FxIEbxhCbeAf0WfZRg.text: Justin our waiter was beyond amazing. He was so wonderful and made our evening top notch. I had the poblano enchiladas and stuff empanadas. So good!!! The food has a great flavor and was perfectly cooked. One of the best Mexican flare meals I've had.

Hz86Dk4z_Jf3vYuwJZljuA.text: Chips, salsa trio and guacamole were delicious! The chips were crispy and fresh! I ordered the Brisket Taquitos...made with Angus beef and they were delicious! Service and staff was great, had friendly waiters. Would definitely recommend this place for lunch if you're ever in Vegas at Mandalay Bay...

5g5YDJbTS-yvvjoCi2r-ig.text: WOW! Andy and i were totally blown away by our dining experience here. We came in this last Sunday (for my birthday) and enjoyed everything. We sat on the gorgeous patio and had the most amazing server. Cannot for the life of me remember his name (thanks to bottomless mimosas) but he has tattoos and apparently just started there recently.  We opted for the $40 all you can eat tapas and $15 all you can drink mimosas. We started out with the mango mimosa. Amazing!  Food wise you truly couldnt get better. We had the shrimp and grits, steak and eggs, and fries dish. All were outstanding. We loved the shrimp and grits/ steak and eggs so much we ended up ordering them again. All the dishes are tapas so you get to try so many different things! We love that.  The next round of food was soooo good. we had some type of sweet tamale. OMG if i wasn't so full we could have ordered 3 more. We also had the chocolate chip cookies with ice cream for dessert.   We also had a few rounds of the passion fruit mimosas and those were by far our favorite. If you're going to come here for Sunday brunch make sure you have a reservation. it was PACKED! We cannot wait to come back.

WcX82aWuTAlP2Hxlzy6nlg.text: Vegan options here! I ordered the avocado ceviche with a side of black beans and it was not only beautifully plated but the flavors were great! Sometimes it's hard to dine with coworkers when traveling but places like this that have options for vegans or GF peeps are awesome! Oh and yes, they have all their GF options out in the open on the menu. The chips were gluten free as well! Very good food for a quick lunch during our visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan friendly. Avocado ceviche with black beans

0GpJPCizDn9M4oYnAV8OLw.text: This place was Amazing! I was starting to think Vegas had no flavorful restaurants.,but I have to say this place was a hidden Gem at the Mandalay Hotel. Very flavorful and was not what I was expecting. The price was also very reasonable. The only set back I would say was the Waitress.  She was very rude and made us feel like we were bothering.     My Dish:  Chips and Salsa: Came with (3) different salsa flavors, all where tasty and great  Al Pastor Tacos: All I can say is "Delicious"   Desert: Churro Ice Cream Sandwich, OMG!  Great Job Borders Cafe, but having pleasant wait staff would have made it perfect. Thank you

t9lu7iySOh43_1BAx6FL4g.text: I came here last Saturday for brunch with my husband and MIL to celebrate my birthday, and I was SUPER excited about it! I have dined here many times, just never for brunch and the food and service have always been fantastic. This visit was a COMPLETELY different story.  We sat down on the patio since it was a beautiful day and I love the relaxing environment of the outdoors during brunch.  Our server came to our table, his name was Ellis (I could be spelling this wrong.)  Right off the bat, he was straight up RUDE.  He seemed very annoyed at the fact that he was at work, or was extremely hungover. We walked up to the table and we ended up greeting him before he greeted us, because he just looked at us and gave us a look like "the fuck do you people want?"  It was kinda strange but we tried to brush it off.  He then said "so it's somebodys birthday here?" then pointed at my MIL.  She laughed and said "no, it's hers!" and pointed to me.  He rolled his eyes and said "great."  And walked away.  I couldn't tell at this point if he thought he was being funny or ironic as the "asshole waiter" but it was getting old fast.  Then when it came to ordering, we said we would start off to share 4 different plates.  He obviously was not listening because he brought out 4 of EACH plate. That was fine, no biggie.  As for drinks we all opted for the unlimited mimosas as we were celebrating.  Literally took 20 minutes per drink. I'm sorry, but if you're paying 20 dollars for cheap champagne should keep it flowing.  Every time we tried to flag our server down while he was standing there doing nothing to ask for another he would condescendingly say "yeah, they're coming, I promise." Oh I'm sorry, I didn't realize you had to cook a damn mimosa.    Let me end by saying that my husband is currently a server, and I am a former server.  Throughout the meal, we were nothing but extremely nice to this server, hoping he would realize "hey, we're actually good patrons!" and would start to be kinder to us or give us better service. This was not the case.  Every time he came to our table (which was far and verrrrry few between....the bussers and expos were at our table far more than this  jackass) he rolled his eyes at every tiny request, never smiled, and treated us honestly like the scum of the fucking earth.  It took everything I had to not complain to management right then and there, but I REALLY did not want to waste another minute ruining my birthday and just wanted to move on from it that day.  So here I am, because fuck that if somebody treats a well paying customer like a piece of shit for no reason other than you're in a bad mood.  Also, in a lovely ending gesture, he slammed our check on the table at the end without even turning to me said "happy birthday."  As for the food, it was pretty decent. But the entirety of the experience was ruined by the terrible service.

fDrCv4FCmqyPBAW2rclx_Q.text: Brunch is my FAV, and with bottomless food AND bottomless drinks for bottomless time you can't go wrong!!   All of the dishes are unique and so tasty. My favorites were the eggs benedict, chicken and waffles, and the berry pancakes (mainly the cinnamon butter!). Even their drinks surpass the norm- their A9 Bloody Mary is one of a kind, so flavorful.   For a table of 18, they were very accommodating and provided timely, trustworthy service. I was extremely impressed!   I can't wait to return here and sit out on their patio again!

XP87a3PafNGsvUz9ohzhKw.text: Food doesn't live up to Mary Sue Milliken's name. Heartbreakingly disappointing. Good ambience and service otherwise.  * Note: there is a $0.50 donation for a foundation on your check if you got tap water.   Food is okay but definitely not what we were hoping for from a Top Chef Masters chef. Chicken enchilada was good. Tacos were disappointing - no complexity of flavors, just salt and fat and carbs. Fish taco was highly recommended by the waiter but it was soggy and not flavorful.  Bloody Mary was surprisingly watery. It tasted like diluted tomato juice. Really missed a strong tang of tomato.  Complimentary chips and salsa probably were the best part of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e7wRElRE-HMzJTKLUfAMHg.text: BEST BRUNCH EVER.   Came here with a group of 3. One a picky eater, one gluten free, and me (I'll eat anything). We did the boozy brunch deal (like $45ish) which includes bottomless tapas and mimosas.   There were 8 different flavors of mimosas, so we didn't feel limited and enjoyed trying all of the waitress's suggestions. My favorite was the raspberry, but the ginger blackberry was also a big hit.   The food was DIVINE. Everything was unique and had great flavor. We never felt rushed and enjoyed sitting on the deck watching over the pool.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict of some sort

dsA6L7mp66UBktgYQDm_IA.text: Two words, bottomless mimosas. Some old coworkers and I came here recently on a Sunday for their border brunch. They offer bottomless mimosas for only $10 if you purchase the $34.99 bottomless brunch, but it even gets better then that. They offer 7 different flavors ranging from blood orange to watermelon to pomegranate. All very good!   We made a reservation through open table since I figured it'd probably be a bit busy. We came around 11 am and were quickly seated. Our server was super friendly and explained the lunch vs brunch menus to us. She also let me know we'd be getting 15% off our bill for being locals. Gotta love the local love!  Food wise I loved some of the dishes but thought the others were just meh. I ended up getting the huevos rancheros, tomatillo egg benedict, chilaquiles and the tres leches french toast. I did enjoy that they're small plates so you're able to order multiple dishes to try without getting too stuffed. My favorites were the chilaquiles and huevos rancheros, both were very unique and flavorful. The benefict I personally didn't care for and felt it was kinda bland. Same with the french toast, just ok.   I'm excited to come back here again soon and try some more of the dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches french toast
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros

CvLJhYnccax8846vkXSf6A.text: Tucked away in Mandalay Bay, the Border Grill is a wonderful option for good, tasty Mexican food and they offer several Vegan options. Love the guacamole and Cauliflower tacos. Seating is nice on the patio overlooking the Mandalay Bay pools. Good margaritas. Highly recommend!

j276sCDP99M7-f13zstmYw.text: Amazing service and awesome food. I went for lunch and had a hard time deciding what to get because there were so many yummy options on the menu to try. I ended up going with the classic chile relleno and I am so glad I did, it was the best I have ever had.

EWdKMgx5o1YkH_TyOaphSA.text: DIRTY AND OVERPRICED  If they could be upfront about the pricing and not be discussing in their bathrooms this review never would've happened.  It's called setting the expectation.   Oh my god is this place is overpriced I mean  geez Louise I had a Cadillac margarita it was $34 Doesn't that seem like a little too much.   As you can see from the picture it says $14.  There's nothing on the menu that stipulates that it's going to be that muck more.    As you can see from the picture my kids had kids meals my wife had a gin and tonic and my wife had a ceviche and it came to $106.  I ate  nothing  I rarely complain about the price but when I go for a snack and I get charged $106 Ive got a wonder why.    In addition while I was in the bathroom at the shark encounter I saw that custodian clean 3 urinals and 3 toilets with a rag that he then proceeded to use same rag on the counters for the sinks( see attached picture )  I complained to the manager, Darla,and she handled it poorly by being a unconcerned and giving me a six dollar discount hence  the one star review will remain at one  Oh on a note darla confessed to me that is customary in vegas to charge 2 1/2 times the regular price of a cocktail if you asked for a decent size glass and a double instead of a mini  glass or whatever they intended to serve it in.    Granted this is a massive double margarita fueled review and I feel bad about stiffing the waitress on her tip but I was pretty pissed about $106 bill for a snack and a cocktail.  And I also feel bad that my solitary review took them from four and a half stars to four stars.  But you have to take a yelpers seriously.     I'm gonna go lay down now.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. here&#39;s the custodian who thinks  it&#39;s OK to wipe down the counters at the sink with the rags he  just  cleaned toilets with
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is the menu with nothing stipulating any $20 up charge
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As you can see this is the original price.

Nh_xOPGclg3t_bk3Ovfbmw.text: I could not be happier! To walk into an Omni restaurant and ask for the vegan is a delight. The enchiladas were amazing. Flavorful, just the right amount of heat and cashew cream. I ate too much but I didn't want to stop!  Chips and salsa were delicious too all three salsas were great, but the green salsa was really special. Ate at the bar and the service was good.  Thrilled to find this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OZp3WSilr41lYw3w70Q-Lg.text: My wife and I received great service upon our arrival at the restaurant. Sierra the manager greeted us and provided excellent service. Our meal and entire service was great. That is why we keep coming back.

PIwVxqc4taCvXF9joXoxIg.text: I'm convinced that nothing in Mandalay bay is going to be more than JUST okay.   This restaurant that boasts a "top chef" restaurant is just another ploy to get you in the door.   Food was mediocre version of Mexican food. It lacked creativity, flavor or decor. With more of a quick meal style food, this place doesn't offer much for those who are both vegan and gluten free. However, majority of their menu is gluten free.   It feels and tastes more like your average chain restaurant than a premium topchef restaurant. Located all the way in the back of the Mandalay bay hotel, this restaurant is one that you might only want to try if you make your way to the convention center and need a break to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable tacos  with a side of Brussels sprouts - REALLY GOOD
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of rice and beans

y7u0e1l-Tftq3iX63fBVQg.text: What a great meal we just enjoyed at the Border Grill in Mandalay Bay.  We are local to Las Vegas, and like the Border Grill because you can get in and out of the place without having to valet park or use the garage, so its convenient for locals.  That is just one of the benefits, the food has always been great but tonight we had a tasting menu and we were very impressed. I had the Fillet and my wife had the scallops as the main course, but the appetizer and deserts were just as amazing.  The price is very fair - locals ask about the VIP discount plan.  Great enjoyable place.  Check it out.

jSQBvpGzBcsgaNjAMfS1Hw.text: So, first off I must say that I am a wimp when it comes to spicy food. Medium salsa is my limit. That being said, the steak quesadilla was really good! Everything else on the plate was too hot for me to eat. I'm from Texas... I live on good Mexican food. It doesn't have to light you up to be good. My husband loves spice and he got the steak nachos which he liked. .. unfortunately they didn't set too well. He's having some stomach issues now. That's why I only gave them 3 stars.

neO72yFTOds-rRuJTmBIoA.text: The service the food top notch.  This is surely an excellent place to dine.  They fully understood the food allergies and all precautions were taken

NeECXpGP7VysyaA_NoxAig.text: Sunday brunch is good stuff, Rachel was the best :)

UAC6f8Wpcm9xOHVmVSivYg.text: Went to pick up some tickets at the House of Blues in Mandalay and thought to stop in and try this place out.  Attending conventions at the Convention Center in Mandalay Bay, I usually scurried by this restaurant and didn't stop to take too much notice.  The only thing I did notice was that it was always busy (good sign?).  Amber K. suggested we try it out as it has good reviews on Yelp and since we were in the area, I said 'why not?'  We walked up and were quickly seated and attended to promptly by our waiter Lars for the remainder of the night.  I decided to try the soft shell crab tostada appetizer and roll with the grilled mahi mahi tacos for my main entree.  The food was very nice and Lars also hooked it up with some habanero salsa for our chips in between each course of the meal.  We finished off the night with a "Mexican" banana split which consisted of mexican chocolate, pineapple, and raspberry ice cream topped off with a little bit of coconut.  Overall, the food was delish and I left sastified.  Also, just being locals, Lars signed us up for the Border Grill VIP card which gave "VIP" locals like myself 15% off of the bill every time we rolled into Border for anything outside of happy hour.  Good night?  I think so.  Will be back soon to try one of the many other options available at the Border Grill!

3IbrdgbJrkmb6Uo2fWzE4w.text: large group so breaking down the bill was an issue BUT aside from that loved everything about this place from the Prickly Pear Pina Colada to the Queso Fundido to the Brisket Taquitos.... Autumn was our server - pleasant knowledgable and not too overpowering ... we'll be back

MjZDjJB0_75Kg5cbl_46BQ.text: We made Valentine reservation arrangements weeks before through the Mandalay Bay resort (on site).  Our party of 5 was originally seated inside a loud, unimpressive part of the restaurant. They were kind enough to honor our request to be seated outside (which we said we would gladly wait for) only to be placed in a back corner facing construction drapes and pvc fencing.  Our server was very polite but told us (after getting to know him) they were understaffed due to several call-ins. We chose the "family style" service where our server brought out several plates for our party to work on.  Every single one of them was cold, luke-warm at best!  You could tell they were flavorable, but all was lost on the cool temp.  One example was the cauliflower taquitos, raved about by other guests, which were stone cold in their center.  We brought  it to our server's attention to which he apologized and said he would tell the chef.  Frankly our mimosa glasses went empty often as we must have been forgotten sitting in the construction zone.  However, we powered on and tried other items on the menu at our server's urging.  Alas the food arrived (cold again) and the frustration continued.  The server informed the manager (not at our request) who apologized profusely and credited our bill 20% and several of the champagne extra charges (which we made certain to get plenty of, sampling all the different mimosa blends on the menu.)  So, unfortunately I cannot recommend Border Grill based on our experience. I would be reluctant to return as there are many other alternatives for Sunday Brunch in Vegas.

c8Qe0wkScvTWBvfP942drQ.text: Decor and ambience is nice.   Food portions can be generous but the prices on the menu were higher than the quality of the food (latter of which was good). We wanted to know what the mole dish tasted like, and our waitress brought out a sample of the sauce. I liked that.  The yucatan pork dish was very generously portioned and filling. The plaintains were my favorite.  Overall service is unwelcoming.

i8cwN50BQz_gmcdAi8NKrg.text: Would give it five stars, but the food was a little too "fancy" for my tastes... (I am sure that if I ordered something a bit more straightforward, it'd have been five stars, though, as all the components of the little creations were yummy, even through I preferred to deconstruct them.)  Still, though, the little Sunday brunch dealio with all the little plates was a neat experience... and the service was EXCELLENT! Many thanks to Jay and all the other staff who kept busy taking away plates and delivering us more. Great job, guys!

JAPm80I2s_JIMsD0m69Nkw.text: Ah the Yucatan Pork dish. How far I've traveled just to eat you. (Boston.) Well, while not entirely True, I did make Border Grill the first stop on our gluttonous trip through Vegas, and my friends agreed that it was delicious. The guacamole is also not to missed. Our waiter may have been a sociopath with a bright future in sales, as my group all succumbed to his recommendations -- and were not disappointed.

Ozd_YP4vVofOPIisua3L3w.text: I cannot say much; however the brunch tapas buffet is amazing for the price.  There is a gigantic selection of different plates to try with items that include pork belly or breakfast nachos. With a big selection in mind, it is not a bad idea to go with a big group so that you can share and try a good variety of what they have to offer.   Excellent Blood Mary's as well!

_yLw8rgAYbr742eVlcCMuQ.text: If you love mexican cusine then Border Grill is for every foodie!!  We went twice in one week.  Tried all of the Cerviche's.  This place rocked in taste right down to their cocktails.  Didn't have desserts too full.  Service was great.  I would recommend Border Grill To Everyone even if Mexican cuisine is not for you!  It will be...

1vDxcf5jeS4jwOKNW13MUg.text: Every year when I hit Vegas for my convention, this is my lunch spot.  New menu this year that shows gluten free options.  Service is always great and the food and beverages are yummy.  The mojito choices are brilliant, as are the margaritas.  Go and enjoy!

OsfEPbyJSyBjLEhA2xh50g.text: We had the Saturday Brunch, small plates tasted 12 of the like 20 items on the Brunch Menu plus bottomless Mimosas. One word to describe it... DIVINE!! Everything thing was delicious , complex layering of flavors to tickle every taste bud upon the tongue. If you have not experienced a "tapas" type meal I recommend Border Grill. Our server Mike was fantastic knowledgeable about the menu and knew intuitively what would tickle our fancy. Also very personable and funny! A treat to interact with! He made my young daughter feel at home and engaged her in banter and recommended the Ceviche Trio for her. SHE adored it, for a child she is very adventurous when it come to food. I cannot over state how wonderful the food , service and atmosphere is in Border Grill. Go ahead take the plunge and try it! You wont regret it!

TS95wn-1s9jeaxzZw_PPhA.text: Border Grill Mandalay Bay is amazing!! We dined on brunch, mimosas and desert. Everything was delicious!! I enjoyed a chocolate, banana almond flourles cake. The endless mimosas were fantastic and the best I've had. I loved the blood orange mimosa and of course the hot pink mimosa. The patio view was very relaxing. Our Server Gatsby was knowledgeable, efficient and had such a fun personality. Gatsby was the best Server we had in Vegas!!

GtzAIJZY2CRtgqU3dIoRFw.text: Still some issues at the front of the house. My friend and I came in with reservations at 9 pm and were seated promptly. The runner came out with water and chips, and that concluded the timely part of the service. We sat there for fifteen minutes and filled up on a whole lotta chips. We ordered the guacamole which was good, I personally prefer less lime in my sauce but I can see how somebody would like more. After discussing the menu items, evaluation of the probability of a downgrade of U.S. debt, outlining all of the eventualities of a default, and analysis of the political barriers towards a deal, the server took our drink orders. Her claim was that she had two sections to cover because somebody was out for the night. I am a little skeptical since there were several servers working and a management call to simply give one person two sections seems unreasonable.   The food, however, was outstanding like the last time I was here. The server upsold me on the tuna tartare on chips as an appetizer; delicious, but the tuna ought to be cut into fine pieces - I had to take the tuna down in one hefty bite. My other complaint is that $14 for two loaded chips is comparable to my earlier experience at T&T, needless to say, not the best deal. I had the short ribs as an entree, it was mixed in a smoky and sweet cayenne sauce over a bed of corn polenta, I definitely didn't leave hungry nor unsatisfied. I also tried my friend's quesadilla, the blue cheese and mushrooms are a nice twist on a staple dish. The tres leches cake was decent, not too interesting, but alright if you need to finish on a sweet note.

d85KpmFIIoS6-6-Tkid-5Q.text: Enjoyed brunch here today. Unlimited small plates and mimosas. Gave us a chance to try several really unusual but delicious dishes. Every bite was fantastic. And best wait staff ever! Dan was attentive, helpful, super pleasant, and cute . (Looks like Brendan Fraser.)

crp_9owiOs7oleobG6tMnA.text: I loved my meal but not the service so I'll focus on the lunch. I ordered the Yucatan Pork plate and was thoroughly impressed.  While we were waiting to be seated a woman already eating said,  "this is the worst Mexican food I've ever had." Considering the location and reputation of the chef I thought that was a little overly dramatic and possibly overstated but it still made me concerned.   Anyway the menu was full of standards--quesadillas and taco options--but I wanted to have something that required enough effort that the chef couldn't just mindlessly throw it together so I chose the Yucatan Pork. It was a business lunch so I was concerned that the portion would be a little much but I went for it and so did the gentleman seated next to me (a former bball player built like a lineman, so my portion question remained).  The pork was tender, fall apart, melt in your mouth good and season perfectly. The mountain of pork was more than enough and so distracting that the tasteless tortilla accompaniment was unnecessary and unmissed.  A side of sweet plantains with a bit of crunch was excellent!  I considered taking my table mates portion since they weren't of interest to him but kept some form of etiquette and decorum.  I'm not sure what the concoction was but the black bean paste on the side was another great edition with the cheese and rice. Ignore the mile long trek through the restaurant to be seated outside on a freezing Vegas afternoon, and the young "too busy for you" waitstaff and I would go back specifically for this dish!

36jotniJ24GzQ-TxFAkLPg.text: Went deeper into the menu this time.   Chicken Mole is the most tender , tasty chicken dish we ever had.    Gotta have the gaucho steak if u like that char flavor.   Great again.

F-FHDoOVauCpIgIRI7N1-w.text: Big flavors and big portions! My girlfriends and I loved it here so much we dined here twice in our 4 day trip! You can not go without ordering the Baja Ceviche - it's to die for, and this coming from someone who rarely eats seafood! The guacamole is decadent and the chicken poblano enchiladas were fantastic, especially with some of their salsa verde.

wVgP4Lk2IzWHADq6alOuRQ.text: This top chef restaurant has some of the best food in Mandalay Bay. Honestly worth all the hassle running across the casino to the place.   The restaurant is private, with almost no public view of the casino, windows make up the whole wall, letting the natural sunlight in without the harsh desert heat. That is five star worthy already!  The staff are very nice and patient with complete knowledge over the contents of the menu. The food is supreme. They have the best Enchiladas I have ever had. I used to live in Chicago so I know. Not greasy at all and fluffy af. The dessert is great, from rich flan to cookies stuffed with liquid chocolate, it will leave you wanting more.   If you are in Las Vegas stop in for brunch or dinner, it's all good!

WIVeZTy6ZynLvjGX_uHNeA.text: This was a great place to eat after the Michael Jackson one show But let me just tell you that the best part was the Guacamole ! Holy moly , I had two bowls!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pescado
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street corn  Compliments of the chef

3VeOxFAReRkdE5PNHLAjJQ.text: Amazing service and view. Food was great for the price in Vegas. The ceviche sampler was one of my favorites along with the patron margarita.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upper Patio

8LOLkV8nWW9pmnowOzPn1A.text: Funny...all the times I'd walked by this place over the years and I'd never been in to actually eat. This was an error on my part, I quickly discovered, as I finally got to this. You really have to sift around, but there are some very solid places in Vegas and in the casinos, places that leave little to chance. This is one of them. Service was impeccable, the chips and sauces were pretty well thought out and seemingly endless and the food itself, aside from the rice side (blech) was also very, very good. I wouldn't put it quite to great and it took me awhile to decide because most of the dishes needed modification so I could have them. This place is also exceedingly slow, so it should be avoided if you're in any kind of hurry, but this is definitely one of the better Mexican-style places I've hit up in Vegas and they definitely do what they can to take care of you...call it more a 4.5.

PlRS6XUL-OuD4-tM6zu8gQ.text: I'm in Las Vegas celebrating my birthday and staying at the Mandalay Bay hotel. We decided to try the border grill at the Mandalay hotel and the food was amazing and the customer service was five scar.  I ordered the salmon tostada and a Rum mai tai, and this was delicious. I recommend this restaurant to anybody visiting the Las Vegas area to please come out.  I want to thank the best server David for taking care of me and my family and them most amazing young lady Sandy, and of course Pascual for greeting us with a smile and making sure our food and service was amazing. Thank you for taking care of me and my family and giving me a place to celebrate my pre-birthday

5bWiCGET52uzUvzqZh7krg.text: If you like no service then hang out here ...waited for a table outside for about 10 minutes and the hostess was super rude when I asked how much longer. Finally they seated us with only one other guy outside we waited and waited for anyone to give us service. Too many options in Mandalay Bay so we left and no one cared.

tpwVxnBM_GwFq7Qq0nIDcQ.text: First off, if you're going to charge for a glass of water, please have the courtesy to ask if we would like to pay for a glass of still water! Having said that, the food IS great here, consistently good. We sat outside, which was a bit loud and could use some misters. The waitress was nice and friendly, but slow in serving my order of corn, which arrived after we were 3/4 if the way through our meal. She was also slow in delivering my glass of wine, we were about 80% through our meal, so I didn't finish it. I would go back, but I'd be sure to ask for no water!!!

s3RS2y8y3etxwJ7v_YZsbA.text: Delicious and affordable!! Great place to stop for lunch or dinner inside Mandalay Bay. Their salsa trio was tasty, first order is on the house. We enjoyed Plantain Empanadas as an appetizer, perfect size for 2-4 people. My friend devoured the Brisket Taquitos, and practically licked the plate clean. Another friend ordered the Chicken Tacos, which she enjoyed, but the tortilla was too small for the amount of filling, so she had to finish it with a fork. I had the Chicken Poblano Enchiladas and they were awesome!! Our server was slow, and didn't check in on us after we got our meals so we didn't get to order a second round of drinks. The food runners were very helpful, however, bringing us appetizer plates and refilling our chips. The prices were very affordable, especially for Vegas. Overall, I'd definitely recommend Border Grill.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Poblano Enchiladas

VIe2TS-oT4o8uFrshCXymQ.text: Really enjoyed our dinner last night. Chips and a trio salsa were provided as we waited to order. We ordered guacamole which was a good balance of flavor. Not much heat at all but still flavorful. We ordered the Barbacoa taquitos and the Norteno pollo. Taquitos were crunchy yet meat was tender. Pico de Gallo was delicious and tangy. Chicken had a great rub on it. Carrots were incredible. Border Grill is definitely one to revisit!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pollo Norteno
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa taquitos and complimentary chips and salsa.

UNiFCEulkSDhjHTJ5TyAsA.text: Great spot for drinks and appetizers, especially if you're on your way to or coming back from a conference at the Mandalay Bay convention space or the Shark Reef aquarium.  Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating, and I would highly recommend the beef/steak quesadilla. Chips have the right amount of salt and are served warm (as all chips should be). The accompanying salsa options range from mild to hot, sure to satisfy anyone in your party.  Really a great little spot that I am glad we stumbled upon!

YcqgTHRsjPHKbL4rEh_nhw.text: This was honestly my favorite place last year. I was so excited to come back this year and introduce my boyfriend to this good food. I ordered the brunch all you can eat small plates... it was more than I remember it being. I checked the LA location for pricing and theirs is $30 which is $13 cheaper than the Vegas location. Also, they changed their menu which is expected but its mostly seafood which I don't eat. I still decided to try it for the other plate options. Service was insanely slow. I put in a request for 3 plates at a time and still they came out one by one and i was only getting one small plate every 40min. It ended up being a 3.5 hour lunch due to slow service and the food was watery and not packed with flavor. What happened here???

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamale 3/10 churro bites 7/10
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Salmon Toast. 3/10
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q26v-zacWNUAOthT9UsMaA.text: BEST BRUNCH EVER  Avocado toast, lobster cachapas, drunken peruvian toast, lemon blueberry poppyseed pancakes, manchego buiscuit and gravy, diablo, fried chicken, Peruvian shrimp and grits, steak and eggs, campechana, short rib has and eggs, churro tots x 2, chilaquiles, prickly pear chia parfait and 3 bottles of champagne with blood orange, prickypear, peach and orange juice. Great manager named Brian checked in on us  and great service by Tiffany! Brunched so hard we need a nap!!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless Mimosa
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View

m57Qm_UCpQm9ICF83sxZHA.text: Yummmmm! Holy crap on a cracker, this place was amazing. The vibe and ambience was perfect for a wonderful brunch. We sat outside with an incredible view of Mandalay Bay. Our server was as on point as you could get. She was funny, engaging, and made some amazing suggestions. Which was perfect because everything sounded so good we were struggle-busin' on what to get.   As you can see from my pictures, we ended up with an awesome array of goodies. The cheddar biscuit eggs Benedict was up there for me. Their version of a hollandaise was divine and the accompaniments were perfect pairings. The strawberry compote on the chicken and waffle made that dish a star. The bread pudding was good but when you had Gordon Ramsay's bread pudding TWICE the night before it can't compare. The steak with the steak and eggs dish was cooked a perfect mid-rare and had wonderful seasonings.   Everything was very delicious. The pricing was more than fair with the quality of food and amount you got. Chips and salsa was provided in the meantime but the food didn't take long to come out and our server paced us nicely. We will be back FOR SURE.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2B63ES1MQ5x1trRpSpwvRw.text: We live in NYC and we have been in Vegas for the past few days. This place is truly amazing, my husband had the special of the day lamb tacos and I had the fish tacos. Amazing!!!!!!!!We both work in hospitality business and we are extremely picky , cocktails as well were extremely good! Candice our server gave us one of the best costumer service we ever got!!! We will def come back and recommend this place to all our friends. Bravi!!!

GrHqyyv6cBwFdnV6BgqWIQ.text: The service at Border Grill Mandalay Bay is wonderful and everything else is simply average-to-underwhelming. The food and drink menu is notably a few tweaks away from being a good option. The restaurant and bar is conveniently located near the Convention Center.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MYRizuv41H4D7xJH6hJCyg.text: This is without a doubt the best Mexican food I have ever had bar none. The food was seasoned to perfection leaving your mouth waiting for the next bite with great anticipation.  ( Try the Brussels Sprouts! ).  The food temperatures were spot on and delivered to the table piping hot. Can't say enough good things about the food. The wait staff were absolutely wonderful. They were jovial and very accommodating. We felt like family there.  We sat out on the patio overlooking the Lazy River. This was a great spot as you could  look down and enjoy the antics of the people playing but not be disturbed by any noise. A must try if you like perfectly prepared food in a stunning location surrounded by happy, content diners. Just go already!

YIQYFfKJFhI7XlhH8WARfg.text: It's has been a few weeks since my first visit to this establishment and I really just want to say this was a wonderful occasion for my family I was floored by the amazing customer service from our waitress Tara (From Buffalo) and the GM of the restaurant. Seriously you guys made this an amazing experience for our large party with me being local this will not be my last time!   If you love Elote you seriously have to try it here &.. thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MUqNJP1PBCJrEplU1R8Omw.text: I had the Border Brunch here while staying in Mandalay Bay. It's $38.99 and although the menu advertises it as an All-You-Can-Eat, it ends up being more of a prix fix meal.   Our waiter told us he had an order of how the dishes should be served, so he would bring them out in rounds of 2 or 3, and we didn't end up ordering anything specific. If your waiter does that, remember any dishes you wanted to try, because at least in our case he didn't bring every single item from the menu out.   From the brunch options, my favorites were the steak & egg, chicken & waffle, and churro tots. If you try to eat every single item like we did, you will most likely get too full to re-order anything.   If you're looking for a tasting-menu type meal in Las Vegas from celebrity chefs, this brunch option is definitely one of the most affordable ones I've seen on the strip!   They also don't require the whole table to order the unlimited brunch, which is really nice since not everyone in your group may want to drop the $40.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited brunch: tamales and pigs in a croissant
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited brunch: chilaquiles, shrimp &amp; grits, steak &amp; egg
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited brunch: chicken &amp; waffle, Yucatán egg Benedict, bacon jalapeño pbj sandwich

S4kbDCqht_aUvnWC32lODA.text: Had this place for brunch. Went with the border brunch. Its a bit pricey but soo worth it. The service was excellent and everything we ordered was amazing. The chilaquiles are a must, the ceviche is packed with flavor and the yucca plate and the blueberry pancakes are delicious!!! We ordered almost everything on the brunch small plate menu and nothing disappointed!!  Definitely worth the price, this place is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummm!!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles are a must try!

UqXaUS0xz9ZRvEBnJxX_Zg.text: Stephanie was amazing! So friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere is fun and relaxed and the customers talkative and friendly. We ordered food to go, at the last minute, and everyone was so friendly about it. I would recommend this restaurant for a late night dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DuKFTnZBLRSBPTrp4JUhfg.text: We ate here when we came to Vegas without much spending money. We really wanted to try it and it sounded like the best place to eat in the area. We ended up drinking water, eating the chips with the many dipping sauces and then splitting the Tamale Sampler. We felt bad for the waitress so we left you a nice tip. I could sense she was mentally rolling her eyes at us when she heard what we would have. Next time we will go all out! Everything was so yummy.

fsVs2y07pBNj-7cY7y4oMQ.text: I am not the biggest mexican food fan, but this was a really good restaurant. The brisket taquitos were amazing and my siblings liked there choice of dishes too. Great service and outdoor space.

KIIvXQSmdJT1XO1I2AJwGA.text: Decent, authentic Mexican food at a fairly reasonable price - for Vegas. The staff was extremely sweet and helpful in finding a way for me to sit outside when they were full for the afternoon. Getting a little creative, they gave me my food and margarita to-go and let me sit in their currently closed outdoor downstairs seating area. The green chili tamales were good although a bit undercooked and the chips with various salsa accompaniments were all fairly flavorful. I wasn't blown away by the food but the overall experience would push me to return should I find myself at the Mandalay Bay again mid-day.

bQ2W8qhvSgaYJoc3GNA31g.text: So much on the menu here is just too needlessly expensive. Another victim of the "Hey it's Vegas, charge 75% more than that would cost anywhere else" mentality. In my opinion, you're better off hogging as many free chips as you can (the three salsas were well liked by everyone) and ordering a salad. That formula should get you full enough while being budget friendly. The salad I got was the Watercross, Avocado and Orange salad. It was delicious once I got rid of the avocado. It came with three bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with chorizo and blue cheese that created a flavor fiesta in my mouth. We had a nice outdoor table on a patio that overlooked the impressive Mandalay Bay pool. The restaurant is tucked in the very back of Mandalay Bay like it's some kind of ugly duckling.

evIRkmwBc-OKiSRejKmGbw.text: I really, really loved Border Grill and wanted to give them 5 stars, however they charge $1 for water (that is filtered tap water, but all restaurants are required to have filtered tap water, so its silly). The restaurant is really pretty inside and reminds me a bit of Frontera Grill in Chicago. We went for lunch and I had guac as an appetizer which was very, very good. The three salsas and chips were great too. My husband had steak tacos and enjoyed them and I had the chicken chiquilles which were good but had too many chip and not enough chicken. My red and green rice was very good too. Now as far as deserts go, we had the two half slice desert. We choose the Mexican chocolate cake which I wouldn't pick again and the banana cream pie which was OUT OF THIS WORLD. Our server was good and I would definitely go back and try something else.

lptd7ifuK9R-yihXw5M70Q.text: Had an excellent dinner on the patio.  Skirt steak was awesome.  Sangria is pricey at $12, but really good.  The star of the show was the dessert.  The flourless chocolate truffle cake in raspberry sauce with a side of fresh fruit is unreal.

vEXWL7Aqeg27n7xz_vMbaw.text: Delicious food and great ambience out on the patio.  Upscale but not at all pretentious or "Vegas-y."  The menu offers plenty of options whether you prefer red meat, chicken, seafood, or veggies.  Or if you simply want chips, salsa, and a beverage or two you'll be all set.  There's a special which includes a sampling of appetizers, a choice of several main courses, and a dessert.  This was a great value, as the apps and dessert were plenty to share with a few people.  The Green Chicken Poblano Enchiladas were great, even though I ended up mostly eating the chicken inside because I was saving room for the tres leches cake.  Yum!!

rgbmc3d6TA8XDMPweyQb5w.text: I can honestly say that while we were in Vegas we were treated alright in most of the restaurants, like most tourists, but here was different.  We were greeted by the manager, who was so friendly, he chatted with me about my passion for cooking and that I used to follow food television back before foodnetwork times.  Anyhow, I digress... What I am getting to is that this place felt like a hometown joint!  They service was great the food was delicious, the mojito was crisp and refreshing, and the dessert was AMAZING!  This place puts a new and fun spin on traditional, but the flavors were on point, and the whole experience was a blast!

6hMnnDrxaDqviRXQZTrQpw.text: 3 stars because the food was great. Service....different ball game. Walked in and didn't need a table for 1 so sat at the bar. Ladies took their time to get me a menu despite the fact there was only one couple at the bar - no big deal. Its the subtle snobs that really got to me - two other dudes show up and happen to sit on either side of where I was. I've been here close to 5 minutes now but not sure what I want to order, but its a Mexican restaurant so chips and salsa is expected, turns out not for me. I only got chips AFTER I placed my order. But the other two dudes get their chips with their menus within seconds. At which point I still want to take it as an oversight. My biggest issue is when the two ladies at the bar proceed to check on the two guys every so often but NOT ONCE did they ask if I was ok or needed anything. Suffice if you've stayed at Mandalay you do know about their souvenir alcohol cups from the beach so I guess showing up with one gave the "no tip impression!" I always divide my tab by 5 so still left a 20% tip, despite all this, but my main issue is I hope I didn't get this treatment because I was a black guy with dreads!! Stayed here often but just never visited Border Grill but now I know not to go back. One hell of a first time it was!!

URxg9ljEdWkXFssHQDpVTw.text: Planned a large dinner party for a work event at Border Grill for the 2nd year in a row.  After spending hours in a trade show hall, it's nice to dine out on the patio! :)  Great service, great prices and super tasty food!  I would recommend the skirt steak and their guac rocks.  Had dinner on Tues and then lunch again on Thurs. Love this place.

0Kr9mj_ooHmJpmKBFWh8sg.text: The brunch is well worth the money. The food and service were excellent.  Will definitely be going back.

kHTpKLiqKvrxRknorI9qpA.text: Had brunch here two weekends ago. Cannot express how wonderful it was.  We struggled to rank the items in order of deliciousness because each was as good as the next. I recommend the short rib hash, the shrimp and the tacos as a few of the best things I have ever eaten - with no exaggeration. And (here comes an incredibly egotistical sounding statement) I have eaten at many very famous restaurants.  Our server Christopher really made the experience special. Ask for him and tip him well!

Pz3sNT8FMZ37hn1FL-tOfg.text: We came to Vegas to see P!nk at Mandalay Bay. After a very long day of walking around we were famished and decided to take a chance and eat at Border Grill since it was right across from where the event center entrance. The food and service was excellent!!!! We haven't had such good authentic mexican food since we were actually in Mexico! They were a little pricey, but what isn't in Vegas. I don't mind spending a little extra money on food this good.

0WPLVgZBDg-PT9tEc8dcLA.text: Our experience at the Border Grill was excellent!!!  This is definite must go in VEGAS!!!! This is the #1 spot the food is great and the watermelon margarita is very refreshing and tasty totally recommend this place

B69mBobOXcc2KPNuwBJMlg.text: I'm kind of middle-of-the-road about this place.  Undoubtedly, the location is very nice, especially on the outdoor patio as you are right by the pool...  But i would say that the food and the service weren't worth the price you pay for it all.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and the guacamole, and I just didn't think that they were the best I ever tasted.  They were good, don't get me wrong, just not the best.  The drink orders were slow that day too, because (as the waitress explained) the bartender had a lot of orders to get out to the pool.

PQJYjq-OP0AsLA_gGWgqUw.text: Pretty good mexican food. I had the carnitas tacos and a margarita on the rocks. No complaints. BUT not worth 30 bucks either.

iD_p4UdBOsTnn2_TRJx2yw.text: Have been coming here on and off for years.  Border Shakers are among the best margarita's I have had (particularly for on the rocks margaritas), pricey but very good with fresh ingredients, like the lime juice.  I have found the food hit and miss here - some very good things like the tamales and cochinita pibil, and some very big misses like the tortilla soup and traditional flat layered enchiladas.  All in all a decent place, but inconsistent in terms of some good items, and others that miss the mark, and one never knows if what they order will be one or the other, unless you only stick to tried and True items.

_i34eKMwNdERryxO7zpo7A.text: Food was great!  My compliments to the Chef, and our Server was very pleasant as well.

0SWNw-2ze3KRKUlfk1xilw.text: I freakin LOVE this place! Try the portabello mushroom mulitas - decadent and delicious!!!! Not too expensive either (for Vegas prices) and the food is so good that any costs are well worth it. I saw a bloody mary with chile infused vodka on the menu that I must try next time!! Great atmosphere, good chips & salsa and friendly waitstaff. I highly recommend!

wiB6cSolAdbDbQW_EZgR_A.text: I can't remember the last time I walked out of a restaurant but we walked out of here on Saturday night.  Four of us ordered margaritas, the pomegrante & melon were delish but the Original one tasted AWFUl. We were seated at 8:15 and by 9:30pm still hadnt gotten our entrees. One of the girls in our party went to ask the server if he had forgotten about us. He was very rude so we decided to leave. The poor manager was gracious enough to pick up our drinks and appetizer but this really was the WORST dining experience of my life.

RgCJHH4C0MoCCouvJsm-3A.text: Had a great experience at Border Grill a couple of nights ago. We had just come from the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay so this was a convenient choice right around the corner.  We were seated in the back corner of the restaurant which was nice. It was dark but intimate and quiet. Our waiter was not the friendliest guy but he did let us know about the drink menu and the special of the night. I feel like when he found out that we were going to only get an appetizer and one entree (two of us) his attitude got even worse.  We started with the raja potato tacos appetizer which was amazing (there are only two tacos as an appetizer so not really enough to share.) They were different than any other type of taco I have had and really a flavor explosion. I'm not sure how to explain the texture of the potato but it was almost like a mashed potato that had been fried on a hard fried tortilla with chipotle crema. It also came with guacamole and a corn salsa. I would definitely order these many times again. In fact I think I will be craving these with no way to get them :(  We also had the carne asada quesadilla. It was also delicious. The carne asada was probably the best I have ever had. The meat just melted in your mouth along with the cheese. It was a tad bit on the too salty side but the guac and sour cream countered that a  bit. Overall the flavor was great, just cut down on the salt a bit.  Overall we had a good experience. Our service was just okay. The food was great. I would come back on another visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LlGWUwx5IW0p5rgn0lUXOw.text: Was not super impressed other than the great view and homemade chips. The dished looked lovely, but my carnitas was greasy and unappetizing even though it came recommended by my companion. She got a pork and plantain special that she liked. The rice was dry and didn't look/taste very appetizing. Blood orange lemonade which was also recommended was SO sweet. The place was busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas tacos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and plantain special

seu_i9duIO1zLY7-M_mJDw.text: Excellent customer service ! A group of 9 of us came to eat on a Friday at 12pm, we had forgotten that brunch and bottomless mimosas were only served on Saturday and Sunday. Not only did they make us brunch on a Friday but they also accommodated us for bottomless mimosas ! Our waitress Tiffany was perfect. Made sure we were always taken care for. Also big thanks to chef Mike for agreeing to accommodate us. Food was delicious! Food was traditional and tasted like my grandma had made it! It was a wait but it was well worth it. Overall great experience.

cnQ1ozz3VE5sb_QonUIAtQ.text: Best ceviche ever!  What a great find. I will have to visit to try something else on the menu or maybe just ordsr the Peruvian Ceviche again. Just delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I will have to visit to try something else on the menu or maybe just ordsr the Peruvian Ceviche again.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Bulldog or as they call it Patron Coronita Magarita
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh chips!

4I7kxehGZYhzquC9nWBJ2w.text: Went for brunch. Might be the best deal on the strip.  Tiffany was awesome. Will be back, coming hungry.

_-LH7EJTXKHURcdIm4yS3w.text: Food is very good. Came here for lunch yesterday. They have a great deal for a power lunch for $21- an app, main entree and dessert. The chips and salsa- out of this world! The salads are so fresh and yummy. Definitely come here if you are nearby. He had a fresh juice and power lunch- tamales, chicken mango salad, flan. I got a vodka soda, the chopped salad and cauliflower.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y5uRiZbhjxFfYyEDz1EgbQ.text: We walked to hell and back to get here... all the way from the Mirage! It was long but we were happy to get seated immediately and have a frosty peachy sangria. It was delicious and came in a large glass. Yum! Very good for a sweet sangria lover. We also started with guacamole, which was good. Loved the chips here, as they were just salty enough. They bring you 3 kinds of salsa, and our waitress also brought us a very hot version, which my friend enjoyed more than I, as I'm not a spice lover. The guacamole portion was huge!   I ordered the plantain empanadas, and my friend ordered the vegetable quesadilla. We didn't think we'd be able to eat an entree after all those chips and guacamole. Plus the heat had gotten to us and we weren't as hungry as we could've been. Our waitress recommended the empanadas, as I was on the fence about what I wanted. She described them as sweet and salty. The "dough" instead of being dough was from plantain, and they were stuffed with black beans, cheese, and poblanos. They were really delicious! My friend enjoyed her quesadilla, which was huge and came with more guac and sour cream, plus pico de gallo.   We ordered a brownie dessert to share, and it was large! It came with ice cream and was rich and delicious.  Our service here was the crowning jewel. Jamie was our server and she rocked! She was personable, gave great service, chatted with us and gave us great recommendations. She was the best server we had in Vegas.   We'd definitely come back (and take a cab next time)!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plantain empanadas

GgWDtk3OiTeRynMgf1m0Rg.text: So some friends and I all decide to come to Border Grill inside the Mandalay Bay for our last meal of our Vegas trip! We were pleasantly greeted by our server/bartender Rachel C. (#146). The food was delicious, weather outside was great and the prices were not bad! If you are looking for a good drink, try the Rum Punch! Lol
