photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Carne Asada tacos!

m7AVO-d9kXi8oPZOh4DHyw.text: Not bad, but not great. The chips and salsa were fantastic - that was the highlight of the meal. Ordered 3 mixed tacos which were just ok. Disappointed they didn't have Mexican coke. Not a lot of great places in Las Vegas but wouldn't rush back

o2HyRoP3J9jTIYsA_4xBjg.text: The steak in my tacos were drowning in sauce/marinade---drowning.  Of course, I got through it and ate every bite (I always do), but definitely not worth $28.  That's right you heard me, $28 for three mediocre tacos.  I don't think any taco is worth $28--ever.  What possessed me to order those????  Hunger does strange things to the mind.  Not worth it and I was mad all night that I ruined my dinner on the "so not worth it, $28 tacos."

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tacos, cheese and lettuce on the side.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $28 tacos.

ZEJCprgoIgSbOwrwFcCnLA.text: I love chefs Mary Sue Milliken and Susan Feniger, so I was looking forward to experiencing the restaurant during my stay.  The first night we ate at the bar and had a blood orange margarita with a mole rim and the citrus chicken quesadillas.  It was so good I did not want to stop eating, but I was stuffed.  On my last day, we had lunch there, also at the bar.  It was happy hour so the drinks were a little less expensive.  I had the spicy shrimp tacos.  Food, drink and service are phenomenal.  Prices are average; not overly pricy, but not cheap.  You are paying for quality in food and service, so just do it.  Go there.  Eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citrus chicken quesadillas.
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shrimp tacos.

F1mKBhpGW1MDAqA-VK5VBA.text: This place is crazy... they offer an AYCE small plates brunch... and I'm obviously also crazy because I did it. I think it's around $35.  Come with a big group for the obvious reason that you can share everything. You can literally order anything off the menu. Our server was very personable (told us his crazy Vegas stories) and helpful (he gave us small family style portions so we could try everything). My favorites were the corn tamale, breakfast fries, and steak and eggs. I didn't love the sweet dishes too much (might be just me though). I will admit that after a while everything started tasting similar. I think the running theme of the meal was eggs in every form possible.  A fun Mexican-themed alternative to your average brunch!

GomjEyKA0u9jsM6vlbSSdw.text: A tradition for a friend and I whenever we both in Vegas, we have Sunday brunch at the Border Grill.  Endless small plates of yummy food.  We spend a couple of hours doing this, which is heavily lubricated with endless mimosas that come in a variety of flavors.  We love it.   Some changes this time.  There's a new serve-yourself station that has a few items and where they'll make you a salad.  They seemed to have reworked their recipes a touch with the flavors being sharped some.  The poblano sauces really stood out well this time.  They're always changing their menu, and I was very unhappy to see the biscuits and gravy go.  That was a standard favorite of mine.  They've also reduced the individual serving size which I think is smart.  I can sample more items this way.  And if you want more, you can ask for it.  Plus, if you have a large table, they'll send several servings of a dish on a larger plate so everyone can take as much as they like.

G-1EEah-sY-4OoEMQ9U3mQ.text: My mom and I had lunch here while visiting from New England and were extremely impressed. Our waitress, Tiffany, was genuine and so helpful, and the food was amazing. I work on a farm that grows Microgreens and I was excited to see use of them here, it really made a great dish even better. We would go back regularly if we lived in the area!

xszFgHecIyCPhGsuFx823Q.text: Excellent service for private function at conference. Ciudad DR could be more brightly lit with higher end finishes.

EAFCxLpcfanhbWw7tS7f3g.text: The sevechi had such a strong mustard marinade that you could not taste the sevechi. The waitress was very nice and exchanged it for something else.

CZclaT8yWP-OaAdN6FqroA.text: Mediocre in a number of ways:  While the place was NOT full by any means I felt rushed from beginning to end  The prices are high (of course - it's Vegas) and the portions are small  Asked how large the large margarita was - waiter indicates bucket size so ordered a standard Patron which was small and little if any booze in it - $14  Was dining alone (my wife in the room with broken bones and a nurse) so indicated I would want a to go meal at the end, didn't actually specify what it would be, let alone order it until I ordered my flan - specified TWICE that I wanted the warm to go order 10 minutes after I got my flan. You guessed it!! Rush, rush get the bastard out the door as quick as possible and on to the next - my to go order comes with no sign of the flan. Thanks guys - you pretty much suck when it comes to service  The chile relleno ($19) was so so, the side of guacamole ($9.50) pretty tasteless, Carne asada quesadilla ($19 I believe) passable.

lW59Ou68bB5OydmUaPA8Zg.text: A bunch of my friends from Los Angeles had came into town and were staying at the Monte Carlo and they tell me that they were having a nice lunch at the border grill I stopped by yes you have to walk through Mandalay Bay to find it so unless you're staying at Mandalay Bay you will have to go out of your way but we were celebrating my girlfriends birthday and they brought out a complimentary tres leches  At the time I was eating red meat and my friend had ordered a steak and sliced off the piece and gave it to me and it was absolutely amazing I think one of the only reasons to go to this restaurant is for the steak and then margaritas they do have good deserts it's a little bit loud I've only been here once so I don't know what it's like at night and never been fond of going to places multiple times and was Vegas because there are so many thousands of options on the strip and around the strip in Summerlin Henderson and lake Las Vegas But if a tourist that was in Las Vegas at axed about it or I was in the lobby and someone asked me what I thought of the water Grill I would definitely say yes if you are into Mexican food this is a good place I didn't think it was too expensive I thought it was just a nice place to celebrate her birthday with friends

hDJxsR-nL4k3QojczZKyfg.text: We ordered: Octopus Asada 5/5 - octopus so tender, feels like you're eating fish!!  Fish Tacos Entree  Chili relleno - 4/5 Caramelized Plantains  Tres Leches - 6/5  OMG!! Everything we ordered was grrrreat!  Plus, HH margarita at the bar. You can order at the Bar and bring to your table.

uR0nH7ZoVAKltCACY-ajfA.text: Came here for lunch and was immediately greeted by 2 servers, Luis and Joaquin. They made us feel at home! They were attentive but not intrusive, all they wanted was to make sure we had a great dining experience. Very impressive! The food was very tasty as well, everything was fresh and well balanced.  We had the corn tamales (free when you check in on Yelp), chile relleno with carnitas and skirt steak. Everything was delicious! The corn tamales were made with fresh corn.  The entrees were well balanced, perfectly seasoned and had nice accompaniments.  I would definitely come back and will recommend this place to all our friends. Also, don't forget to ask for Luis and Joaquin!

4qh8g__muk9XmnMKoi74JQ.text: Ernoica is awesome. Attentive, sweet, wonderful. Ask for her and tip her well. Small plates concept (all u can order) and all you drink mimosas for $10 more and they come in all different flavors. A great deal and amazing service. Fully worthy of a later Sunday flight.

9TY5O9wDIfBjgpbeDKVbsw.text: The best Yucatan Pork (aka cochinita pibil) I have ever had! It was so tender and full of flavor, it melts in your mouth! Order it with corn tortillas and makes excellent tacos! One word, YUMMY!

OqOhWalZN1b2vsrdFLGQsw.text: Super disappointed. We ate here a couple years ago and it was really good so thought we would try again. The menu has changed. I ordered the Yucatan Pork and a salad. I thought it was joke at first. The waitress brought a small plate out with maybe a half cup of pork in banana leaves and not even a half of radish. At $28 they can not give you some rice or beans? So plan to leave hungry. When we tried to use our card comps to pay we watched the waitress ask the manager, he shock his head, and she came back and told us we had no points, a lie,when he did not even try.

oM6eKlY7k3La5vu4rZS4bQ.text: It's pretty close to the convention center inside Mandalay Bay. They serve really nice dishes - we had the vegetarian taco dish and a short rib burrito special that were both awesome. The cookies and milk dessert we had was unbelievable - $6 for 6 large, delicious chocolate cookies and a cup of silky ice cream....honestly could've been twice the price and still be a good deal.

5sFlrKt9TvmanVNPLK15zQ.text: The braised chicken tacos are fantastic. I wanted margaritas and the server told me how great their house tequila was so no need to order the patron. She was right, delicious. Waiters and hostesses were all very friendly and helpful. I would come back.

A-rWAjDo0FQ-iWChjLatAQ.text: Waiter at the Border Grill tried to bill me for $8 for sparkling water when the menu says it is 50 cents. And I double checked when he brought the bottle.  Shame on you Lars.

T_VYvO-h6GSarfOryIKP2g.text: My favorite Vegas eatery hands down!!! Great GF, veggie, vegan options. Sustainable and organic. Such a great spot! Faves are quinoa avocado tacos, ceviches, mojitos, and sweet corn tamales.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado tacos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado tacos!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice spread complete with complimentary chips and 3 salsas.

gEf98O26qUoUYI5vPsbKjQ.text: I came here for the fixed Sunday brunch menu.  There are some fun things to try but I did not feel it was worth the $50 price.  If they brought it down to $35 or $40 I'd be more into it but spending $60+ dollars each after (if you get a drink) seems really ridiculous for Sunday brunch.

Di2Iydkn57UfbYg7YKV6dw.text: I would not recommend this restaurants for anyone who has Celiac. I explained to the waitress that I had an allergy just not a gluten free lifestyle. She then said the chips are gluten free but made in a facility that processes wheat. I did not eat the chips. I ordered an item she assured me was gluten free and safe for me. It was not. I started having a reaction within about 10 minutes of finishing my meal.  I informed the manager just so no one else had an issues. His response was that they must have used the wrong flour. He didn't seem too upset that I will now be sick for the trade show I am out of town for.

EjAoK2QyP5bAm4IVFMpSxQ.text: Amazing Chips! Nice and warm with plenty of salt. Two stars for the mixed drinks. They were interesting, but not worth a second round. The food was decent. Very good salsa, but enteee's were bland, especially the enchiladas. We were also seated on the side of the restaurant rather than inside, so the atmosphere left a lot of be desired.

Sf8BkZToDVXbFQhRfQ5X_Q.text: Thank you Christina, Christy and Destiny for amazing brunch!! What a perfect place for groups to have a great experience. The food was perfect and the service 6 stars!!!! We will be back!!!

oUgdSzgsgGEHamca9Xd3yQ.text: I was excited to try this Top Chef Masters establishment, and I was not disappointed!  I am a Mexican food lover, and although this is not authentic - it's delicious. First, they give you a huge basket of crispy tasty tortilla chips with three different types of salsa. Perfect with the blanco margarita! I could have been fine on this alone.  I ordered the seasonal vegetable enchiladas, and my husband ordered the fish tacos. Both plates are exceptional. My enchiladas did not look like ordinary enchiladas. Instead, the tortillas were stacked with veggies and cheese between them. It reminded me of Mexican lasagna. I loved the fact that my enchiladas had roasted eggplant, zucchini, and brussell sprouts! My husband's fish tacos were crisp and fresh. He was quite delighted.  All in all, the service was friendly and pleasant. I would go back in a heartbeat!

MC3Os6ERIEoDg9omPaXIxw.text: Everything was fantastic, from the warm chips and delightful margarita to the very friendly service. I received a complimentary tamale as a first time customer they was great. My entree (chicken poblano enchiladas) was also fantastic.

3VcoQZEr9jCuozpQY1s3MA.text: Had a really great dinner once we finally found it!  Located in the farthest corner of the casino -- was a great setting once we got there!  They were doing something upstairs so we were lucky enough to have dinner in the downstairs dining room which has 20' high ceilings and a patio outside.  Probably beautiful in the summer but cold this time of year!  We had an EXCELLENT server -- ask for her if you go -- AUTUMN.  Very friendly and efficient.  We were lucky enough to have a great Travelzoo voucher and ended up with far more food than we could eat!!!!  Started with guacamole and baja ceviche.  We eat allot of poke and ceviche and their ceviche was great.  For mains we ordered a scallop shrimp combo over couscous and a yucatan pork.  The scallop shrimp combo was great.  The yucatan pork was cooked really well but we didn't care for the sauce -- it was kind of sweet. We also enjoyed two margaritas on the rocks!  Too full for dessert so we took some almond cake to go!  Lovely restaurant and we really enjoyed our dinner.  Wished we had ordered the skirt steak instead of the yucatan pork but otherwise everything was great.

qoGZr2uNIq4-_ROGZVP-ug.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas for a basketball league he was in. It was our last day and wanted to end our trip with a nice lunch before driving a couple hours home. We had just finished looking through Mandalay Bay`s Shark Reef and were getting hungry. The first place we came across was Border Grill and immediately gravitated towards it when I saw Susan Feninger`s name. Well-known chef for her modern twist on Mexican cuisine and cheftestant on Bravo`s "Top Chef Masters" season 1.  Looked at the menu for a bit. Border Grill doesn`t have that many options, so we decided to walk around Mandalay Bay to see if we were interested in anything else. Most of the restaurants in that part of the hotel weren`t open for lunch. We walked as far to Rum Jungle, didn`t want to walk to the other side of the hotel where they had more restaurants, and made our way back to Border Grill.  Border Grill looked to be very busy, even for lunch, the place was packed. As we were taken to our seats, we saw a couple things on people`s tables that intrigued us. The first thing to hit your table are fresh chips and three kinds of salsa. The chips were hot and not at all greasy. We took a glance at the menu and looked for some of those things that we saw on the way in. One was the Steak Nachos. They looked so good, so we knew we had to get an order of that to start. For our entrees, I ordered the Spicy Shrimp Tacos and my boyfriend got the Chicken Poblano Enchiladas.  When the Steak Nachos arrived at our table, I didn`t realize how big it was. I could have had that as my entree and would have been totally fine. Border Grill definitely doesn`t skimp on the toppings. A lot of good small sized pieces of steak, plenty of melty gooey cheese, onions, tomatoes, jalapenos, and big dollops of sour cream and guacamole. So amazing! The Spicy Shrimp Tacos we were really good. Chipotle marinated shrimp, cucumber slaw, guacamole, and a chipotle aioli. The tacos also come with rice and refried beans. The Chicken Poblano Enchiladas had smoked chicken, wrapped in corn tortillas, topped with poblano cream and a mix of grilled corn, mushrooms, and poblano chiles. OMG... that poblano cream was the best thing on that dish! So good! I would definitely go back for the poblano cream alone. Everything on the menu should be served with poblano cream. Yummy...

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Nachos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Shrimp Tacos
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Poblano Enchiladas

r3HJ9q3SPg2_LwKYlK_klw.text: My husband and I wanted to stay in Mandalay Bay for dinner before watching Michael Jackson One. We wanted a somewhat quick sit down dinner. Border Grill seemed to have the highest reviews and only $$.  Chips and 3 types of salsa: the chips were too salty for our liking, maybe it was just our batch? Guacamole: Amazing! Worth the $9 Plantain empanadas: Comes with 4, very delicious, not as sweet as you'd think, which I loved! Green corn tamales: A must get before your entree! Chicken poblano enchiladas: Just like the chips, they were so salty. Sips of water between bites were needed.  If you plan to watch Michael Jackson One, Border Grill provides a dinner package with show tickets. $42/person for a first, second, third course and dessert and discounted show tickets. My husband and I weren't too hungry so we decided not to take advantage of the package. But I think it's totally worth it!

D4lZpNtWbvDYpzFUD44omw.text: We had nachos that were on the specials list!  AWESOME!!!!  Nice to sit outside and relax.

5MaO26d4vZ8KsVuQn6upGw.text: Me and my wife came to this last weekend and we were both pleased with the food and service. We will definitely be coming back on our next vegas trip.

qxZkvmkHc0bWhzVkAh2gCQ.text: awful, I am being generous with 2 stars. I did not expect to pay $28.00 for a meal that was  ala carte. My meal was not even enough to feed a 7 year old. The  enchiladas were over cooked and the chicken tasted like it came from a can. Another thing I did not expect is to be served warm water from a glass liter bottle.  The only thing good about this place were the chips and salsa.

gMGo2hgzaw2OXiTtE9sA0Q.text: I wanted to try this place because I am a fan of the tv shows that I've seen the owners appear on. I was a little surprised to see the location which is near the convention center food court and slightly tucked away. It was nice that we got to sit out on the patio which overlooks the Mandalay Beach. The salsas were all very good but could've been more flavorful in my opinion. We had the Baja ceviche which was fantastic! I ordered a shrimp and vegetable quesadilla and it was great! Perfectly cooked shrimp with wonderfully marinated vegetables with just the right amount of cheese. The tortillas were deliciously crisp! I wish they had some new and exciting margaritas to try but maybe next time!

xyDA8jSS6vaqSFXVTAPjmA.text: Ok. So I had fairly high expectations for this restaurant as the chefs are a pretty big deal! My sister has been begging me to come here. The chips and salsa were great. Dare I say, the best part of the meal. I got a blanco margarita and it was so bland. It was very obviously a mix that had a distinct flavor. I asked for my margarita to have jalapeno and it came with 2 slices just floating around...lol. So I had to muddle it with my straw best as possible. As for our meal, we used the free check in and got the green corn tamales. They we're pretty good but very sweet. We also got the plantain empanadas which are great! Highly recommend getting those. For our meal, my sister got the octopus which she said was dry and disappointing. The small dish was half potato which seems odd for an octopus dish. Her friend got the fish tacos which she said were great, just difficult to pick up and eat. I got the guacamole, Brussels sprouts, and homemade tortillas. I was planning on making my own little veggie tacos. Brussels sprouts were supposed to have chorizo (yum) but after they came, I was informed that they do in fact not contain chorizo but they decided to not change the menu. It was very odd. The guacamole was really good! Tortillas were awesome but are small street taco size. I felt that $3 for a side of 3 tacos was a bit silly... to overall, this meal was OK. In all honesty, I wouldn't make the trek back down to try again.

9DHvevebW23T3XaEa7zanQ.text: This place serves quite possibly the best brunch I've ever had.  The service from our guy, Armando was second to none.   We read that it was the best brunch in Vegas so decided to give it a whirl. We were pleasantly surprised when we found out it was the restaurant of Mary Sue Milliken, chef celeb who we ironically saw in a Cadillac culinary taste challenge in LA a few weeks back. Her food was awesome so I was extremely happy to try her restaurant.   The brunch works like this:  Instead of the bacteria infested all you can eat buffett as most LV joints. Here you have a server who brings you out a tapas portion meal you can share. There are about 17 options and we had 8, sharing everything between 2 people.  OUr goal was to order 1 of everything but just couldn't do it to ourselves. The brunch for $30 per person also includes bottomless mimosas.  NOTE: DO NOT GET THE GUACAMOLE THEY OFFER--ITS A SCRAM TO BUMP UP YOURE ALREADY RICERY BRUNCH. TRUST ME YOU WILL BE SO STUFFED,, DON'T EVEN FILL UP ON THE CHIPS.   Everything was great but a few things did stand out:  -The breakfast enchilada -The eggs benedict -Biscuits and gravy -Asada taco  Left feeling really satisfied and the cost with our 15% discount by signing up for some Border club they offer was a reasonable $55.    LOVE THIS PLACE--just don't get the guac!!!! Oh and sit outside weather permitting, lovely view of the pool.

yaaqDQskJTRadqhG_aVYKA.text: Now that BG has a new chef, I decided to update my review! Menu overhaul has happened, the faves are still on board and some new treats to try. We are still major fans!   We've been thrice since Chef Chris came on board and have yet to be disappointed. We brought a bunch of friends here in March and loved our time. We had some food allergies in our group so we begged not to do family style and were elated when we were given the approval.   Came again in May with family and for the first time, remembered to ask for the Chef's secret brunch item (that wasn't so secret since it was on Facebook). The waitress looked at us like we were insane and said "we don't have secret items here." Then, when shown the picture: "Oh, we must not be giving those to the public." Lady, I'm pretty sure I've seen 4 other tables get the delicious Jalapeno Sorbet. Queue bringing the items out. She explained she just started in April... probably something that should be discussed before sending her out during brunch service.   Hopefully one of these times we will meet chef Chris since we've met Chef Mike several times (gotta get to Truck U!!)

oVxjKve6WworQnwLD7d0fg.text: I guess customer service doesn't exist... flavor doesn't either. We waited 30min to be seated after making a reservation a week before. Food took more than an hour to arrive... and was mediocre at best. Largely bland and flavorless, and incredibly overpriced. I've had better at Chipotle. We finish up with dessert that had run out.. (AKA we got none, after waiting 21 minutes) and they charged us for water. REALLY? Most disappointing experience of my Las Vegas trip. I would highly recommend going anywhere else -- even the cheapo food court nearby. Don't waste your time.

IFzrACMKr4r11zBqqeeI9A.text: Yum. The kobe tacos were great, and the chicken in mole was awesome too.especially the chocolate mole.that was definitely my favorite. Great service in vegas style.would definitely go back.

HmF41xQ04fRNzdUI6lBGDg.text: Really amazing staff! And not sore on the eyes either.   Food is standard Mexican at a decent price for Vegas standards, but come to think of it you don't really find Mexican grub on the strip so I guess it's a gem!  That was a run on sorry.   Also very accommodating to big groups and children :)

wJ2DrHXUIJIbZVYD-foMpQ.text: I have to say, I dined at both forums and Mandalay locations, and the forums location is by far way better.  They have different menus, which was disappointing. I was hoping to order the veggie/potato taco dish I got from the other location, and it wasn't on the menu. They couldn't even make it for me. Service was good. Food was okay. And I absolutely hate being served a wet plate, or anything that's wet in general, and the server gave us wet plates.  Gross in my book. Anyway, it was okay, just won't dine at this location again.

wFUMXbrQoliaIyd1ay8UZA.text: 5 stars! Wonderful spices and flavor combinations. Couldn't have been better. Can't wait to come back! The tomatillo sauce is amazing!

l5oc3W5YPSI8M7S_hZpNlQ.text: The food is OK but I did find they have a very heavy hand with sour flavors here. They give you three sauces with your chips. One is smokey, another is spicy and the green one was painfully sour. I went with the lunch special that was a halibut Torta. I thought it was nice that I could have spicy watermelon instead of fries. The watermelon was marinated in too much sour lime juice and was very painful to eat. The torta was OK but had a small amount of fish compared to the very large roll. My husband had the lunch burrito that was filled with chicken rice and black beans. He said it was OK because the chicken was moist but could have used some sauce in it.  OK food, it will do.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lunch Special Halibut Torta

wzpZoMzS_Zc9MldauNOcAg.text: Definitely the culinary highlight of our weekend in Vegas.  You can get a three course menu that lets you get a great sampling of what they have to offer.  The foods were both familiar and unique--a sweet corn tamale, chilaquiles with duck confit, plantain empanadas--just enough of a twist to make it stand out without trying too hard.  Everything ran to the spicy side, which was more than fine with me, but be warned if you don't like a little heat.  I balanced it with a cranberry margarita.  For dessert, the pastel Rufalina was an excellent choice, but probably large and rich enough for two or three people.  While the food was great, what really stood out was the customer service.  We received excellent service from start to finish--especially from our server, Jeff.  He knew the menu backward and forward, and made great suggestions without being pushy.  We also got terrific service from the bartender and the hostess.    After a ruined anniversary the night before at Craftsteak, this experience more than made up for it.  I'll be making this a must stop whenever I'm in Vegas.

vL3c2-SFXkKg0JWlohCs6Q.text: My boyfriend and I recently came here for brunch; the brunch special was outstanding and the service was excellent. We stayed there for three hours enjoying the view (overlooks the Mandalay Bay pool) and bottomless mimosas and Bloody Mary's. We both left very full, slightly intoxicated, and happy with our decision to eat here. We will certainly be back again in the future.

emBdBssOl5bUy3yZzKenMA.text: Eat here if you're looking for a gluten-free-conscious menu and awesome customer service! Everything from the chips and salsas, to the raspberry chipotle margarita, to the beer-battered fish tacos (GF!) was excellent. DELICIOSO!   We sat on the patio which was covered and lovely. Our food came out quickly and was awesome. We'll definitely be returning on our next trip to Las Vegas. I'm very happy with our choice tonight.

91WTcvJ6tIwHJtp64Q_J1w.text: Love the fun and modern Mexican twist and Autumn our server was plucky and gracious- we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. enchiladas were wonderful

hmPk_OhSOqzz2vO5ch95_g.text: Been here for brunch once before and I wanted to come back and bring the husband. Was disappointed in the quality of food compared to the first visit. Everything was overloaded in sauces and came out luke warm. Good flavor but cold eggs are never yummy!

j_j_F1HrftGbdWrrNnPTtg.text: Good food. Very different but really overpriced. It's not the Mexican food that you would normally relate to. If you want chips salsa and guac. Stick with the authentic Mexican restaurant. This is very Americanized Mexican food.  I won't repeat this again.

Km1EPbYcPqVJ4ec3HtGS6Q.text: Bland food, tiny portions - dinners looked like appetizers - and big price, not a combination for a positive review or a return visit. Our server was the best part of the meal - by far.  Want good Mexican? Go to Juan's Flaming Fajitas on Tropicana, off the strip a few miles, well with the trip ......see my review of Juan's for more info.

mvmJTFtIs6Wudg2n60SIBg.text: Love the view of outside. The service was great. The food was a bomb. We got there when they just opened in the morning. Quickly, we got the table outside to sit down as we request, there was no waiting in line or anything(Thump up).. Hint: if you dont want to wait in line, please a reservation before, it would help you much because after 30 mins we sat down, the place got filled up really fast. We got the all you can eat selection menu with the unlimited mimosa. Hooray! The foods were good selections and best description on each dishes would go to my table service man. He was excellent, not to aggressive on coming back and check on our table. Very funny and friendly guy. I love the service. Specially each dishes was good portion to eat and enjoy with the glass of mimosa. definitely will come back here next time.

O1Ckxi1il_xX03YOTlfKcw.text: Restaurant week restaurant two where the food was so good and the portions so big I could barely eat for 24 hours following and took some of my meal home! Lol Manuel was the server and he was great... Very attentive and made great recommendations. I got the skinny mango margarita and it was really good but not enough mango flavor. The tuna ceviche like appetizer was great as the tuna was really fresh and the flavors popped. The date salad had too much lime for me. The seafood enchiladas were great with a fresh slaw on top, very filling and very good. The steak was fatty but the nachos underneath it were gooey and yummy. The whoopie pie dessert was nice and light but the cake was dry without a lot of chocolate flavor. But the horchata cinnamon milk and the caramel that came with it were fabulous... Could have drank a whole glass and the caramel wasnt heavy so added a nice touch for moistness. Definitely enjoyed the meal and saw some other things on the main menu I want to try!  As a big top chef fan it was nice to try this place. It isn't near the other Mandalay restaurants so it's easier to park near the convention center than the garage and we sat outside because freezing inside but the fan outside did little to keep us cool. The view of the Mandalay pool at night was really a nice touch though.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whoopie pies
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood enchilada
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho steak

435vcLNb97LolKbhTOvNwA.text: I have been wanting to go to Border Grill since it opened. Finally made a reservation for Valentine's Day and it was excellent. Did not disappoint.

3LY-uUHgWLjcA1PjOvsmMw.text: I was glad to see one of the better Santa Monica Mexican restaurants in the Mandalay, where I was "stuck" for several days on business.   The restaurant has both indoor and exterior seating and after being in the smoking, dated Mandalay, I was super happy to enjoy 3 lunches at Border Grill.   As with every Border Grill lunch or dinner, complimentary house made chips and sals are rolled out. We shared the guacamole which is every bit as good as good as the SaMo location. There is a lunch special ahi tacos on the menu which sounded good, but I really wanted a light salad. I asked if they could take the ahi and substitute for the the steak on their normal steak salad. This, with a light vinaigrette made for a very refreshing and light meal.   I love the flexibility! Great service in Vegas!

uiFUp8NAtZIMeAyaaIp5bQ.text: Best weekend brunch in town, small plate masterpieces as much as you can put down, add unlimited mimosas, micholadas and bloody Mary's and your set.

YLOj9mW9BBoeOhtFDXhfZg.text: Very solid Mexican food, which really isn't as expensive as it could be given it's location in Mandalay Bay. The portions aren't huge but they are filling, and our waiters were incredibly friendly. If I didn't already have amazing Mexican food earlier in the week, I might have rated it higher, especially given that they have a Yelp check-in offer of green corn tamales that are awesome.   Per the waiter's recommendation, I went with the steak tacos, an item not listed on the menu. There were three, they came loaded with guacamole, and they hit the spot. It definitely warrants a side order though and disappointingly the rice and beans were just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Tacos

rH2WxPdW6zxUEZuxfiiWgQ.text: Brisket taquitos are excellent. Less than 5 minutes from order to service. Water stays on table, no waiting for servers. Tiffany, our server, was one of the most friendly in the industry I've encountered.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time at Border Grill and what a refreshing place. Prompt, friendly service, sustainable philosophy, and delicious menu.

28yd455xGuck4bwrymXoPQ.text: Great service! A little bit sad because Brunch specials happen only Saturday & Sunday. But we still had the bottomless mimosas with some great food!   I come here everytime I come to vegas.  Definitely recommended!!

6e9wAC-tCbYe6D4yPaLQhA.text: Yuck!  Very, very overpriced Buffett with almost unappetizing plates.  Any meat was over salted to the point of being inedible, and any egg was undercooked to the point of undone white.  Sent back the churros twice because despite being dark brown, the batter was still completely raw.  The manager came to apologize but no offer of comping anything??  Two of our party had menu dishes and both were somewhat cold.  Service was spotty-refilling chips and water glasses had to be requested.  Overall, a big disappointment.  Run!

sTPy1vZNm6j3ROGWgH-jNg.text: My husband and I recently became Vegans and were stoked to find so many vegan dining options available in Las Vegas. We had an entire dining schedule mapped out for our recent visit which also happened to be our first visit since becoming parents a year and a half ago  Ha!   However, we found that we drank too much and often didn't make it out of our hotel (Bellagio) which was surprisingly lacking many vegan options, so we were really looking forward to visiting Border Grill. We decided to try brunch on Saturday April 14.   When we walked up the hostesses were chatting amongst themselves but finally looked up at us, saying nothing...we finally broke the awkward silence by saying that we would like a table for two. The young lady escorted us to a table and handed us the regular menu at which time I advised that we actually need the vegan menu, she replied saying that she wasn't sure that they were serving it, but she would ask, as we were the second party to request it. WTH? My heart sank, I needed to be fed! Lol And I was soooo looking forward to this! I was almost in a full blown panic by the time she returned with the vegan menu....yay!!!   It was a bumpy start, but let me tell you that was the end of any snafu's. A lovely man, whose name I do not recall, but I believe he was the manager, came over after that and introduced himself; I swear he was like an angel! Lol He answered all of our questions and took such good care of us!!!! We started with guacamole and chips as well as some type of taquito or flauta, I don't recall exactly because it's been a few weeks, but whatever it was, it was amazing! I ordered the "beef" enchiladas and my husband had the mushroom tacos and I swear it was one of the best meals we have ever had, vegan or otherwise. Such amazing flavors and textures, everything was spot on, I wouldn't change a thing. When I asked what type of "beef" they used, the manager explained that it was The Impossible burger, which we have had before and love, but he went so far as to bring us a little side of it from the kitchen to try. He even researched what it is made from and gave us the 411 on that too. Above and beyond, best service, ever!!!   My husband and I agree that after going vegan, it's not uncommon to have a meal and afterwards say, " It wasn't bad, for being vegan". There are definitely times when you feel the pain of your sacrifice (still worth it though). You will not have that experience here, the food and service are amazing, no sacrifice needed! I would drive back to Vegas, from Redondo Beach, just to eat there again. You guys need to open a full vegan restaurant, seriously! We talked about this meal for the rest of our trip and if we hadn't left the next day, we would have gone back for more!   To the folks at Border Grill, thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!  Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Beef&#34; Enchiladas with Poblano Cashew Cream...this dish will change your life!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Tacos

72vFTb3v03QVL-dZzGWhWw.text: Ordered a Carne Asada taco and a strawberry Mojitos. Just so disappointing. No flavor with the tacos, tortilla was dry, side beans and rice were dry. And the strawberry mojito was actually disgusting. Only thing I have to say was good was the guacamole but it was a very small amount provided on the dish. The chips and salsa on the other hand were not tasty. The chips were too oily and the salsa nothing special.

mvWMlrrpeN2uvd1CzJZbrg.text: This place needs some organization at the front where you enter at pool level outdoors.  You really cannot tell where to walk in. Also the outdoor tables do not seem to have been cleaned off.  We had to ask for utensils and napkins.  The wait for our food was excessive. The chips and salsa that they bring to your table are not very good. The salsa is in teeny little containers it is hard to even dip the chips in. Food just OK. However it is way better than eating off of the menu at the pool.

xx9OxgdGILrwSsF_1X9lrg.text: Wonderful lunch option if you are spending the day at the Mandalay Bay pool area.  Though a bit of a hike (isn't everything in the larger casinos?) well worth it! Casual shaded patio offers a great break from  the blazing sun. The food is super fresh, attractive and presented in solid  portions. The service is friendly and attentive but never rushed. We liked it so much we went back the next day.

kk1LNVwnkNr4Clz3GtS-sw.text: Today is my birthday and this will the best place I could have eaten at. After walking around the casino looking for vegan food I stumbled here without even knowing that they had a vegan month long celebration where proceeds go to support Cruelty Against Animals organizations. I loved everything I ate - empanadas and nachos with Impossible beef, tofu enchiladas, and finally chocolate sorbet with fresh fruit. The host even shared a delicious coconut milk fruit parfait from the brunch buffet. Thank you Border Grill for a meal that I will remember fondly.

nwxMrUDAEy1frPS6QbIRIg.text: The food was amazing!! Met a friend for dinner, we got right in. The staff was very friendly and fast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The biggest fish tacos ever!!

1bkthMZusbbHmXOB30H33w.text: Appreciated the chef making the Veganuary menu items for us.   And boy am I glad this happened!!!  The food was OUT-standing.  Excellent portion sizes and way too much food for us.   We still managed to put every bit of it away heh.  Vegan Chile Relleno and Beef Nachos was my favorite.  We will be back!  Hoping they make some of these items a permanent part of their menu.

fiX0gjBDnwZOsrmtPgxSYA.text: Excellent place for quality food.. the shrimp and scallops dish with butternut squash puree was so good I wanted to lick the plate! Drinks are good, strawberry margaritas on the rocks are amazing and not too sweet. Queso fundido is great ask for it with steak in it. Was very surprised by this little gem. Bartenders work hard to serve you and make a perfect cocktail.

Hu76aDHtXxFg7BbnNxWxzw.text: I was actually throughly impressed by Border Grill. I did not have high expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. The chips and trio of salsas were yummy. We got the carne aside tacos which were awesome and enjoyed the meat. I could have used a little bit spicer of a hot sauce and the service was a little slow, considering it was lunch mid week and not too many people in the restaurant. I will be back though!

5Y8XY83EJdbCw9sRF4GZJQ.text: Tomatoes are red, Tamales fresh to order, For top notch Mexican, You go to the border?!?  Go figure I'd start this review with a poem, but all joking aside Border Grill surprised me and really is poetry in motion!  During a recent stay at Mandalay Bay we wound up here with back to back visits for lunch and dinner which pretty much speaks for itself. The wife had been wanting to eat here and I was hesitant because to me it seemed like a healthy alternative to Mexican food I'm used to, but I'm the end I would certainly return for more.  So our first outing was for lunch and we had decided to sit on the patio area which overlooked the pool area so take note should you feel the need to people watch as you eat.   With a Yelp check in they provide you a sampling of the green corn tamale which I did feel was a nice touch. The tomatoes tasted fresh and were pretty crisp and the sour cream was light and creamy, but the sweet corn for me didn't quite knock my socks off as I had hoped. To me it tasted identical to the one from El Torito which was a bummer.   For the main attraction I set my sights on their tacos and of course I went for the "tres especial" dabbling in carnitas, spicy shrimp, and carne asada. The carne asada was actually very tender and the marinade complimented the meat very well giving it a little twang bite to bite. I must say the carnitas was a hit as the braised pork was melt in your mouth AND in your hand soft (take that M&M's). Lastly came the shrimp and what I enjoyed was the seasoning of the shrimp as it gave it a slight kick, but nothing too overpowering.  For my dinner outing, since the tacos were all cooked to the nine I figured they knew how to cook their meat very well so I set my sights on the skirt steak. My only thought was being a mariachi band short of a fiesta as I didn't enjoy my experience at all with this one. I had asked for medium rare as I always do and it was extremely rough on the ends of my steak and towards the middle I had about two exceptional bites of tenderness, but it did appear borderline raw which even I won't mess with. I wanted to ask for a replacement yet didn't want to hold up the group so I dealt with it, but that was very disappointing. It's saying a lot if I found the roasted tomato a highlight of the meal!  All in all, I'm delivering a rare three star experience mainly because of inconsistency between lunch and dinner..I feel it was just so-so overall of an experience and I'd be doing a disservice honestly if I said any different..I will be back again as my wife fell in love with border grill after both sittings. I'll cross my fingers in hopes I do the same!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skirt Steak
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Taco
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Corn Tamales

kBOiAKwuKStqHla5esDtxQ.text: I recently went to a conference at the Mandalay Bay convention center and was taken here 4 times in a 5 day span. It is convenient since it's so close to the conference hall. Even though I could recite the menu by heart by now, it is not a bad place to go. Even after eating there multiple times, I am still giving it 4 stars. The carnitas were surprisingly tender. Guacamole and chips are good. I had an appetizer which was really good, I think it was beef with pineapple salsa? I was pleasantly surprised and wanted more! I would go here again, but am also happy I don't have to for another year

zrPRw2d2XPn5tbPN6DViow.text: The Border Grill at the Mandalay Bay Hotel is by far better than the Caesars Palace location. We have dined at the Mandalay one about 5 times for both lunch and dinner. We were so impressed and satisfied each and every time. From the ambiance to the servers to the delicious food.... it is all outstanding. My husband and I enjoyed this restaurant so much we decided to have our 40 guest wedding reception dinner there this past May. Our favorite server, Brandon, is always on point, even exceeding our dining expectations. The chefs are all amazing in their craft. We have yet to try a menu item that we haven't liked. My husband is a big time meat eater but he even enjoyed trying their vegetarian options too. But the mango sorbet there is heavenly!

VRy7yv0UEqOK-wMAbxplkw.text: My review is more about the event staff. Serena Dominguez, the wedding event planner, is such a great help! She replied to my e-mails extremely quickly and was more than accommodating. Unfortunately, our plans took a different turn and we will not be hosting our reception at the Border Grill. But I wanted to give a shout out to Serena for being awesome! I would definitely recommend her service for your planning needs!

MsU1sRk_sOtm5Bon44w8Iw.text: Wow! Absolutely amazing ! I was expecting some boring tex mex but this is far from it , and far from The border I was thinking of . There is a lot of South American styled dishes that are amazing !

QDRWTMbJgOpf6cj092JOjQ.text: If you like to explore a variety of flavors and textures then you have come to the right place!  My husband does not...he is a simple meat and potato man.  However, I love to be adventurous!  I was not let down!  The chips were fresh with three different salsas to explore.  We tried the pork dish and even my husband devoured it!  There were plantains that were perfectly sweet, a relish that was perfectly tart, then the amazing pork in a phenomenal salty yet sweet sauce.  It all went together so well!  The waitress was also amazing!  She told us things to do in Vegas and made all the food suggestions we tried.  The view was beautiful.  We ended our meal with a churro dessert that I barely got to taste because my husband devoured it!  It was to die for!  Crispy churros with ice cream and fruit...yummy!  My husband came out if his food shell and I was glad he did!  You have got to try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RF2VWvK-ZqYnD-Wwo6Ah3w.text: A really blow your socks off all you can eat brunch menu. Don't bother looking at the regular lunch menu - that one has pretty standard Mexican fare which may be good but then you'll be missing out on the very unique brunch selection. It's slightly pricey at $42.99 but it is Vegas and it is all you can eat of very refined small plates. The menu has about 16 different dishes so a lot of variety. We ambitiously tried to eat about 13 of them off the menu between 2 people and we just barely made it. I never thought I would be able to eat again but it was so good I kept taking bites.  The brunch has some secret menu items. The chef's secret pancakes that day were a lemon poppy seed with blueberry compote. Really unique with the poppy seeds and pretty complex in flavor - it wasn't like it was just sweet or just pancakes. Another secret slash off menu item were the guava empanadas that were brought over without any prompting. This one was flaky, flavored well and not too sweet.  I'll reiterate that there are a lot of items on this menu and it's amazing at how well executed every single dish was. The Peruvian shrimp and grits featured creamy, luxurious grits with two big shrimps and a punchy aji panca salsa. The short rib hash and egg had amazingly tender short ribs that were melt in your mouth. Another standout was the steak and eggs that again featured a really prime cut of meat that was almost melt in your mouth tender but with great flavors from the chipotle sauce and guacamole. I'm not a huge fan of corn but the green corn tamales were something else. I've never had corn like that before or I would seriously be a fan. The corn was so sweet and unadulterated with anything else it was just eye opening for me. We did have a lot of other dishes that were also great but those were some of the ones that come to mind for me first.  We opted to sit on the patio of the restaurant and I'm not going to lie it was a little warm out there towards the end of August. If you sit closer to the doors though you get some AC when people are walking in and out. The view looks out onto the Mandalay Bay's lazy river, wave pool, and other pool facilities which is a nice backdrop for a meal. The washrooms are located outside of the restaurant, down the stairs by the conference room facilities. I know there are a few Border Grill locations in LA as well so I'll have to check them out but if you're in Vegas, I highly recommend coming for the brunch menu!

2ky2xaZjdoKzEF1uf6Wrwg.text: Can't say enough about this place. We had brunch there on Sunday and you get SO much MORE than you pay for!! From the service to the food and drinks. Bottomless mimosas with more flavor selections than I knew were possible and bottomless FOOD!!! Who does that ? And all great tasting and good quality! I want to go back to vegas just for their brunch and all that for less than you would pay for breakfast and one drink anywhere else!!! Highlight of my trip.  Just had them again and same thing amazing food and amazing service. Jenifer and Erica took such good care of us

0CgbAELGL0-puza3aVH4uw.text: Convention Center restaurant. Busy as all get out! But bring me I managed to snag two seats at the bar. Jenn was her name and drinks were her game!  Very personable bartender. I had a good old fashioned blood orange Rita and a glass of water which cost a donation of $.50. Whateves- good cause and thirsty as all get out in the Desert. It was fantastic!! My friend had cheese enchiladas and I had brisket taquitos with a jalapeno slaw rice and tomatillo salsa. It was fresh spicy and delicious.  Jenn took great care of us especially when we had to dash all of a sudden like!   They were backed up with a delay of water chips/salsa and iced tea. Since it's a convention center a little surprised they wouldn't have been prepared but it was minor.   Kev was also the other rockin cool guy workin the bar!   Thanks! Would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wt7bt86yrmUGlCOPkNBuxA.text: What I got: Yucatan Pork ($26), Empanadas ($9), Fish Tacos ($18)  Pros: - If you use the yelp promotion, you can get free green corn tamales. This was my first time trying a tamale and was my favourite item I ate here. It is a corn husk wrapper with mashed sweet corn inside that you eat with salsa and sour cream. It was delicious.  - Yucatan Pork was a huge portion, fried plantains and an orange that you squeeze on top makes the flavor sweet and savory- which was really good.   Cons: - Located in the Mandalay Bay hotel, this place can be a bit hard to find bc it's not in the same row as the food court. Be sure to ask for a map.  - Fish tacos wasn't as good as the other items- it was also hard to eat bc the ingredients were piled very high. The fish also seemed to be grilled instead of the usual fried crispy fish but that's probably healthier.

HXnm2NpmRAxCd1pSWlNLyg.text: I stopped in for restaurant week 2019 with a few friends for lunch on a weekday. The restaurant was busy but there was plenty of bar seating and we were able to order off the full menu there so that's where we set up.   I started with one of their seasonal mojitos, which was refreshing and I'd want to come back later in the year to see what other fruits and combinations they do (the one I had this time was blackberry).  For my appetizer I went with the green corn tamales which are made with sweet corn. This was probably my favorite part of the meal and something I'd go back to again. For my entree I chose the shrimp tacos and with the warm shrimp, cold slaw on top, and crunchy jicama, they were perfect. For restaurant week, we received 3 tacos per entree, which was plenty especially when we also had a dessert coming. I chose the tres leches cake which was ice cold and creamy.   I'm looking forward to coming back again when I have friends staying down near the Mandalay Bay and I want to meet them somewhere for a filling lunch without too high of strip prices.

Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches cake

kCFYwXvtHvK2ttPbe59nRA.text: This was my 2nd time dining here and the experience was not even close to my 3 star review from last time. The most egregious issue with our dining experience is that 90% of the food was served practically cold from the refrigerator. We were there right when it opened so we could only assume that the food was pulled straight out of the icebox and not given enough time to properly heat.  After 90 minutes I ordered one final diablo fried chicken and it was finally warm so if you want to take your chances on the tapas weekend brunch I recommend coming later versus right when they open at 10am.  The diablo fried chicken and the steak and eggs and ceviche (very small portion) were probably the standouts. The avocado toast was nothing special. The lobster wasn't even detectable in that tapa. We did note that some items were really small while others a larger portion.   The wait to get food was really long so only come here if you have a minimum of 90 minutes. Our server didn't seem to want to be there so that didn't help our dining experience. Definitely won't be returning to this restaurant with just so many better restaurants in Vegas.

KhMpc1MrUul7zPO2qMAfNA.text: Rather disappointed in this restaurant owned by famous chefs. The food was inconsistent. The salad dressing was very one note. The skirt steak added to the salad was cooked very well. The chips and salsa nothing special. The blue corn tamales were delicious though and free with a yelp check in.

3VAKJE4QaAuXzIpPpTw9MA.text: My favorite spot in the Mandalay for a "relatively" affordable lunch and dinner. Make sure to check-in on Yelp for a free tamale!  They give you complimentary chips and three types of salsa which I love. The salsas are great and the chips are freshly fried.  The Border Ceviche was delicious. I liked that they gave you plantain chips to complement. I recommend this dish but note it may not be filling on its own.  There's really nothing I disliked about this spot, I would come back whenever I'm in the Mandalay Bay.

lVaNWcvE--Z1cGEbHlvExg.text: Wow! We came here for Mexican food and while it wasn't the type of Mexican we were looking for (more casual dining) the food was incredible! This is definitely more 'upscale' Mexican and we all loved it. I think we were a little leery of the menu at first since it is small and we were not sure what everything was, but we just went with it and were not disappointed. The items we had were the plantain empanadas, Al pastor tacos, brisket taquitos, and the the fish tacos. The portions were small, but we all left full, which was unfortunately since we really wanted to try dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple pork tacos - so good!

uUBp8lcm2D08juElevJ9FA.text: I aways wanted to experience this restaurant because a lot of people have said its amazing, and because I have friends who are Mexican I look for the place to be authentic with their food items, that's very important to me. With that said:  Waitress: Autumn she was very knowledgeable and welcoming. I in no way felt I was being rushed or overly checked on. She was great and provided 5 star service with patience.  Food: short rib enchiladas & churro ice cream sandwich..both were great   Appetizer: cheese with jalapeno and green corn tamale this tamale was my favorite tamale I have tasted with a side of sour cream and pinto de gallo was very light but tasty.  Drink: this is actually a secret drink on the weekdays that I found right up my ally (Autumn recommended it after I couldn't decide what margarita I wanted) It's called Pineapple vinallea bean margarita..Two words: smooth and delicious for a day time cocktail.  Ambiance: I asked to be seated outside on the balcony and it was the best choice, I had views of the lazy river and great lighting which made the vibe more memorable.   Over all I would come back and recommend, thank you Border Grill for my first experience exceeding my expectations.

iq8VYj-vdLvY__ptjjg2xA.text: Very cute place in Mandalay Bay. We made reservations so we had our table ready  when we arrived. Our waiters introduced themselves and told us the specials for the night. We got free corn tamales as a appetizers which was amazing. The salsas and tortilla chips tasted fresh and delicious as well.  We also had Mexican corn dip which was also really good.  For entree my friend and I got one of the specials. A Peruvian dish that consisted of beef tenderloin, peppers, onions, tomatoes and steak fries. The meal came on a sizzling skillet. Flavors were amazing. Prob. One of the best dining experience/food I had in Vegas.  Great last dinner in Vegas for sure!

Lz_iNTOfGUT2vBF1xpGE7Q.text: My friends had been to the Border Grill in LA and they loved it.  So when we were walking through Mandalay Bay and came across Border Grill, we just had to stop in.  It worked out because we were both thirsty and hungry.  Our group was sat immediately, then we were quickly greeted by the most informative, patient, and friendly server.  He answered all our questions and gave us great suggestions.  Starting with their house margarita.  We loved it so much we not only ordered one pitcher, but two.  They make the margarita mix from scratch and it tastes perfect.  It is not too sweet or sour, it is just right.  For dinner he suggested the tacos, but to go further than that he suggested getting a trio of tacos and getting 3 different tacos that they offer.  I of course listened to the professional and again he did not steer me wrong.  I went with the carnitas, spicy shrimp, and fish a la plancha.  They were all delicious.  My favorite was the carnitas, but the other two tacos were so super close behind.  We also grazed on chips, salsa, and fresh made guacamole.  Overall everything was great at Border Grill!  Our server was the best.  He took such great care of us.  The food was amazing and the margaritas were mixed to perfection.  We actually had a good time at Border Grill.  The atmosphere was fun.  I highly suggest you checking it out when you are in Mandalay Bay!!!!

kUHbUvzn7Ht5tfFA1f3hVA.text: This is my second time here and I'm leaving it just as happy as the first time! Great service, friendly staff, delicious food. I love their bloody Mary's and Micheladas. Brunch was a great option to try so much different food.

yIZhvmMsjbRfQOefIF41iQ.text: Okay y'all. This is the dark horse best scallops I've ever had. And I've had some good scallops, seeing as I lived in Florida for a few years. Just wanted to say that first for those who skim.   I'm local, so my mom suggested I try it out here. Straight to food: we got a blood orange mojito. Sparkling white peach lemonade. Free chips and salsa. 2 free sweet corn tamales (not on menu - ask about them). Al pastor tacos. And shrimp & scallops a la plancha. And a plain flour tortilla.   The peach lemonade was delicious. Mojito was a bit heavy handed on tequila, which is probably an upside for other people. The tomatillo salsa was the clear winner, but the other two were smoky and tasty. The tortilla chips are really well done. I'd buy just their salsa and chips to take home if I could conveniently do that. The sweet corn tamale wasn't what I'd call a tamale, but was 4 bites of deliciousness, complemented very well by the sour cream, which I assume is made from scratch.   Entrees: my boyfriend is a simple man, so got the tacos. The meat was super juicy. It comes with three on a plate, but he only ate one there. He says the marinade on the meat was the best part.   I got the shrimp and scallops. It was omg so good. The ancho chile reduction is too good to explain fully. It was not spicy, but had that good flavor of heat in it. The scallops were so soft, I could have just spun my fork in it. The paella bites were a lot more mild in flavor, which was a nice break. Shrimp had a nice charcoal flavor, the squash made everything a bit sweet. Just. So good. Still in heaven. I had to take some home, but I ate all the scallops there and pretty much cleaned the 1/2 of the plate I ate.   The chairs were comfortable. Our server was extremely animated, but seemed to genuinely enjoy being able to give people good food. I think we undertipped now that I'm reviewing math, but I'll hopefully come back and overtip to compensate. The art style is weird - I've never been a fan of that style. But I do respect the continuity from the walls to the napkins to the plates.   I'm going in for surgery this week, so today was our last hurrah. I told my boyfriend that I'm fine if I can't eat solids for a few weeks because this meal was good enough to make up for it.

jK-dJy1NGGZI2lsfRavCSg.text: Had to try this place out. Drinks (Cadillac)  are good, chips and salsa are very good. The menu seems pretty extensive and the quality is very good.  Maybe a tad pricey but you are in the Mandalay Bay which is quite nice. I thought it was good and well worth price.

6bumG6Mxqa_Hbcu4XkJh_g.text: I made reservations on Open Table for five but then needed a table for seven only there were no seven tops available so another person in the party asked for a two top reservation at the same time and requested it be as close to the five top under my name. Um, hello!! When we got there, they knew exactly who we were and gave us a table for seven! So awesome. Service was excellent and so was the food. This business meal could not have gone better. Bonus points with the boss because she loved her dinner was a definite plus!

vpvi8jR6voujEEfoRL5d8g.text: Vegan heaven!!! Their vegan menu is legit!!  I have been dying to check out their new vegan menu with the Impossible Burger 2.0 and wowsers!!! Holy smokes its amazing!! So I was never a red meat eater in my life, I stopped eating meat at 5 years old so a meat burger taste doesn't appeal to me. This burger though is fantastic and my 2 MALE carnivore friends also had their burger and they said "I eat meat and I wouldn't be able to taste the different". Then as time was passing would refer back to how good the burger was and couldn't believe it.  I seriously contemplated about ordering a second one for myself so go try it out!  Other items we ordered and is pictured below is their house made guacamole what Chips & Salsa, they're Impossible empanadas, the vegan relleno (made with quinoa and cauliflower) and there Mexican chocolate sorbet for dessert. Everything was so amazing we asked to see the chef but they had the night off so hopefully they will come across this review.  This is my 2nd time here and both visits did not disappoint. From their delicious vegan food to their friendly service, you won't be disappointed with choosing this Border Grill to dine. My friends visiting said that was the best meal they've had on the trip and worth the walk.  I would also like to mention that our server Candice was also fantastic. She was so upbeat, so happy and so much fun to be around that she really added a lot more pleasure into our dining experience.   Try this spot out! *****

tUX5F-H0DrrUAF6lUfKjjA.text: The location is hard to find... follow signs to convention facilities.  Fantastic and friendly staff.  Fresh and delicious food.   I love this place.

qJ7kXloV9uNJITB1brsw9A.text: My husband and I decided to give this place a try for dinner. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. Great atmosphere. You can sit out on the covered patio overlooking the pool. All that's great but the main attraction is THE FOOD. Fresh ingredients and great recipes! They make their tortilla chips and they are seriously the best tortilla chips I have had in my entire life. I want a to go back I'd like 50 pounds of chips! Comes with three different salsa. All of which are quite good but I found myself eating the chips plain.   I ordered the Poblano chicken enchiladas and they were super good. Great flavor combination. My husband had the chili rellenos duo. They were both super fantastic!! When my husband was done eating he did find a plastic binder in his dish (from the fresh produce). The staff was super embarrassed and apologized so many times. They also removed the item from our check. Even with finding this in his food I still give this place five stars because of how great they handled it (mistakes do happen!) and the food is just that good.
