wcWx4BTmZ_RUmE6vxbvq-g.text: Great dinner made better with free corn tamales for a Yelp check in!  Complimentary chips & salsa were given to us upon sitting down, the salsas were excellent!   Very good shaken margaritas (we tried the lime and the blood orange).  Loved the Avocado ceviche & Peruvian potatoes and Brussels with no chorizo (our choice) - this was such a delicious combination!  Only a few items are truly Vegan but some can be modified.   My partner tried the tres leches cake, it was gross.  Very hard and very little flavour - skip this.  Beyond the cake the only other disappointment was the lengthy delay it took to clear the tables around us.  We were there on a Saturday around 7:30 pm so maybe it was just because they had been so busy earlier.

dOkl4W1USl0uFASfN3oTAQ.text: This place is good if you are not in the mood for a hoity toity restaurant at the Mandalay. You can pretty much taste the freshness with every bite. The meat is tender and the tortillasare made onsite (you can see the ladies making them.)  Mmmmmm. tacos

17MyRP9_97uW-q90oX7NBQ.text: This is the second restaurant by Susan Feniger that we had tried, and again we were not disappointed.  Infact we have been a big fan of Susan ever since we went to her other restaurant in Los Angeles called "Street".   Border Grill is located towards the very back of the Mandalay Bay Hotel.  We went to the Saturday all you can eat brunch and we had a great time.  The endless pomegranate misosa and all the tapas we had tried were fantastic.  The only thing regrettable is that we got so full that we could not get to taste all of them.  It is so much better than your average  "All You Can Eat Buffet"  places that are rampant in the strip. The other thing that we noticed is that in both restaurants, all the servers were well learned of what they are serving and oh so friendly.  They all made us feel as if we were friends visiting for brunch.   Great food and great customer service,  we can not wait to come back to this place the next time we visit Las Vegas

ZFMX_6tLNteLJ3XEOfcbsw.text: Unfortunately, we did not have a good experience dinning here. As hispanics we expect this place to satisfied our appetites with some real mexican food. We ordered fajitas, margaritas, chicken nachos, quest fundido w/chorizo (which came highly recommended by the waiter). All the food was drowned in oil including the chips. We started with the queso fundido and it was just horrible. There was so much oil we literally tasted it once and couldn't continue. The fajitas was also drowned in oil. My husband couldn't even eat the bell peppers because of the amount of oil on them. He only ate 1/2 of his meal, and he is not the type of man that leaves food on his plate. My chicken nachos were so oily that I only ate a 1/3 of it. I paid for that later on that night. I couldn't even enjoy being in Vegas because I spent the rest of the night in the bathroom. I would not recommend if you want REAL Mexican food, especially if you want to enjoy your time in Vegas without running into a restroom. I'm so upset that we wasted $80 on food we didn't eat or enjoy.

yKVlfn8WICCL7yWJw65Hqg.text: The best kept secret and deal in Vegas !!!!! As a frequent visitor to Vegas  and self proclaimed foodie, I have tried every celebrity chef restaurant up and down the strip. This is the jackpot, I do not like mass made food like buffets where food gets overcooked as it sits under heast lamps, here everything is cooked to order and is worth the wait. At 29.99 with an extra $5 for unlimited mimosas, not a better bargain

zYYJ9vXDmOP764lYzP9pew.text: Not good the dessert was really bad ! The food was ok nothing g memorable .. Only good thing about this place is customer service! Won't go again

XiFvroeNHQSKbOwl804r4g.text: Used to be a reliable fave when working here. Positively lousy the other day.  Cold and tasteless.  Time to close

1BJfVVNguDP71PNiNf0s8Q.text: Went to Border Grill Sunday night using a Travelzoo voucher. We were given very limited options not listed on the original voucher. The food was very sub par. I ordered the "spicy" grilled shrimp and received what appeared to be bland, boiled shrimp atop a bed of watery rice. Literally. The rice was floating in broth and greens. My friend was given the suggestion of the seasonal fish, so he ordered it. The waitress failed to mention it was resting in a bowl of soup, despite the 100+ degree weather. The dessert, chocolate pie, was obviously premade thawed, and the drinks were overpriced and boring. The strawberry sangria tastes like Franzia. Overall, the food lacked any substance, as did our waitress, who kept telling us yes, then no, and blaming it on her manager for the night. Not worth even the Travelzoo prices.

9ydNa_SuGtrnFSsncLAn6g.text: We went with a group of 7 to Border Grill on the 4h of July. Our service was excellent, Paris did an amazing job. Food and drinks were good, but nothing amazing. The best part was the server and chips and salsa!

U-E-YBgyqklNQcBGkIGh9A.text: I thought that at lunch today this would be some crappy Mexican food like at Chili's or Baja Fresh but the guacamole seemed very fresh and good and the three tacos I had were amazing.  The server was also very good!  I had low expectations but was impressed.  The server let me mix up my taco selection so I had one shrimp taco, one grilled fish taco and one fried fish taco.  The rice was kinda dry so I left it but I was full after the tacos anyways.

C_etHw4c3M5X0xM96Qi3rg.text: I live In San Francisco and I came here for my Aries weekend bday party and to my surprise I actually loved this place. IThe food was great  differentChef Mike even came out and took a photo w/ us . We loved the empenada's . The cocktails were strong which is a must in Vegas cause you need to have one in your hand at all times. We had a great dining and drinking exp. Would go back in a heartbeat actually I wish I was in Vegas right now with the food and  a drink in hand oh well back to work lol

rjpE_IT5y2ON4_2GEWyEbQ.text: silly me went to the reef aquarium at mandalay bay . which is good . while buying my admission ticket i was given a free coupoun for a free maragretia drink with my dinner. so i was like ok i will try this over priced mexican resturant.  oh snap this place is a rip off. while waiting a long time for my free drink which wasnt very good i ran out of salsa and one of the bus boys aksed me if i want gaucolmole so i said yes thinking it was free dip. like the old saying goes theres a sucker born ever minute and im living proof of that. they hustled me in a resturant . i still cant believe i got coned .   the gaucolmole was $ 9.00 plus tax . my bill came out $ 25.89 including tax . it should of dawned on me why  on a saturday about 6:00 p.m. when i left the place it wasnt crowded and less then  half full. the food was good but not worth double the price of planet hollywood. i said to myself before i even went to this hotel i wasnt going to eat there because its so expensive....   " note to john P.  -------- follow john P.'s advice and eat denny's instead of this highway robbery  "

0vfW9xhW9I6oUESNnmW5LA.text: The good thing about this place is that it's somehow off the beaten path, despite being in the Mandalay Bay. And the food is solid. I had a steak salad and it was very flavorful, although they did dress the salad up a bit too much. If I have a salad the next time I go back (and I will), I'll be sure to ask for the dressing on the side. Also, the chips are yummy, chunky, made fresh in the back type chips, which is always a bonus.

VGFZ6xcMaTr1rew2WU6u7g.text: Salsa was ok. Tomatillo was excellent. Rice and beans were bland. Steak taquitos were good and shrimp not so much. Get over the water charge folks... it is what 'tis. Waitress was tad pushy by upselling us to the moon and i didn't like that. Knife had crusty food on it, they replaced it but still gross.

ilbNd__p0iKPwgSajKc8cw.text: I was just expecting so much better. So, so much better. I honestly can't remember much about the experience except that I think I got fish tacos that were ok, my husbands chile relleno was pretty good but the big thing was the rice that came with it. It was AWFUL. He called it "hotel rice." Cheap, bland rice. It had color, so I think it was supposed to be flavored but, alas, it tasted like nothing. It was a lot of money for mediocre food. There are a lot of places you can spend too much money on food on the strip -- don't do it here.

ZBodQgW9YbIdGEZhrcEGGw.text: Everything was outstanding with our visit to Border Grill.  Read about this in Vegas magazine and was so happy we decided to go here.  My girlfriend was really looking for a good meal with lots of flavor and this didn't disappoint.  We walked from the Wynn to Mandalay Bay to take in Las Vegas on our last night, so definitely worked up an appetite.  The margaritas were very clean and crisp with a hint of spice and paired great with the ceviche sampler that we started with.   After we demolished the delicious starter, we moved on to entrees - she had the Chicken Mole Verde and I went with the Yucatan Pork.  Both were incredibly filling and so very flavorful.  The Chicken was succulent and the pork was just delicious.  We had eaten enough that we didn't dare eat dessert and ended up taking some of our entrees home with us.  The wait staff topped off the experience by being involved, friendly and attentive.  Would highly recommend and plan to go there again when in Vegas.

w16HkJGVT1mudXjLsdOfJQ.text: Great steak salad, didnt like the weird hard tortilla thing it came on but skipped it and enjoyed the rest. The salsa was really tasty, smoky and yummy! The skinny margarita was so delicious, I loved that they had a skinny cocktail option. We went here in a group for a tradeshow and everyone seemed to enjoy their meal!

8HXaUpPT-Q6hzgkSQhQ2lg.text: Went to Border Grill in the Madalay Bay Hotel. We had the lunch salad special-WOW. It was served with chicken, but I asked for Talapia instead and Tom had the chicken. The salad was an amazing blend of hot, sweet, and tart. The salad had slices of nectarines, peaches, grapes and spiced candied walnuts. The service was outstanding and Tom Davis was our waiter. The guacamole is the best and the sparkling peach lemonade was outstanding. We had half a piece of the chocolate pie that had the perfect amount of cinnamon. It would be a place to go again and again. Outstanding.

uDFRPuDcH49jp6juhPb_Kw.text: 3.5 stars  considering this place is in lv...and is one of the top chef master's restaurants..i'll say it wasn't disappointing.   I started off with the homemade white peach lemonade which was really refreshing, with the right amount of sweetness and tartness! so glad i got it.   they give you complementary chips and 3 diff kinds of salsas yayyyy  OH and the seating outside is overlooking the mandalay bay pool area= GORGEOUSSSSS   i got the special of the day: tecate pork torta= satisfying and hearty. generous portion of pork and this kind of cabbage slaw thing with fries sprinkled with some kind of pepper...maybe cayenne? 'twas pricey...but i guess it was worth it.   i would probably come back for happy hour or margheritas  p.s. i tried the food truck in la which i enjoyed...and i know there's a location in santa monica...maybe MAYBE i'll go again

1iSu5f4ElyzMTtKzIGCySg.text: Seriously. Overpriced mediocre food. The yucatan pork was billed as a spice infused pork cooked 8 hours in a banana leaf. One thing was left out-- it also was basted in salt. Wow. Two flavors stood out: cinnamon and salt. The chicken enchiladas were wrapped in a thick tortilla almost impenetrable. The soup was interesting: a stewed tomato taste with subtle heat.  Chips and salsa were fine.  Was expecting more from this place. Too bad. Nice people work there and they do their best to sell the food as upbeat as possible. The food lets them down.

EoUSr_bKmk0eZbZhPDH_Cw.text: WOW! I'm a bit of a foodie and have been disappointed by previous visits to Top Chef restaurants, but not at Border Grill. The food and service were stellar! I was in Vegas for a conference and stopped for lunch, the menu had some inticing items, but what caught my eye was a special of Pork belly tacos. I always love when a chef thinks a little outside the box and offers something to tantalize my tastebuds. Braised pork belly witha spicy bbq type sauce and , I think sesame and pomegranite seeds, topped with a fresh slaw!! Service was spot on and loved that they offered a variety of non-alcohol beverages beyond the standard tea and soda, try the sparkling peach lemonade. I can't wait for my next visit to LV

yWhvXOwAa3bAxQVSgIOq3A.text: Great food and drink.  I had the fish special,  very good.  Sowas the taquitos.  Would go back.  I did for lunch the next day

CoMgevck_9qQyYwYL2dsQA.text: We flew in and arrived in around 2 and I had BG on my list of places.  We (wife and I). Since I am a professional chef and LCB Inatructor, love to get different things so we can sample as much as possible.  Well, so happens the Brunch menu is a nice menu tapas style.  Everything was fresh and VERY Good.  Of you like a texmex kind of thing you will love this.  Only thing, order several things from the start and as soon as you get the order - order some more keep it flowing.  Do this,great place.

cH_G4FiceqC3pq-yFeNViw.text: The food here is actually very good. The girlfriend and I had carnitas and carne asada tacos. Both were really delicious and authentic...the carne asada in particular was very very good. Really tender and well marinated.   Only downsides are really slow, inattentive service and obviously it's way overpriced (but that's expected in Vegas)

_941ZJsnmtz6sriCn13LXw.text: Dropped here after a conference, and it was well worth it. Good food, decent prices, big portions. Sangria & Watermelon soda were yummy, and good guacamole! Really, most of it is bad, this stuff was real. Portions were pretty big; 2 guys got the chicken quesadillas & couldn't finish. I had the ceviche trio, very good flavor.  YUMMY plantains.

nP5ZKEj5DpIQ5AckGz6SJA.text: Was there for workers compensation convention in November week before thanksgiving. Party of four. We had a one hour lunch break. Ordered food that came in 1.5 hours. Food was cold and stale. Will never go back!

NcOkx1SrPOGyQoVVcqwKZQ.text: WOW. WOW. WOW.  The food was seriously amazing.  I loved it.  All of the ingredients made up the perfect meal.  I had the shrimp tacos, which were delicious.  The other people in our party loved their meals too (chicken enchiladas, carnitas tacos).  The service was awesome as well.  The complimentary salsa and chips was great.  You got 3 different salsas, which were all really tasty! Will definitely come back.

Sz3GFUlfRt7UEEtFe2aoHw.text: Guac was amazing!  The charge for their water filtration system is a little off-putting though.  I actually thought about having my wedding reception in their lower level area.  Great food and drinks!

66m7mJ_8MlL0Iis8Oag-IA.text: Really delicious, fresh and filling food. A nice departure from the bland, overdone stuff that a lot of local places serve. I had Peruvian Ceviche, which (although I'm no expert) is a terrific, light and healthy dish. Wife had fish tacos, also very good. Minus 1 star for a little too much salt on everything. But I guess we didn't need that second basket of those yummy chips.

OR8eqE9CFRfvEXNZ2jcMGA.text: First off this restaurant is located next to conference rooms and not so close to the other restaurants. We visited on a Thursday evening and it was dead in the dining room while the bar was full of loud conference attendees. The food is fine, overpriced like much of the restaurants in Vegas, but not outrageous. The problem was the service, the wait staff was just not bothered, even the manager hung out in the bar area. It took forever to get menus and after our meat almost 15 minutes to get the check, which was ridiculous considering there was only three tables and two servers. We won't be back.

Y1VTU6Yyw4cU8objoK3yXA.text: I was lucky enough to go to the Santa Monica Border Grill back in 1995 while I was visiting some friends in L.A., and was blown away by it. I was at a conference in Las Vegas this last week, and I was happy to see that there was an outpost of the Border Grill there as well - of course I had to try it.  I went during lunch one day, and had the guac to start, followed by the chicken chilaquiles. Whenever I am in Mexico, I try to eat chilaquiles for breakfast, so I was pleased to see them on the menu (even though it was lunch time). The chips were cooked well, but were RIDICULOUSLY salty. I though that maybe I had just received a bottom of the basket set (or something like that), so I asked for some new ones, but those were amazingly salty as well. Once I dusted a large amount of salt off the chips, though, they were good, as was the guacamole. The flavors were nicely blended, and they didn't skimp on the onion.  The chilaquiles were a disappointment, though. They were the "green" version (as opposed to red or, more rarely, mole chilaquiles), and the green salsa was very acidic. I like the flavor of tomatillos, but these almost tasted underripe, which made for a weird flavor mix with the queso fresco and the corn tortillas. The chicken in the dish came in big chunks of dry white meat, and didn't taste like it had been cooked with the rest of the chilaquiles ingredients at all.  It was very disappointing. For comparison, I was comped a free breakfast buffet at the Wynn, where they had what they called chilaquiles with eggs (really, it was more like a chilaquiles/migas hybrid) - the flavor profile of that dish was much more authentic than what I had at Border Grill. I know that people think highly of the Wynn buffet, but still, when the food at a restaurant that prides itself on authenticity is beaten by a buffet offering, that's a bad sign.  I'll hang on to my good memories of the Border Grill in Santa Monica, but I won't be going back to the Vegas one again.

J3JBgkPR9D1wnd-zQZiCqg.text: Decent spot, friendly service, nice spin traditional Mexican with things like grilled turkey breast, tropical salsas, etc.  Habanero salsa was very good, hot and flavorful.  I went with the carnitas, tasty and not greasy.  Chips were very good also, nice and thick, stood up to the guac nicely.  Great for lunch during a conference, or getting out of the sun when chilling poolside...wish I was doing the latter when I visited.

AxZWkY19y9vHVSD0IlmXtQ.text: I have been there four times, and I love it.  It's authentic, regional cooking with a creative twist.  I always get a shredded chicken and tortilla casserole that is amazing.    The prices a somewhat higher than other non-hotel related restaurants.  Guess what, you are in a hotel.  Hotel restaurants will always cost more money due to the higher overhead.    The staff were attentive.  Last time, we had a very unattentive server.  This time, we were blessed with an exceptional server.  We appreciated the experience and the food.

qKnQOod4a10IBPTOIfMh_w.text: This is some of the best Mexican food I've had. Love the atmosphere especially in the warmer months when the patio by the pool is open.  This is a must try when visiting Mandalay, a great alternative to the Beach Grill which also serves great American favorites

5g-za6Py7_ZSCkMnKVzYWw.text: Came here for lunch during our trip. The food was great! Everything was yummy and the prices didn't break the bank. We has such a great time....our waitress was so friendly and helpful.

PzR7w4xaILw7Ciw6unJWLA.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review of Border Grill before now.  I have had dinner and just drinks here many times and have enjoyed each time.  My fiance wanted to go to the Wisin & Yandel concert at the beach on Sunday but we didn't buy tickets in time, so we had drinks at Border Grill so we could listen for free.  Clint was our bartender and he made me a wonderful Mai Tai ($12) and then he brought us free chips and salsa (perfect).  We always have wonderful service and I think it has something to do with the women who own this (you can catch each of them on the celebrity chef competitions on TV now & then). Sign up for their locals discount card (free) and emails about specials.  It is worth it.

oRXgSnY7ZfdlO_P-0D5N2Q.text: Wedding Reception at Border Grill = Awesome  We had our wedding reception at the Border Grill at the Mandalay Bay and it was a blast- great food, great drinks, great service all around good time for everyone. We wanted something hip and new and fun and the Border grill definitely provided that. They also provide a coordinator at no charge to help you plan everything from the menu to decorations to music and anything else you want. We worked with Destiny Hampton and she was amazing. Very attentive and helpful. She definitely knows how to plan parties. All of our guests raved about the food and how much fun they had. I highly recommend this as a wedding reception location in Vegas.

XcLCcBBvp65idXOZLyGb7A.text: The food was good but not good enough for more than 3 stars. The best dish was the steak. They make fantastic chips and salsa though. The fish tacos was really good. They give 3 large pieces of perfectly battered fried fish. The yucatan pork was flavorful but some of my pork pieces were dry and hard. The server was exceptional.

TE-GJl8AqygJFzguGzUD8g.text: I watched the two owners of Border Grill on Top Chef Masters and Chef Hunter and wanted to try their restaurant while in Las Vegas last week. The restaurant is very bright and attractive. The chips were outstanding, although my husband did not care at all for the salsa. We split one of the specials - short rib tacos combo plate. It was very tasty and there was plenty of food to share. Service was extremely attentive. I am glad we tried this restaurant

ipgksw3GDH8pFpPbvWKPWw.text: Amazing place to eat! I went with my husband back in March and enjoyed a great meal. The Chef came to our table to talk with us and was really nice. Our waiter,Jason was great and friendly and the manager,Chris could not have been better. I can't say enough great things. From start to finish was wonderful. By FAR the best brunch EVER and one of the best meals we have ever had. Yum! Anytime I am in Vegas I will go back.

sLQyFPvdQHMov9quObzR5Q.text: Hosted my wedding brunch here!!  The staff, food and room was amazing!!!

1aqCrXOYSTKdq3qsd7OYdw.text: Wow the border grill was a great spot for lunch !  Had a chance to chat with the manager/business owner and I can tell that he really cares about the customer experience and quality of food they put out and wanting to make it the best possible for the customer. That is not always the case at a lot of places and I really appreciate that .  I loved the complimentary chips and 3 types of salsa you get when you sit down !!! So good. I also had the  Mexican sandwich with  smoked paprika Fries ! CHICKEN MILANESA.  It was great!  panko crusted chicken breast with oaxacan cheese, avocado, gem lettuce, pickled onion & carrots, lime aioli on telera bread .

NaVPhJje7gcGxeZwMmp9WA.text: Start to finish was some of the worst food I've had in a very long time. Somehow, even their queso (both kinds) was lacking. The plantain empanadas was okay but not particularly flavorful. The Mexican Chopped Salad was decent. The Chicken Poblano Enchiladas was covered in the worst tasting salsa verde. Sorry, but I don't see how this is a Vegas-quality restaurant.  Redeeming factor - servers tried really hard to make the experience better. Quality guys on that front.

A9U_LzEy3p70GxgE7r_9kw.text: Amazing service and food!! We went last night for my birthday and we were blown away.  Amanda was our server and she went above and beyond.  The manager came out a few times to talk to us as well.  The empanada appetizer was amazing and the chicken poblano enchiladas were delicious! Thank you for the great experience and food.  I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3BXdeDTbHvvVHYbTqP2Y9w.text: We came in for lunch today. It was busy but we were able to get a high top at the bar without a wait. They offer a bar, inside seating and covered patio.  I started with the blood orange margarita, which was slightly spicy with a nice blend of peppers and chocolate on the rim. It was a unique and delicious margarita, but worth the 14$ considering it's in Vegas. They brought complimentary chips and trio of salsa. Tortilla chips are freshly fried on site, but not too spicy.  The menu states it's normally 4$ so that was a nice treat. We both had tacos.  They offer steak, shrimp, fish and carnitas, brisket and cauliflower paella (veggie) tacos on corn tortillas server with black beans and rice. They do offer a mix and match which isn't listed on the menu, so be sure to ask for that if you want to try a variety. You can also get flour tortillas. We both ordered fish, steak and shrimp tacos.  The steak and shrimp were my favorite. The steak was topped with onion, cilantro, salsa and avocado cream which blended perfectly with the flavor of the carna asada. The shrimp was really not spicy, and also a nice blend of flavors. The fish was plentiful and cooked well, the other two were just better.  They accidentally brought us a carnita taco, but replaced it quickly with correct tacos. We tried it, and were just average, although meat was nice. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zdPAB7Lo9W2im78mUmOF6w.text: I had to admit, I've walked by this restaurant so many times without blinking and never thought I needed to try the food here.  My coworker wanted to eat here, and so glad we did!   Our server was so friendly and nice and attentive, he made our night.  When we wanted hot sauce with the complimentary chips, with three mild sauces, he sure delivered.  It had to been one of the spiciest hot sauce ever (ghost chiles).    The bean dip (don't eat this before going on a flight) was fantastic with pulled pork on top.  This could be a meal in itself (came with warm tortilla too).   My skirt steak was seasoned so well and cook a perfect medium rare, it was better than the $60+ steaks at other restaurants.  Came with so many sides too, I was beyond stuff.  Kudos to the delicious roasted brussel sprouts with bacon. Yum.   The seafood enchiladas was cooked maybe a tad over, but my colleague thoroughly enjoyed his meal (3 enchiladas).   For dessert, we got the pumpkin flan, per our waiter recommendation.  It was like eating a smooth pumpkin pie.    Highly recommend this place for a more moderately priced restaurant in the Mandalay Bay.  Your wallet and stomach will appreciate that!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skirt steak
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood enchilada $38

mNAlscgsQaDfOn10yzocKg.text: We were craving Mexican food while walking this area of the strip. After the first place we wanted to try was closed we luckily found Boarder Grill! It was deep in the casino. But the long maze was worth it!  We got the chips and salsa which I am not happy unless I get this when getting Mexican. Their chips were so amazing!!! The trio of salsa were good, though I personally love chunkier salsa. The guacamole was good!!! We both got the steak tacos, they were yummy though I felt like it needed something extra. The beans and rice were very good!!   Delicious patron margarita!  They have the cutest plates!!! And the decor is awesome and fun!!!  Every one was great! Our server was helpful!  I am happy that we ended up here!  Ask for their hot sauce, it's more like a salsa but so good, and the right amount of heat!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FzfJSElpLYWR2yPiG5zm8Q.text: I had no idea they served brunch here until my friend took me. Holy smokes, this is so much better than a buffet! The price point is better and the food selection surpasses the Bayside Buffet in Mandalay. We came on a Saturday morning and were seated immediately, outdoors by the pool area. It was a really nice view and thankfully the sun was out.  It's AYCE with plates served tapas style, so you just have to pace yourself so you can indulge your inner glutton. Our server was amazing - he took excellent care of us and made sure we got the full experience of the vast menu. We ate damn near everything on the brunch menu and and enjoyed all of it. The stars were the campechana, chilaquiles, steak & egg, and the breakfast tots. We had multiple orders of these items. The bread pudding and cinnamon roll pancakes were divine. I honestly cannot stop thinking about their food. It was that good.    For the price, this cannot be beat. The food, service, quality and overall experience was worth 5 stars and I have every intention of returning with my kids when we visit Vegas in March.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And this is how it ended.. the bread pudding and cinnamon roll pancakes were the stars of this ensemble
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And so it began.. sooo yummy!!!

QBRPvq08ncPtaIhiLOHiJA.text: This was our first official meal in Vegas. With the ratings I expected a little more out of this restaurant. For starters the complementary chips and salsa was pretty good. I love when Mexican restaurants bring you complementary chips and salsa! Every Mexican restaurant needs to do this. The tomatillo (green), smoked salsa and the mild salsa were all very tasty in my opinion. Smoked salsa isn't something I have experienced too often, but I didn't mind it.   For my meal I ordered the carnitas tacos ($17). The corn taco shells were on the smaller side and they give you 3 of them. I was pretty disappointed in my tacos. The carnitas needed drained a little before throwing them on the taco shell. The taco shells were so soggy due to this. They give you two sides rice and black beans. The rice was on the dry side so I didn't eat much of that. I did like the black beans though. The prices are pretty steep for the quality of the food in my opinion.   The service was very slow. We were finished eating for what seemed like 15 to 20 minutes and waited for our checks. I can't say that it was because they were busy because they were in between lunch and dinner. Our server walked past our table multiple times and could clearly see we were finished but obviously he wasn't in a hurry to get us on our way.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas

wATpOw1YOvd1Ii-eXCjRhQ.text: Im not a huge fan. I was expecting a side of rice and beans with everything. You don't get rice and beans with everything....It was okay. Son and I both had chicken enchiladas...the chicken was basically a paste of chicken in dry corn tortillas - not the best texture. I found the mushrooms on top to be an odd addition but fancy mushrooms, none the less.   Husband had Yucatan pork, he said it was yummy. He got a big portion of pork and he had rice and beans! Daughter had a side of rice and a side of beans for $10. I think the disappointment of this place is the price when you know how cheap beans, rice and tortillas are.   Chips and guac were yummy - but I've had just as yummy at el pollo loco for 1/2 the price.   For a large portion of slow cooked pork and chicken paste, I don't think this place is worth the hype or the price.

izIc41N7QwlbApbaYPXydg.text: It was ok .service was great Brian is very profesional  But the guacamole was bland ,first it was to  spiced up   then the second try was to bland had no taste . The fish tacos where good portion but needed a bit more flavor to over come the fishy taste . For being in Vegas and in the Mandalay Bay I expected way more .

8L21N2Tiw9EoK87WpmRSjQ.text: I went to this restaurant not reading any reviews, but my husband did the quick research.  While walking through the hotel, trying to find the place, I noticed an ad about the chef and she starred on the show Top Chef.  I admit, I was being judgmental for a split moment- thinking it was going to be a nose turned up place.  This restaurant appeared to be 20% filled and we were asked twice if we had reservations. Can someone please explain this to me?  Either way, we were seated immediately, water came along with free fresh chips and 3 variety of salsa. Say, que? Oh yes, the tortilla chips were fresh and the salsa were all mild spice to my liking.  The server offered a spicier version as an option, but we just stuck with the initial offerings.  The tacos were stellar, filled with large chunks of fish and definitely well worth the reasonable price tag of $18 for 3 tacos.  The right amount of cabbage, picked radish, avocado and the star was the seasoned fish.  With a quick yelp check-in deal, we got free green corn tamales to try. Accompanied with sour cream and a acidic version of the pico de gallo, this was a great compliment to this very sweet treat.  Make no mistake, this is not your average Mexican food joint. The food was excellent and it will surprise you.

N8KKaVQ8ZXM4pnqjcvg5sA.text: Went there for dinner Saturday night and was expecting good food & at least an ok margarita.  Was disappointed on all counts except for the hostesses.  Service was barely ok but the food was way below average.  Don't waste your money here

uQbM5-YL6w5TebV92ZYk6A.text: Best brunch in town by far. Ask for Adam! He was super attentive, knowledgeable, and personable. We'll be back for sure. I'd eat pig slop there as long as Adam served it to me.

DSfCYdvmFg2OPRQY3I_tsQ.text: I've eaten here a bunch and every time I come back love this place more!  I've done their Sunday Brunch a couple of time, lunch and today was my first time for dinner....all absolutely A-maze-ing!!  Tonight, our party of 4 were seated promptly upon our arrival and immediately greeted with chips & salsa and waters. Our waiter, Jeffrey, stopped by and took our appetizer order (Border Guacamole) and drinks. For the entrees we ordered: Border Ceviche - so fresh and flavorful, Yucatan Pork cooked in banana leaves have it amazing depth and just a hint of sweetness, Brisket Taquitos were crispy on the outside but deep flavor on the inside and the Vegan Vegetable Paella with cauliflower and beets was just the right amount of spice. Everything was perfectly cooked, unbelievably flavorful and beautifully presented. Not enough space to cover how great our meal was.   You're going to love this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Taquitos were crispy and the meat was fall-aparty!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Border Ceviche was served on fried plantains and was SO fresh and flavorful!
Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Paella (vegan) with cauliflower, beets, Spanish peppers and green onions...spicy!

lka2dLCy6BsDWOrc-cA9fQ.text: We love this brunch!  I got married yesterday and I knew I wanted to have a bing brunch the morning of  the wedding.  We had 14 people and we had great service! The food was awesome, they brought most of the brunch items out family style and they kept the food and drinks coming.  They put us on the patio which was comfortable but got a little toasty by 12:30 but we liked being out there.   This is a stop we make every time we are in town. I highly recommended it. For the price the service, atmosphere, and food can't be beat

8Zjo2XjQSp1q0cUn4wGSGg.text: Came here with a group of 8 for the bottomless border brunch (meaning you can order as many items off the menu as you want as many times as you want for the set price of $38.99). We also added the bottomless mimosas for $15 extra. So it may be a little on the pricey side but over all the food was pretty good. It's brunch with Mexican influence. If you look on the website, you can download the menu. But we had all of the food options available on the menu. Some of the better items were the torta sliders, the spicy chicken tamales, the tres leches bread pudding, the eggs benedict, the chilaquiles, and the secret menu item for the day, which was some sort of beef hash with fries. The sliders had a sweet taste to them and the spicy chicken tamales were soooo good but they had quite the spicy kick to them. I would probably say that i was least impressed with the chicken and waffles and the chorizo pigs in a blanket. The chicken and waffles had more of a strawberry syrup which I didn't care for. And the chicken was nice and cripsy, but had no flavor to it. The other thing I was really hoping for was the chorizo pigs in a blanket. Chorizo for me is always packed with flavor and maybe a little spicy, but this had no kick and almost resembled just a regular hot dog. Lastly, the mimosas were pretty good. They leave the bottle on the table for you so you can pour as much as you want (which I prefer) and they gave us several flavors to try. Apart from the food, the service was excellent, the people serving us were super friendly and quick with the champagne when we asked. Apart from a few sub par menu items, I would recommend this place!

Pros:  Plantain empanadas Chips and salsa Fish tacos with the coleslaw salsa The art and decor in the restaurant  Servers are very attentive   Overall, I am glad I didn't give up on finding this place. Don't know if they got rid of it but found one in Vegas that was easy to get to vi Mandalay Bay.

RXvgXXUEKe4ilt8Qaa8Haw.text: Very mediocre. My meal was quite good but server messed up multiple things- and he wasn't a Vegas meth head - just not good at his job. Forgot to bring two items and got daughters meal wrong. My wife had shrimp mole and the shrimp come unpeeled in a thick mole sauce so one gets to pick it out to remove the shell and get sauce all over your hands. I hadn't seen an adult wash their hands after dinner in quite awhile. They also charge for  tap water which they bring regardless. Overall not very good.

sm8xjJsndnAWaGPxqvI-MA.text: Came here initially for just chips and salsa but wound up getting a couple appetizers as well ... including a few things we didn't ask for or plan on having. We were given two orders of the Yelp check-in despite not checking in at the time and an order of guacamole (server's mistake.)  After we saw a few of the vegan small plate options, we ordered a few: the empanadas and taquitos. The taquitos were good and all, but the empanadas were ridiculous. Nicely spicy, awesomely seasoned, and I just wish I had more. The Cadillac margarita we each got was one of the better ones I has in Vegas, too. The chips and salsa were okay, but easily the worst thing we had. The guacamole we got by accident was tasty though -- that I would buy next time.   They don't have vegan brunch options at this Border Grill, but they do at the one in LA. Our bartender told us a former chef came back in January and came up with some vegan options, which was awesome -- there aren't many vegan choices on the south end of the Strip.  TL;DR: Vegan empanadas and guacamole. Get on that.

aJxrT3zM8XMZrgKpxh-hlw.text: Great service. We had guacamole, black beans, enchiladas, the chile relleno duo, and brisket taquitos among the four of us. Everything was good. My enchiladas came in a deep green sauce that is not your typical salsa verde, and had charred vegetables on top. One of the chile rellenos was a typical breaded and fried, cheese-stuffed pepper, while the other was grilled and stuffed with vegetables.  The drinks did not disappoint. The standard margarita was right on. The blood orange margarita was not too sweet, like many flavored margaritas. It tasted like real fresh fruit, plus some heat, and had a mole rim.  For dessert, they gave us complementary salted chocolate chip cookies for my friend's birthday. They were warm and gooey, just fantastic. We also ordered arroz con leche, which was subtle and tasty, with fruit inside.   I look forward to trying one of their locations in LA.

wrIuS3ATCNA3pkHKUAp82Q.text: Had brunch with 10 girls on a Saturday morning.   Where shall we begin... There is a brunch menu where you spend about $35 for unlimited dishes. There is also a regular menu for other options as well.   Almost everyone chose the $35 option, and 2 people ordered from the set menu. My friend chose the torta and I ordered the tostada. We ordered bloody Mary's, coffee, etc as well.   The food was mediocre. Nothing special at all. My tostada was mushy because it probably got soggy after sitting in the kitchen for so long. The torta was so meh. No flavor. The bread was useless because it was so plain and flavorless.   All the food was arriving in order from the unlimited menu option. However, the 2 separate orders were extremely late. As in 45 minutes. As in the waiters had to check if she actually put in the order. Twice. To a point where we didn't even want them anymore.   Everyone had eaten and my friend and I were still waiting on our food.   Thennnnn the check came. We asked the waitress (I think her name was Tiffany) if she could separate the orders based on who got the $35 option and who got a separate dish. And no. She couldn't.  So one of the girls had to separate all the charges based on each person.  Also, the gratuity was not included for such a large party- so weird.

OthAlnN9NyPlNZpPsGrPlQ.text: 3.5 stars  Good food, but kinda pricey. We went to Border Grill randomly since we were staying at the Mandalay Bay and wanted to grab a quick dinner. It honestly reminds me of El Torito Grill or any other Mexican restaurant that's on the fancier end. We went on a Sunday night around 7pm and found it decently full, but with no wait. Keep in mind this was Labor Day weekend too. We weren't looking for a full-on meal and most of their dishes were $20+ so we ended up ordering the baja ceviche ($15) and the carne asada quesadilla ($19). Both were tasty, but a little too pricey for what you're getting, which is not much, in my opinion. I know it's Vegas and it's a very nice restaurant so I can't really blame them, but I doubt I will return. It's just Mexican food. I can get both dishes for cheaper and tastier elsewhere.  The two highlights were the complimentary chips and salsa (they give you 3 different sauces) and the service. Our waiter was nice enough to even pack our leftover chips and salsa, which was awesome. Not really a must if I'm ever in Vegas again, but Border Grill is good and would make a nice date place so it's a solid 3.5 stars in my book.

W2ylYU2V3ZNakUgbQGnlog.text: Haven't been here in years, but remembered how amazing the food was.  Had a quiet dinner with a small group, and border grill didn't disappoint.  Fast service, very clean, good food, and very pleasant employees.   Everyone wore a smile.  The paintings on the wall were a little meager for being in such a high end hotel on the strip (Mandalay Bay), but nothing I can hold against them.    SECRET MENU*. As far as the food goes; the waitress informed us of a burrito on their secret menu.   Short rib burrito, black beans, cilantro rice, avocado and dressed in a sauce that is addicting!  Ask them what's on their secret menu for the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Secret menu

rN2MQHRGLwlgTt2j0woL4Q.text: Sunday Brunch offers unlimited/all you can eat tapas for roughly $35 and all you can drink mimosas for $10.  My girlfriends and I came here today for Sunday Brunch. We were greeted right away and seated outside. A day for brunch in the middle of November in Las Vegas called for good weather, luckily. Or server was very knowledgeable of the menu and knew every single flavor of mimosas (impressive).   The mimosas came in flavors such as passion fruit, pomegranate, raspberry lime, apple caramel cinnamon, blood orange, orange, etc. Our personal favorite was the pomegranate mimosa!  The tapas were good but nothing too special. I was impressed with few dishes. But the ones that I absolutely LOVED were: shrimp and grits, steak and eggs, and the eggs benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Border Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tapas-sized carne asada fries topped with fried egg

QVvK608f6HclwPHOn6h1RA.text: Great Food with even better service!!!  I can't think of a better place to get authentic tacos than at the Border Grill. Their $20 Monday all you can eat Tacos are simply amazing.

N1Hdi0mqptglun8LR0lI9Q.text: I got the "trio of quinoa" salad and my friend ordered beans and rice with a side of food poisoning.   The trio of quinoa is just lettuce with dressing sprinkled with 8 pieces of quinoa. The beans and rice with a side of food poisoning is beans and rice followed by six hours in the bathroom.   The wine is good but overpriced.

xZbW_UXMmU3_jBQqYD0LsA.text: ***Like many restaurants in Las Vegas, Border Grill is a multiple-location restaurant; while it might not be the most original Vegas dining experience, the kitchen does a good job of churning out quality food with great consistency not found at many big brands on The Strip***  Las Vegas, especially The Strip, is filled with second location restaurants from big name chefs. Border Grill in Mandalay Bay is one of them. Several of these restaurants are disappointing especially due to how it feels like quite a few Vegas kitchens are phoning it in because they are going to get a big customer base regardless of the quality. Border Grill is not that way though.  Border Grill features upscale Mexican cuisine, and while it may not elevate Mexican cuisine to justify the high price point, food is prepared with consistency here. My lunch started with a complimentary basket of hearty and crunchy tortilla chips. The chips came with a trio of sauces with two of them being surprisingly spicy for somewhat mainstream Mexican cuisine.  For my entree, I had their chile relleno, which I enjoyed quite a bit. The roasted poblano was filled with a really good, thick and stretchy Mexican cheese. The poblano was nicely cooked and flavorful. The outside crispy crust was good and not too greasy. The chile relleno came with sides of two kinds of rice and really good pureed black beans topped with Mexican cheese.  For dessert, I had their salted chocolate chip cookies with condensed milk ice cream. Of all the restaurants I have ever been to, this was probably the best bang-for-the-buck dessert I have ever had. At $6, the dessert included not 1, not 2 but 5 large salted chocolate chip cookies. And the cookies were delicious. They were fresh out of the oven and were nicely crisp on the outside and soft on the inside with warm and gooey chocolate chips (perfect chocolate flavor).  The cookies were accompanied by two generous scoops of condensed milk ice cream. The ice cream was very creamy and not icy, and it delivered on its name by really getting across the condensed milk flavor with every spoonful.  Service was friendly and quick.  Their lunch prices vary. Some items like the chile relleno are priced about right given that it is Vegas, but some of their more entree-dishes are in the high-$20s range and are probably not worth the high price tag.  In terms of the decor, Border Grill is okay. It is far away from the casino (near the convention center at Mandalay Bay) so you do not get the disturbance of cigarette smoke like you do at several other casino restaurants. Border Grill offers both indoor dining and an outdoor (and covered) patio.  Border Grill is a good spot for a satisfying and slightly upscale lunch. I have been to the Border Grill in Los Angeles, and it is about on par with this location. While Border Grill is known for serving upscale Mexican cuisine, several would say that Border Grill does not warrant their high prices. I would agree on that point to a certain extent. Rick Bayless' Chicago-based restaurants (especially Topolobampo) truly elevates Mexican cuisine by integrating hard-to-find Mexican ingredients and churning out moles of incredible complexity. Border Grill does not come close to that. But judging Border Grill on just what it really is, which is an upscale restaurant with Mexican flavors, it is a worthwhile lunch spot in Las Vegas--especially if you find yourself at Mandalay Bay, which is quite far from other notable Vegas casinos.  I noticed that Mandalay Bay no longer offers complimentary self parking. I imagine it is because they struggle to secure parking for their hotel guests during busy times. It is kind of a nuisance given how almost every hotel on The Strip offers complimentary self parking.

7cHJxUVK_CYSQt47fpuArg.text: Food and salsa was very good. Nice atmosphere,  prices are reasonable . Would definitely recommend

VokvuoW9VYWLwxSf3IppIg.text: Private Event: Could not be happier!   Destiny, Autumn, and their team were absolute rock stars. Destiny helped me change the room at the last minute and Autumn helped me plan through the setup and decorations, listening to my requests but also giving her own feedback and ideas to make the event the best it could be. Once it started she stayed in close communication with me about our numbers and how close we were to the minimum. As servers, Autumn, Crighton, Jose, and Candice were all courteous, hard working, and did an excellent job of communicating with our guests about the drinks and food options. They also made sure to bring me drinks and food at the registration desk (It's easy to get forgotten as the Event Planner!) The real ice cream on top (pun very much intended) was that when Autumn noticed that we were nearing the end of the event without having hit our food and beverage minimum she spoke with the chef who was able to give us some mini ice cream cones(which we hadn't ordered.) It sounded like this worked out because there was some left over from an earlier order, but the fact that they thought of it and put it to use for us without blinking an eye is, in my opinion, the hallmark of awesome service.  All in all I couldn't be happier with the Border Grill team, and will be planning as many events as I can there in the future (I already signed up for the same time slot next year!)

pEOoHD7c7ZcUJJZKgUkctg.text: Very friendly staff, quick service too, was sat right away and the moment my plate was done or my water done, any waiter passing by would stop and assist. Those cookies: to die for! And that condensed milk ice cream was superb!

v_r-pTr7_p0uZYwM0T7wjA.text: I read that Border Grill had one of the best brunches in Las Vegas. So decided to check out the Mandalay Bay location for their Border Brunch. For $35, you get unlimited made-to-order tapas. It's really a great deal! First off though, finding Border Grill was a bit of a pain. It's really deep within the resort, basically near the pool area. If you're coming in from the monorail, basically keep walking past the casino and through restaurant row. You'll know you're on the right path if you pass Aureole and then eventually you'll see signs pointing to Border Grill. It was a beautiful day outside, so I decided to so sit at their Patio. Even though I had a reservation, I opted to sit at the bar since the table they provided me had too much sun shining down on it. But let's get on to the Border Brunch. They provide you with a menu of about 22 dishes to order and you basically order anything you want. For a solo diner, they recommend ordering two at a time and four to five dishes at a time if you're with a group. Here in chronological order is what I ordered: Empanada with Cinnamon Butter -- bit.ly/1SxW5oq This was like an amuse bouche and came with the Border Brunch. Tomatillo Egg Benedict -- bit.ly/1BtOm6v Cornmeal battered tomatillo, hominy grits, epazote hollandaise, roasted tomato, baked kale This was a good dish to start with. Fried green tomato with a nice runny egg on top. Delicious!!! Breakfast Fries -- bit.ly/1TCYAHA Beer braised short rib, manchego cheese, bacon, sunny side egg This was very dish but I'm glad I got to try this. It's a breakfast poutine essentially since you have cheese, short ribs, and a runny egg. This is probably a dish better suited for a group to share because, even though this was only my 2nd dish, I was already starting to get full. Serrano Ham Waffle -- bit.ly/1K1R5H7 Manchego cheese, maple syrup, butter I liked this! It was a good combination of sweet and savory. Peruvian Shrimp and Grits -- bit.ly/1IpX4Qk Aji panca salsa, roasted green chile, creamy parmesan grits Ordering this seafood dish was a good way for me to get my money's worth out of the $35. The shrimp was cooked nicely and had a very nice kick to it with the chile. A very unique take on shrimp and grits. Oyster Taco -- bit.ly/1ewZ4iE Cornmeal battered oyster, flour tortilla, pickled chayote, tomato, buttermilk aioli At this point, I was pretty stuffed but I still wanted to try more. This oyster taco is really about the size of a street taco so it was only a few bites, but that was more than enough for me. I really enjoyed it! Churro Tots -- bit.ly/1GxS79Z Dulce de leche infused churros, cinnamon sugar, chocolate ganache, passion fruit puree From the beginning, I already planned on ordering this last since it's pretty much like a dessert. As small as these tots were, they were pretty dense but had good flavor. The two sauces worked well with them. Overall, I thought the $35 AYCE tapas Border Brunch was worth it. But I was really limited to my stomach capacity since I only got try 6 dishes out of the 22. I highly recommend coming with a group if you plan to try all 22 dishes. As for Border Grill, it's a really nice restaurant! It's a nice take on upscale Tex-Mex food similar to Mesa Grill. I did visit the other location at the Forum Shops which I'll review later, but I like this location a lot better, especially if you can snag a table outside. I would definitely love to come back again to them for dinner.
